Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bridget N
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome with my 14 and 12 year old to see the sites and to see the Pope over Easter. We loved our stay at Hotel Campo De Fiori. I want to come back and will not think twice to stay here again. They were so helpful for me. I loved the roof top terrace and so central we could walk every where! Very quite! We will return soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “average apartment”
Reviews.Author: DubaiJanine
Reviews.Content: Our apartment was on the first floor of a small building near the hotel. It was very noisy and quite dark. The ceiling in the bathroom dripped water from time to time. Small extras normally present in hotel rooms such as decent shampoo samples and a box of tissues would have made a difference. For almost 300 euros a night I also expected that they would wash the few cups and glasses we used in the kitchenette. It was ok, but I wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank T
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo de' Fiori is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Located in a central location to all the sights in Rome, it has a rooftop terrace with a spectacular 360 degree view of this beautiful city. Our room was cozy and charming, with a very comfortable bed and plenty of space, while our bathroom was modern with all the amenities. Rooms were extremely clean and quiet, even though we were close to the noise of the outdoor piazza and late night restaurants. I cannot say enough about the staff - they were friendly and helpful, and offered suggestions for restaurants and places to visit, as well as easy-to-follow directions when needed. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sightseeing and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Roy W
Reviews.Content: Efficient and friendly staff. Superb roof-top terrace giving 360 degree view of The Eternal City. Numerous excellent restaurants within walking distance. Will certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: suzie0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect, right in the middle of Rome within walking distance of everywhere. The hotel staff were so helpful. The palce was clean and well cared for. Can't praise it enough, would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for seeing Rome!”
Reviews.Author: steve m
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to see that we were walking distance from most of the major sights and piazzas in Rome and were there a total of eight days. Although the room was a bit small and dated, the bathroom was modern and sparkling clean. There is a wonderful three tier rooftop terrace above the fifth floor for viewing Rome and your surroundings. We enjoyed the fine bakery as well as a wine shop and outdoor restaurants on the square in the evening and a full farmers market during the day. There is a convenient bus stop a few blocks away and the front desk can help you figure out a route if you don't want to walk. The breakfast room was quite pleasant and plentiful with gracious staff. We had no issues with noise from the square in the evenings. I believe that the windows are dual paned. A few things that weren't great-The room would have been too warm in the summer and we only had one day that we could have used the air conditioning and were not able to get it to work and the lighting in the room was too dim for reading, even during the day, so we had to go to the lobby area or terrace to plan our days. Overall, the price seemed high for quality of room, but the location and general ambience of the neighborhood made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dark and rather unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Johannes2011
Reviews.Content: Attracted by the website we chose Campo de Fiori hotel for our 5 days stay in Rome. As we came with our 2 kids they offered us an appartment next to the hotel. As we learned very soon, the appartment had little to do with the rest of the hotel. Even on a sunny day it was so dark that you needed all electric lights switched on. But the worst was the noise. Just outside are two popular bars where people were hanging out every night until very late. Even through the closed windows you could hear every word spoken. Difficult to sleep! The service was rather cold, not cordial like in the many other places where we had been staying in Italy. Also, we had ordered an Italian-speaking private tour guide in order to visit Caracalla bathes and Catacombs. Instead we got an English guide who wanted to show us the Colosseum... All in all not a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Drab and not even in the same building as the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SandySNewYork
Reviews.Content: I had no idea that when I booked that I would be staying at a drab walk-up quite a distance away from the hotel. I stayed on the 3rd floor of this walk-up and in the morning had to carry all our suitcases and carry-ons down ourselves because, yes, it's true, the "bellman" don't start until 8am. As an Italian-American, I've been to Rome probably a dozen times if not more. This was by far the worst experience I had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in one of the apartments that the hotel has close to Campo de’ Fiori. The apartment was clean, secure and well appointed. It was up several flights of stairs and there are bars in the area which operate at night but, for us, these are part and parcel of being in a charming old city, built before elevators were even thought of, in a central city location and indeed part of the "buzz" of Roman life. Luckily these did not, for us, spoil the experience. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful and the roof terrace of the hotel is just great. The area around Campo De’ Fiori was recommended by friends and it could not have been better, both as a central location base and for the number of restaurants and bars nearby. The apartment offered flexibility to eat in if we wanted to after a day’s walking, to buy breakfast from the baker in the square to eat with freshly made coffee in the morning, and on some days to come back for lunch and a short rest before setting off for the afternoon. We walked everywhere that we went in Rome as nowhere seemed more than 30 minutes maximum from the hotel/apartment and so timing was totally within our control. This was our first trip to Rome; we will be back and the first hotel/apartments that we check for availability will be the Hotel Campo de’ Fiori. In short, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SteveAli_12
Reviews.Content: As first timers to Rome we don't think we could have done better than Hotel Campo de Fiori. We were in the main hotel, 2nd floor, quiet room. Good bathroom, plenty of clothes space, comfy bed. The rooftop terrace is fabulous - you can get out of you room without heading back into the hustle. And the views! Staff were fabulous, Gabriele and Valentina helped us out with some travel bookings and restaurant suggestions. Easy to get to all the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 7 night stay in Rome and Campo was a perfect choice. Friendly staff and cosy feel is just what we like. Rooms are small but excellently furnished. Very clean too - the maid was excellent. Breakfast is typical buffet style, with meats/cheese/scrambled eggs/cereals and so on. All ver tasty. Location was perfects and we were able to walk everywhere we needed to. We booked a top floor room with a private terrace (602) and was perfect! If we return to Rome this is where we would stay. This is a beautiful small hotel - strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Antique decor (the good kind) and a great roof terrace.”
Reviews.Author: CassR84
Reviews.Content: The service staff were friendly and pleasant. We ha just booked a standard room being on our honeymoon and on a fairly tight budget. The hotel upgraded our room to a deluxe suite in order to provide us with a nice view like we asked. The room was gorgeous and had some antique furniture in the room adding to the beautiful decor. The bed was comfortable and we slept well both nights we were there. The breakfast buffet provided us with many choices and made fresh hot chocolates and coffees each morning. A MUST FOR ALL WHO STAY THERE: go up and have a look at the roof terrace. It is set up beautifully and offers a great view of the city. I would definitely go back there in the future and I recommend it to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyrose
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night stay at the Campo De'Fiori and the best I can say is that I'm thankful we only stayed one night. There were six of us and rather than reserve 3 rooms, we opted instead for 2 3-person apartments. What a mistake. My apartment was directly across the street from the hotel. The building was very old (which typically in a city in Rome would be fine, but this lacked any old world charm). The front door to the building is marred with graffiti. There is no elevator so bags have to be carried up the stairs, The apt. was very dark, outdated and, after dark, extremely loud. Right below our windows, are bars and restaurants that are terribly loud until the early morning hours. The apartment was very hot and we wanted to keep the windows open (since we couldn't figure out how to turn the heat down) but the noise, and lack of screens, prohibited that. The glare from the outdoor lights was also a problem but since the windows lacked shades, the only way to keep the light out is to close the shutters, resulting in a very dark room in the morning. Oh yes, the accommodation for the third person in this apartment is an extremely uncomfortable cot in the main room of the apartment. My sister's apartment was across the piazza, down the street and up 3 flights. While her apartment was updated, the building lacked an elevator and was also extremely loud at night. The lack of an elevator was a problem on Sunday morning when we left since there is no hotel staff available until after 8:00 a.m. to help with the bags. They had to carry 5 bags down 3 flights of stairs. The bottom line is that we paid for a hotel experience. What we got was, in my mind, a bait and switch. Dumpy apartments, separate from the hotel, without any hotel amenities at all. In re-reading some of the ratings on this site, I'm amazed to read that there is a rooftop terrace and food available. We were not told about any of this. I would NEVER recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome as it should be”
Reviews.Author: harngtngrp
Reviews.Content: The old city of Rome represents the place to stay for any first time visitor and Hotel Campo De Fiori offers a premier esperience in Roman hospitality and comfort. Combining a charming modern yet authentic architecture with ample, well appointed rooms, the hotel is both authentically boutique in an old world sense but fully functional. Most important, the service is superb. The staff displays a genuine interest in their turata, neve fails to' anticipate all needs and offers a great introduction to the esperienze of Rome. The complimentary breakfast, spotless housekeeping and consistnt ospitalità male the hotel a first choice for any stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: GMcK83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my girlfriend for 4 nights in late March - had a lovely stay. The hotel is perfectly situated in central Rome and is walking distance to all major tourist sites (20 mins to Colosseum, 25 mins to Vatican, etc). The hotel also has a fantastic roof terrace that looks over the rooftops of the City - the hotel is happy for guests to bring their own drinks to the rooftop, which is a nice way to end a day of site seeing. Due to the age/location of the building, the bedrooms are quite small but are well equipped with modern bathrooms. Due to the roof terrace and number of sites in the local area, not much time is spent in the rooms meaning the size is definitely adequate for most. The staff were very helpful and friendly, recommending good restaurants and organising a taxi in advance to pick us up from the airport. The breakfast was ample, but the friendly lady serving could have done with a bit more assistance as she had to refill juices, clear tables, take tea/coffee orders, etc all by herself - she coped well but sometimes there was a bit of a wait due to the lack of support. However, i realise there are cost implications re this and it was a minor downside to a great overall experience. Overall, would definitely recommend. Location is fantastic and staff go out of there way to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: lulu12Brookline
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights by myself in March and wish I had stayed longer, my friends stayed at another hotel close to the Termini. Stayed at room 102 and loved it. The size, the decor the appropriate lighting in the bathroom (very hard to find in a any hotel). I read reviews saying the top floors are better but I thought it was great to have easy access to the stairs to go to the breakfast room and to the lobby . The elevator is quite small. Rooftop has amazing views at all times especially at sunset with a glass of Chianti. I love the decor. Location was perfect, you could walk to almost all sites from there. Breakfast was great, Maria makes a wonderful capuccino and handles well the demands of guests who are not used to wait 5 minutes for their coffee. The best part of all is the wonderful staff! Very efficient, friendly, accommodating and beautiful! Barbara and Valentina were amazing, kind and gave me great advice for restaurants and shops. Andrea, called a restaurant to make sure they had risotto that night because I mentioned that I wanted to eat that. Gabriel went to the market to find me to tell me that my car (that they booked to take me to the airport and I highly recommended) was a few minutes early and if I wanted to go he was ready for me. I travel often and can easily say that I can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jholfel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 5 days in August while visiting Rome. We were (and still are) absolutely in love with this hotel. Because we planned to walk just about everywhere in Rome, this hotel offered the perfect location to the Trevi fountain, Colosseum, the Vatican etc. We also loved walking out of the hotel in the mornings and visiting the coffee shop across the street and the piazza for some fresh fruit directly from the market. The afternoon we arrived (tired and jet lagged), we were able to unpack, shower and walk a few steps out the door and get some fabulous Carbonara in the piazza while families and friends played and relaxed! It was truly an Italian experience. In addition to the excellent location, the rooms were great. We had a double/queen sized bed and separate bath. We loved the decor - it was very "Roma". The room and bathroom was very clean. There was a flat-screen TV and alarm clock and a window over looking the terrace. It was the perfect room to unwind after a long day touring Rome. The staff was very nice and offered many times to schedule tours and reservations for us. They gave us great suggestions of traditional eateries that were off the beaten "tourist" path. I truly believe that they would have done just about anything for us! We spoke very little Italian and the staff was so accommodating with their English. We found the price to be very reasonable considering the location and room appointments. As a side note, we flew into Rome airport and took the train into Rome city. We then attempted to walk the mile or so to the hotel, but found it too confusing and the neighborhoods a little unnerving. In the end, we hailed a taxi and were there in 5 minutes. I would recommend a taxi from the train station to the hotel. For me, the best recommendation is one who states they will stay at the hotel again - and we absolutely will. We will stay here again and again on our next trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: RichJ19
Reviews.Content: During a recent two week trip to Italy, including 7 days in Rome, this was by far the best hotel of all! Fantastic attention to detail in the hotel, luxury throughout and a roof top terrace with incredible views ranging from St. Peters Cathedral to Palazzo Venezia! We stayed in two of the rooms on the top floor (6th floor), which I highly recommend if your budget allows. However, all of the rooms have access to the rooftop terrace so if your budget dictates a room on a lower floor, no worries. The location is perfect! The adjacent plaza (Campo De Fiori) has a wonderful daily market and numerous dining options are a very short walk away. This hotel is very close to Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and is an easy walk to Trastevere. We even walked from the hotel to the Borghese gallery, but admittedly that is a long walk (but well worth it). We will definitely stay here again if we return to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but with some issues”
Reviews.Author: layton1837
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in March ,would have stayed 4 nights but extra night was 560 euro's ,more that the 3 night stay combined. When we arrived we were allocated room 103 (standard room) The room was very dark due to very heavy curtains covering a small window. The lights were required at all times .As it was 20c + in Rome we opened the window to gain some air, The window opened onto a small quadrant ,which was the height of the hotel, no view at all, when the window was opened all we could hear was the constant rumble of a fan which was unbearable. We tried the air conditioning but all we could get was the heating mode. which was set to a minimum of 19c. We complained at reception and they explained that the air conditioning had not yet been switch on, but they agreed to move us the next day to a deluxe room, Room 102. This was slight larger than the previous room and had 2 windows that overlooked the front of the hotel Although there was some noise from outside this was better than the constant hum of a fan Now for the good parts. The hotel has a fantastic location, all sights within 30 minutes of hotel. Continental Breakfast served in the basement. booked a car with the hotel from the airport .this was spot on both ways. The decor of the hotel is not to everybody’s taste but was to ours, very nicely decorated, The roof terrace gives a fantastic view over Rome and chilling out with a bottle of wine with the sun shinning was fantastic. Would definitely stay here again but would book a deluxe room and would be selective of when we visited, as the hotel can be overly expensive, tea/coffee in the room would have been appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our last three days”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel030
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in Parioli for 13 nights, Positano for 7, so wanted to be in the midst of everything for our last 3 days. This hotel was perfect. Staff are very helpful and Valentina is especially warm and humorous....she even directed me to a great fabric store! The restaurant recommendation was exceptional. We reserved a double deluxe room and although a bit small it is well laid out and the bathroom is new and sparkly. The sound proofing is very effective. Loved the breakfast and especially loved the rooftop in the early morning, listening to Rome waking up.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Skidney_GALA
Reviews.Content: Just returned having spent another long weekend in Rome watching Scotland try and play Rugby against Italy. We stayed in the apartments again which are situated just off the square and a short distance from the actual Hotel. These are perfect for a group of guys looking to pop in and out at all times of the day without bothering any of the Hotel/ local residents. Functional clean and quiet when recovering from the eventaul hangover. The staff were great - regular communication from initial enquiry and even sorted out our airport transfers etc. Will be back and having viewed the Hotel and roof top terrace I may even let the rest have the apartment and I will take advantage of the more elegant surroundings of such a chic Hotel! Best regards

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shukes-and-Jules
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in late February and really enjoyed our stay. This is a great part of rome to stay in as it is just so convenient, lively and fun. The hotel is nice, staff were friendly and rooms smallish, but very clean and comfortable. The rooftop terrace is great for wine and cheese or chilling-out any time of the day. The breakfasts could have been better quality but otherwise a great choice for central rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend staying in Campo De Fiori & Hotel Campo De Fiori.”
Reviews.Author: travegoddess21
Reviews.Content: I literally just returned from visiting Rome with friends and have to say that I thoroughly enjoyed staying in the Campo De Fiori area. Have been to Rome many times and have always stayed over by the Spanish Steps. This was my first time staying in a different area of Rome. Campo de Firoi area is loads of fun and I have to say I loved it. The market in the mornings is a must see and the restaurants and bars are always active in the evenings especially on the weekends. The area is sooo...convenient to stay in; it is an easy walk to most of Rome's must sites. The hotel and apartments are well located. Great area and loads of fun. Not to be missed!! I tried booking our stay at the hotel but it was totally booked and so I booked a 2-bedroom apartment affiliated with the hotel. We arrived into Rome late from Paris, and even though we can in late checking was smooth and friendly. The first apartment we were directed to is located directly in the square; it was not what we were expecting. It is on the fourth floor and faces the front of the building. This apartment was not that nice & OMG!! It was extremely noisy. We spent one night there and the next morning we requested to be moved. The staff at the hotel was more than accommodating, and they worked to ensure that we were comfortable and happy and they quickly came up with a solution that worked out quite well. We were more than pleased. We were moved to two, one bedroom apartment (both in the same building) off the main square and loved it. Each apartment sleeps four or more people, (great for family and a group of friends) and both have a kitchen and sitting area. The sitting room has the day beds and thus doubles as a sleeping room. One apartment was on the 4th floor and the other on the 2nd floor. Lol...I took the apt on the second floor, I would not recommend getting an apartment on the 4th floor if you are not in great shape as there are lots of steps. We enjoyed the apartments we finally ended up in, they were large and comfortable, Lol….and we had free Wi-Fi – LOVED IT!! I would stay in either of these two apartments again, but would not want and or recommend the apartment facing the square. If you are thinking of staying in an apartment, try to stay away from the one facing the square. The noise level on the weekend is very, very high, everyone is out having fun, lots of eating, drinking and just hanging out. If you are someone that goes to bed early (10:00 PM or so) you will not find it appealing. Any of the apartments on the side streets are quieter. My recommendation to the hotel since they are managing the apartments is to make them look a little warmer, friendlier more receptive. Simply by put some prettier covers on the day beds in the sitting room and add some flowers when they know that guests are booked for those rooms, it will make them more cheerful. Finally yet importantly, let me not forget to mention just how WOMDERFL the staff at the Hotel Campo De Fiori is - everyone and I mean everyone is fantastic. The service was exceptional! I can’t say enough about just how good the service is at Hotel Campo De Fiori. The owner/s of this property is lucky to have such a great staff. I also have to mention the rooftop view, - la vista è bellissima! It is not to be missed. Just book your stay and experience it for yourselves. Buona fortuna!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT FACILITY”
Reviews.Author: mikeinnz
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel mainly for it's location and found that we had booked into a real gem. The location was indeed very good - easy to walk to all the main attractions and an easy bus journey to the main line station. We took the limo service offered by the hotal to get from the airport and it was a very easy, hassle free option. The adjacent square, the Campo de' Fiori has a fantastic market running every day - we even brought some pizza herb mixtures home with us! The breakfast each day set us up for the whole day - a nice change from many hotels. The room was very comfortable and had a brand new en-suite - again a real surprise. But the main delight was that the staff, particulary on reception, were just great. They could not do enough for us. They guided us to some great restaurants - nothing mega- expensive but some great food. So a great experience all round!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we imagined and more...!”
Reviews.Author: Em-Kate5
Reviews.Content: From the moment we booked we found the staff to be so helpful with our enquiries, room upgrade and arranging airport transfers. Upon arrival one of the receptionists gave us a map and suggested routes to see all the main sights and places/areas to eat and visit, all information given we found invaluable and it all added to making our first visit to Rome an amazing experience. The hotel decor is authentic looking (very charming) and is exactly as it looks in the photos on the website. The rooftop terrace is an added bonus, a place you can recuperate after a days sightseeing, with amazing views. Breakfast was delicious. Campo de Fiori is a great location, very central and some lovely, inexpensive eateries surrounding the market. We look forward to returning to Hotel Campo de Fiori in 2013!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rkd29ny
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in early March and was able to get a reasonable rate due to it being off-season. Hotel location is great, most attractions are within walking distance. Hotel is steps from Piazza which was nice as you can just step right outside to have dinner or drinks (many of these restaurants appear to cater to tourists but it also seemed to be a spot where a lot of local youngish people came for drinks and was great for people watching). Also there is a market there in the mornings which is fun to browse before heading out for sightseeing. The room was small but comfortable, furnished with an antique Italian feel (although may be over the top for some people's tastes). Staff was lovely and accommodating. The roof deck is beautiful although we didnt spend much time there as it was cold. Breakfast room was cozy and breakfast was good. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: STTV
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with amazing views from the roof terrace! Nice Italian furnish & decoration of the Hotel & rooms. Bathroom was small but clean & efficient. Staff was kind and helpfull, great location, within walking distance of main historic Roman attractions. The breakfast was delicious, really a hotel we recommand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay with Little Kids”
Reviews.Author: swissID
Reviews.Content: We've spent a beautiful long week-end at the hotel and had an absolutely perfect team who helped us in any case. If you're visiting Rome with little kids, the hotel is a great spot to stay, although the rooms are not huge (but very clean). You can start your day with a rich breakfast which is far beyond the poor Italian average, get the right informations from the excellent crew to avoid the classical ripoffs, and then off you go: All the sights are in walking distance with a stroller, and relaxing on the terrace after a long day is just outstanding. The hotel provides a taxi service to FCO with additional children seats (fixed price, child's seat included) and a perfect baby bed in the hotel room (additional price). Even the still mineral water is suitable for baby needs ("acqua oligominerale"). If your baby could choose: go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Before you get there”
Reviews.Author: espressobarb
Reviews.Content: I will be going to stay at Hotel Campo de Fiori at the end of May, but they have already made it seem like my holiday has started. They have a facebook page, and put up lots of lovely things, recipes, sights to see in Rome, pictures of staff, pictures of their rooms and their rooftop deck etc! Someone is putting a great deal of effort into this every day, which bodes very well for when I actually get to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: Welcoming, friendly and efficient staff, lovely room with well appointed bathroom and perfectly located for sight-seeing in Rome. What more could you ask for? We thoroughly enjoyed our four day stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “:)”
Reviews.Author: Mlockley
Reviews.Content: Quaint neighborhood, friendly and accomodating staff, beautiful rooms, gorgeous rooftop terrace. I can't think of anything I didn't like/love about this place. :) I'll be staying here again when I make my next trip to Italy. :)

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: geraldh987
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of all good comments on Trip advisor.From the moment of our arrival we were not disappointed.Car to and from the airport provided by the hotel was on time and good quality/value. We were greeted like old friends and reception staff were friendly/helpful and courteous as were all the staff we met during our visit. The room was full of character and the bathroom modern and pristine.(we would have liked a bath but you cant have everything with the space available in the historic centre) The whole hotel had character from the Roman underground cavern breakfast room to the quirky side rooms off the reception area, Position of the hotel could not have been better with everything and more on the doorstep. We stayed for 4 nights and ate at a different hotel recommended restaurant each night all within 5 mins walk of the hotel.Each meal was excellent in different ways and an average 50 euros covered the bill for the two of us. We met Franco the hotel owner and quickly understood, through his pride and passion, why this hotel is a "winner" in all aspects. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: John E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there from 2/18-2/21 and had a wonderful time. We took the available car service and arrived weary from our overnight flight @ 10:00 am and our room was already available. The hotel is located on a wonderful square filled with shops and restaurants, close to a taxi stand and bus stop. It's located in the middle of all the sights, close enough to walk everywhere. We really enjoyed our time here and would stay here again if we ever make it back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: IGlobal
Reviews.Content: Nice place to spend a weekend in rome. Pretty expensive. We will check flash deals if we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Idem. Idem. Idem.”
Reviews.Author: CircusgirlBlackpool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it only deserves excellent reviews. I could wax lyrical about it, but it has already been written. If you are reading this because you're trying to chose somewhere to stay, well we can't all be wrong....................it's everything we say it is. Excellent and more.

Reviews.Title: “Wooooonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: rickfrank
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. We stayed 5 nights in two rooms on the top floor to experience the sunrise on one side & sunsets on the other. Staff was wonderful. The only minor drawback (or bonus depending on your point of view) was the thinness of the walls between rooms. The amorous adventures of your neighbours could be inspiring or annoying depending on your perspective :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gemma M
Reviews.Content: I am not one to usually gush in a review/ even take the time to write a review, but in this case I felt compelled to. The hotel was excellent. From the reception staff to the cleaning staff, to the drivers that picked us up and returned us to the airport everyone at this hotel went out of their way to ensure that our stay was as easy and as hassle free as possible. From the minute of booking, emails were promptly replied to. The reception staff booked us into two fantastic restaurants (within budget and to the spec that I asked for - tradditional Roman cusine - preferably tourist free!), gave us a free upgrade and arranged transport to and from the airport for 50 E each way (same price as a cab and no hassle - driver was waiting for us on arrival and took us TO THE DOOR - priceless when you are new to a city and dont speak the language!) All of the extras were thought through - they have a superb roof terrace, but instead of trying to sell you overpiced wine in a porrly stocked mini bar, they provide a corkscrew in every room and glasses and recommend that you pick up a local bottle fromt he store over the road (we did this for 5 E) and take it to the terrace to enjoy! This was such a refreshing change! Ok - so the rooms are small - BUT - what else can you expect when you are in the heart of the city less than 30 minutes walk from everything (and to be fair - when in Rome who wants to spend hours inside?!?). The room was beautifully decortaed and the bathroom super modern and stylish. If you want a massive 5* generic "super hotel" this isnt for you. If you want a tasteful, personalised, beautiful boutique hotel you must book this place.

Reviews.Title: “Like living in old Rome”
Reviews.Author: get_me_out_of_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the hotel's appartments. While not spacious, it was like living on the Campo. Loved the experience! Staff was helpful. Breakfast great. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Eric C
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome many times and the Hotel Campo De'Fiori is one of our absolute favorites. I highly recommend the apartments which are actual apartments either next to or across the street from the actual hotel. The apartments are very private, very romantic and are very well kept and safe. We have never seen the rooms in the hotel but the public spaces (especially the roof top garden) are incredible. Never a night in Rome went by that we didn't get a bottle of wine from the shop across the square and watch the sun go down over Rome from the hotel's roof. Pick this one. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Virg W
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and booked 2 rooms. Right from the start we informed the staff that it was a surprise for our mother's birthday and that she had no idea we would be there as well. They helped us to organise everything from the taxi to pick my parents up at the airport to book us in two of the most beautiful hotel rooms I ever stayed in. When we arrived, all the staff knew about our plan as soon as we told them our name and their welcoming was the most professional and fiendly I could possibly dream of from a hotel reception.They even offered us the champagne and arranged glasses and snacks to great our mother when she arrived. Overall, we owe al lot to the hotel and the staff for making our week end such a special one. Honnestly, I loved everything about his hotel: the amazing decoration, the comfort of the rooms, the location (walking distance to the main monuments), the breakfast, the view from the roof top, and of course the staff, their friendliness, their language skills in French, their service and their 'italian charm'!! It was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, great location, friendly and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: PhilStubbington
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here, and loved the hotel. We stayed in the main hotel rather than the apartments. Over-the-top but tasteful decoration, great views from the roof terraces, housekeeping was first class, and handy for restaurants, bars, and of course the other sites in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a romantic/family trip”
Reviews.Author: Nico1611
Reviews.Content: Very well located by the Campo de Fiori, hence pretty much everything you might want to visit in Rome, this hotel is surprisingly charming. The roof top is simply beautiful, and it provides a very nice view over the city. Rooms are on the small side, yet they are well designed and arranged, so that they feel fairly comfortable. Breakfast is above the average for Italy - but then again, don't expect miracles there. The staff is surprisingly friendly and helpful, and they are perfectly fluent in more than one language for the most part. I would recommend it for a romantic and/or family stay in Rome, knowing the price isn't a total rip off on top of everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: throwingmuse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and could not fault the hotel. It isn't exactly minimalist in styling, with silk, velvet and deep colours everywhere but all the better for it. The room we had, 302, was plenty big enough with a great bed and very decadently decked out in red with a black tiled shower room. All spotless, including the beautiful roof terrace and lovely communal areas. The staff were extremely helpful including a restaurant recommendation for a birthday meal which was superb. The location by the market is central and very convenient, although if you have open windows be aware they set up for the day early! A stunning base to explore a stunning city from.

Reviews.Title: “A True "Roman Holiday" experience”
Reviews.Author: ananLAX
Reviews.Content: It is always a dream to visit rome .. especially if you have watched the movie Roman Holiday and Hotel campo de fiori fulfills the dream in a every way.. We stayed here for 4 nights in end of January 2012. This visit was very special to us as this is our 15th wedding anniversary and we decided to go to rome and selected hotel campo de fiori after analyzing so much and we would like to say that the hotel lived up to the expectations and made our stay very special and quite memorable. Even before travelling we would have sent many emails asking for various questions/details as our visit was very special for us, we got the response within hours to each and every mail. "when in Rome": The top 3 reasons why someone should stay in Hotel campo de fiori 1. Ambience & Cleanliness The hotel is really beautiful and the rooms are absolutely clean. Rooms are small but nothing to worry about as it is very much sufficient. The rooms have all the required facilities like safe box, clean bathroom, comfortable bed and especially a wine opener in the bathroom. Quite a romantic hotel, but suitable for all age groups whether it is with family with kids, for romantic couples or even for individual travellers 2. Service One of the best service we have experienced (as we travel a lot). whether it is Airport transfer or suggestion for restaurants, or arranging for tours or providing any information about rome etc., All the staffs were very friendly and smiling always when we enter or exit, we were kept hearing "buongiorno" / "buonasera" from every staff we came across every time. For sure this hotel is "home away from home" 3. Location The best location.. few steps we were campo de fiori piazza, The location is very center and we could walk for 20-30 min. in all directions all the attractions were covered, saves time and also we did not use public transport. "New Attraction in Rome": The hotel Roof Top terrace - We relaxed ourselves during lunch and evening wine at the roof top terrace, brought pizza slices from Forna (just in the square) sat in the roof top terrace and brought a nice bottle(s) of wine (before and after dinner) and sat in the terrace in the evening(s). May be one day this will be added into the tourist attraction list as must visit in rome. "The Terminal" : We use the hotel fixed rate airport transfer both way, perfectly organized and we left early in the morning and when we came down to the lobby the driver was waiting for us already. "Fast five" : We would have met approx about 5 different people in the reception, they are extermely fast in their service whether it is check-in, check-out or any queries we got the response immediately within couple of minitues. And also they are our best friends during the stay. "Saturday night fever" : We are not into major nighlife, but when we stepped out of the hotel on saturday night, we felt that we should experience the same..this is the place just outside the hotel, when we needed a break in between changing bars we just jumped into the hotel lobby and relaxed and had chat with the person in the receiption and pop out again to another round of party..and when we were totally tired at around 3am no need for a cab just steped inside the hotel and crashed. what more we need...for a perfect night out.. "eat enjoy love" : There are few restaurant arounds which are good (1) Da Pancrazio - just opp. to the hotel (2) Al Balestrari - simple, good ambience, friendly staff, great service and very reasonably priced (3) Forno - for the best pizza (4) Baffeto 2 As Audrey hepburn says when asked, which place she liked the most "Rome, by all means Rome" for sure we will also cherish our visit to rome and our 15th wedding anniversary as long as we live.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Quality, Quiet, Comfort”
Reviews.Author: BrennaBee
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed here after 2 nights somewhere else. It was excellent! The decor is a bit old fashion but just fine. We loved the location it could not be more perfect! Room#404 was quiet, room size great, nice flat screen TV and english channels too. Nice mini frig to store things came in handy with the cheese,salami etc brought home. The bath size too was great. The staff extremley helpful too. I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicole c
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the doors we felt at home, all the staff make you feel part of their family,names are remembered and nothing is too much trouble, a hotel with a soul. If you want to experience Rome living in the heart of a truly vibrant area then this is the hotel for you, fantastic views to be enjoyed from the roof terrace, a perfect spot for relaxing after a full days sightseeing, we walked to all the major sights from this hotel. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and cleaned to the highest standard daily.This was my secnd trip to Rome and if I am lucky enough to return I will return to Hotel Campo de fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service!”
Reviews.Author: LoSo12
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write a review normally but this hotel truly deserves all the praise. Our trip started off a bit rough with my bank giving me trouble all the way in Rome. Valentina & Michael greeted me with much warmth and friendliness and did everything possible to make it comfortable for me as I dealt with my bank overseas, truly going above and beyond what was necessary. It didn't stop there. Our server, Maria, went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed and comfortable every morning. I had a particular liking to a type of cheese that the hotel provided for breakfast. I asked Maria the name of the cheese and she said she didn't know. The next morning, we went down to grab some breakfast as usual and she came to me with the same friendly smile and told me she brought the sticker label from the packaging to give me. It doesn't end there. Gabrielle, recommended two restaurants to try in Rome and they ended up being our favorite restaurants during our trip. I can say with full confidence that staying at this hotel truly made our trip what it was. I actually stayed here for four days and stayed at a nearby "popular" hotel and noticed a stark difference. At this hotel, I truly felt like a welcomed guest. At the other hotel, I felt like I was renting a room and bothering the staff. Even the cleaning staff at hotel Campo made me feel welcomed with their friendly greeting. Next time, I'll make sure to stay at this hotel for the whole trip! My husband and I missed you all so much when we moved to the other hotel. Thank you so much Valentina, Michael, Gabrielle, Maria, and the rest of the staff at hotel Campo for making our trip a very memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa d
Reviews.Content: How lucky were we to book this hotel,completely quirky,clean and relaxing.perfectly positioned. All of this was made even more perfect from the friendly reception staff down to the lady at breakfast and the gentleman cleaning your room.Everyone is mae to feel welcome and nothing was to much trouble.we would highly recommend this hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Campo de Fiori while visiting Rome in January 2012. The location is ideal if you want to explore the city by walking. All of the major sites are no more than a 30 minute walk in any direction. The hotel is comfortable and inviting. The rooms are small but well appointed. The staff goes out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The are friendly, professional and very helpful. They're happy to make suggestions to make your visit more memorable and they are ready to assist with anything you need. The rooftop patio affords beautful views across Rome and provides a quiet oasis above the bustling streets and market below. It's a great place to relax for a few hours in between walking adventures. I was very pleased with my decision to stay here and will undoubtedly stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassable location, charming room, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: fproenca
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all, really, but let's go through each point. Location: it really doesn't get much better than this. If you're a good walker, can go to the vast majority of Rome's attractions on foot. You have a number of great restaurants and cafes less than 10 minutes walking (as a matter of fact you have a number of good places right in your doorstep, but I mentioned the 10 minutes just in case you want to vary). For example, one night my wife and I had dinner at a great wine bar less than 2 blocks away from the hotel and after that we decided to cross the bridge over to Trastevere for a last drink. The walk is pleasant and the distances are more than reasonable. This could be done because the location of the place we were staying really couldn't get any better. The room was really charming. The size was very adequate: it wasn't huge, but it wasn't cramped. The decoration was tasteful. Bottom line, the room was very cosy. The hotel also has a very nice common terrace, which you can go to enjoy a wine iver the sunset, or just to enjoy the view. The hotel service was really good. The hotel helped us with transportation to and from the airport as well as with very good restaurant tips (which is important, given the number of options available). Hotel staff was very attentious to every of our needs and always helped with a smile on the face and going that "extra mile" to make sure we were enjoying our stay. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at Campo de' Fiori and we're glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clodaghhbellina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Dec 2010 and the hotel was beautifully Christmassy, our room was beautiful. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our brief stay and I liked the location too. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to walk Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days here over Thanksgiving 2011. It was a perfect location to see all the sights. We could walk to most everything we wanted to see. The rooms are beautiful and ours (with a balcony on the 6th floor) had a wonderful view of Rome's rooftops and St. Peter's Basilica. The breakfast in the basement is terrific, the front desk very helpful and the views from the roof top terrace the best! The biggest treat was watching the market change to nightlife each day and back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WarrenSharp
Reviews.Content: Ny wife and I stayed for 3 nights January 2011. Great Hotel, lots of character, excellent spot on the roof terrace (even in January cold). Nice rooms (smallish but as I udnerstand it good for Rome!). Very comfortable bed - one of the best I have experienced in Europe. Great bathroom. Excellent location right beside the square. Staff were very informative and helpful. Would (and will) stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pro's and Con's of Hotel Camp De' Fiori”
Reviews.Author: KanataKid
Reviews.Content: First things you should know. Age of reviewer: 30, travelled to the Hotel with my wife and daughter (6months old) for 4 nights, stayed in two of the apartments. Pro's: -Large apartment room perfect for a family -Excellent service from all staff members of Camp De'Fiori -Great Location, walked from our hotel to the coliseum, vatican, pantheon, trevi fountain and piazza navona -Great market close by in the campo de fiori square Con's -Spent first night of our trip on the 2nd floor of the hotel's apartments, the apartments are all nestled in between two busy bars, this made for a terrible nights sleep. The noise level was higher than I could have ever imagined, lets say I was not impressed that the hotel staff gave us this room considering we had a baby with us. We moved up to the 4th floor after requesting a new room from the hotel staff, much better :) Overall I would return to this hotel, I would just make sure I stayed either in the 4th floor apartment or back in the hotel, which is only a short 1 min walk away from the apartments.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: mcdegonz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I ended our 3 week European vacation with 2 nights in Rome and chose this hotel and we couldn't have been more pleased. The location was central to everything we wanted to see. We felt very safe and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed relaxing on the rooftop garden after a day of sightseeing. I chose this hotel based on my online research/comments and I was not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Concentrated charm”
Reviews.Author: 303631Alex
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not spacious, but perhaps this is the magic of this hotel: everything is concentrated, especially the charm and good reception! The staff is super friendly, the breakfast room is a place I would like never to go away from and the rooms, although small, are of such charm that I strongly recomend this place to couples with a romantic penchant.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stevie_and_Nic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights in the Hotel Campo De' Fiori before heading to Positano and loved it so much that we booked another night (this time in one of the apartments) on returning to Rome. The hotel is situated in a fantastic central location close to all the key sites of interest and nextdoor to a piazza (Campo De' Fiori) which is home to some great little local bars/restaurants and a wonderful marketplace. The hotel rooms are small but beautifully presented. The apartments are a two minute stroll from the hotel, are relatively simple and traditional but very comfortable. There wasn't much of a view from either of the hotel room or apartment, but the views from the large terrace on top of the hotel are breathtaking and a wonderful place to sit back, relax and enjoy a glass of wine with some prosciutto after a long day of taking in the marvels of this historic city. Breakfast was good. Staff were very friendly, warm and helpful and the hotel provides free access to Wifi. Although the rooms cost a little more than a lot of other hotels in Rome......it's definitely worth it for a really memorable travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Goughie
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night break in Rome flying over from Bristol with Easyjet – dead easy! I had arranged for the hotel private car transfer for 50 euros thinking this would be the best thing to do. Unfortunately, when we walked out of arrivals, there was no-one to be seen. I telephoned the hotel and after a few minutes they phoned back to say that the car had been stuck in traffic and would be there shortly. OK we didn’t have to wait long but it wasn’t the service I was expecting for the price. All the way to the hotel, the driver played some weird music really loud and couldn’t hear me when I asked him to turn it down. All in all I would not recommend this as a means of getting from the airport. The hotel itself is very pretty and in a lovely position. It is ideally situated for all the main sights but it is relatively easy to get around on foot in Rome. One of the receptionists at the hotel went to great lengths to try and sell us one of their guided tours and looked quite disgruntled when I asked him about the open top bus! I would thoroughly recommend the open top bus, it is only a short walk to the Monumente a Vittorio Emanuele 11 (wedding cake building) where all the buses seemed to stop. We were also given tickets for the green open top bus which went out to the Catacombs which was wonderful. The route takes you out into the roman countryside and the smells and sights were breathtaking. This is not something I would have normally done but I am so thankful to the very kind lady who gave us the tickets. Our room 101 was fairly small and situated on the first floor, next to the extremely small lift and overlooking the front of the hotel. This was incredibly noisy at night and I wished I had paid extra for a room at the back and on a higher floor. The room was clean enough and the bed nice and big although the shower room was really small. Breakfast was served in the basement and beautifully laid out, although adequate there wasn’t really a lot of choice and it felt like we were having afternoon tea rather than breakfast. However, as others have said the roof terrace is amazing with 360 degree views all over Rome. This, in my opinion, is by far the best feature of this hotel. We loved Rome and would definitely go again but would opt to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel”
Reviews.Author: musicgalNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only spent one night at Hotel Campo de' Fiori, but it was a wonderful way to end our trip to Italy. We generally stay in small B&Bs but decided to 'splash out' for our last night. As we had only one night in Rome we wanted to be centrally located, and this was perfect. The hotel has all the charm of a small B&B, and just as friendly a staff. Our room (502) had a beautiful view of the rooftops and was impeccably decorated. As we had already seen the 'sights' of Rome on a previous trip, we just wanted to walk around some nice neighborhoods and this was perfect. Although our room was not huge, it had all the space we needed for our luggage etc. Very cosy. We actually found the breakfast to be better than many we have had in Italian hotels. Quite a lot of choice, fresh bread, and even eggs. The roof terrace is spectacular although the weather was too chilly for us to make much use of it. The hotel arranged a car for us to take us to the airport for 50 Euros which was well worth it. We would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone we know visiting Rome and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service, charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Craftylady23
Reviews.Content: The square (piazza) from with the hotel gets its name is crowded and often access to the hotel is completely blocked. On arrival, we had to walk a short bit from our taxi due to this--not uncommon in Italy. The square is home to an ages old market which was in full force. There are numerous cafes in the piazza to people watch while downing cappucino, pastries and more. We walked to all the sights in Rome from this hotel. Like "funromanticgetaway" describes it , we also enjoyed the excitement New Year's Eve in Rome from the rooftop garden and our room overlooking the square. We loved the decor of our tiny (not even room for a chair) but well appointed room. It was equipped with a minifridge and a corkscrew/bottle opener (chained to the bathroom wall and quite difficult to use as a result). A word of caution to double check all arrangements carefully. We had some miscommunications with the desk staff who are fluent in English but failed to understand or communicate important information. For instance, tickets were booked for us on the wrong date and had to be reissued.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable New Year's Eve!”
Reviews.Author: funromanticgetaway
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. We had a 360 degree view of the fireworks illuminating Rome's sky at midnight, as we celebrated the new year. The staff was very helpful. They helped us locate a restaurant with availabilty at the last minute on new year's eve and also called a taxi for us at the last minute for our depature to the airport. The taxi charged 45 euros, less expensive than expected. As a New Yorker, I am accustomed to smaller rooms and street noise, so none of this bothered me. In fact, the rooms were larger than I expected and the noise was minimal despite staying there on arguably the loudest day of the year. I highly recommend this hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location near the Campo”
Reviews.Author: TonyHitch
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, the staff and our "apartment" at the Hotel Camp de' Fiori. Literally just a few feet from the square, the hotel consists of traditional rooms on several floors of the main building plus a small lobby and living room as well as a number of small apartments two doors down from the hotel entrance. We stayed in a large one-room apartment for three nights and loved it. It has a mini-kitchen that we used only for breakfast plus a nice bed and simple desk, etc. The staff speaks fluent English, has great senses of humor and made our stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AMHartley
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the wonderful Hotel Campo De Fiori! The location is perfect for sight seeing in Rome. The rooms are typical European sized but beautiful and well-appointed. I was a little concerned about potential noise from the nearby square but with my windows shut I didn't hear a peep. The photos on the web site are accurate and the roof-top deck is a dream! The breakfast was ample with excellent coffee. The best thing about the hotel is the amazing staff - Valentina, Matteo, Barbara, Gabriele, Angelo, Adam, Andrea & Andrew - not only efficient and well-versed on the city, they were kind hearted and lovely. They bent over backwards to make my stay truly special and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: RaeRae M
Reviews.Content: One cannot find themselves in a better location!!! Rooms are smallish...it is Europe, clean and well maintained. Bathrooms again smallish and clean, with good hot showers. A convenient wine bottle opener is provided in room, which is handy for when you ascend to the FABULOUS rooftop terrace you can sip while watching the sunset burnish the Dome of St.Peters in glorious light, while listening to the clamor of the fruit market and restaurants below. Don't worry about the noise outside, one does not hear it inside. Breakfast is simple, cereal, brioche, yogurt and coffee. All of the staff a pleasant and accommodating, and will assist with any reservations. An airport shuttle is offered for 50.00 Euro per person, you may think a little steep, trust me, it is by far the easiest, efficient and convenient way to arrive or depart.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Alba B
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in room 601, which was beautifully decorated, clean and very comfortable. The breakfasts were plentiful and the espresso was heavenly. The best part of our stay was the staff. Andrew, Valentina and Matteo were always available to assist us and made sure our stay was enjoyable. I especially enjoyed the political discussions I had with Matteo, very enlightening! Gabriele, thank you for the restaurant referral in Sienna, (Nonna Gina), the gnocchi ricotta and the pici was fantastic. If I am fortunate enough to return to Rome, this will be where I stay. Sincere regards and Happy New Year, Alba

Reviews.Title: “Best of everything”
Reviews.Author: sonnybella
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hotel Campo everytime I visit Rome . This last trip (aug-sept 11) I was with a party of 8. We stayed in Hotel Campo's apartments. Although we were scattered (not in the same building) we were all within the piazza and the different apartments were all beautiful, clean and spacious. While staying the apartments we had access to the hotel, the roof top lounge, lobby and internet, but not the breakfast (unless we paid extra). The check-in/check-out was quick and they called a cab for us whenever we needed one. Overall, the location is what makes this hotel stand out above the rest. Amazing restaurants, night life and daily market all within foot steps from your door. The market during the day, is the best place to buy homemade vinegar and lemoncello (which make great gifts to bring home).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jan625
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff. Rooms a little cozy but comfortable.breakfast filling and typical for Italy. 10 minute walk to Parthanon ,20-25 minutes to Forum and Vatican. We were traveling with our adult children and they enjoyed the easy access to night life.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Good location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: HoustonK_11
Reviews.Content: Priced well. Very tastefully decorated rooms, but not spacious. Everything was clean and operated properly. The real story is the staff. There are seven people that work the front desk on varying shifts. All of them got to know us during our stay and sincerely wanted to make suure we were comfortable and assist us with all our outside activities. We were told by two of the staff members that they had a very good boss. It shows.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Boutique Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Buzzy267
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved everything about our stay. The staff are unbelievably friendly, fun & helpful. The room, while a bit small, was full of character, charm & very clean. The position is excellent, within walking distance of just about everything or the bus is fairly close anyway. There's a great market place around the corner where you get fresh fruit, veg, nuts, flowers, clothing & gifts, there are also restaurants & delis there too. The breakfast was lovely & service very good. There are rooftop terraces on a few levels where you can relax, read, enjoy the view & get your bearings of significant tourist spots to check out, or enjoy the peace there. A wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: erinjilek
Reviews.Content: Our stay could not have been better, we arrived in the early afternoon to our room ready. it was small and comfortable, with a great clean bathroom, staff was very helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel! Great rooftop terrace.”
Reviews.Author: rstyle
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Campo De' Fiori. The staff was friendly and always helpful. Although we stayed in one of the apartments rather than the hotel proper, we had full use of the quaint lobby, and the truly amazing rooftop terraces. Sunset, wine, and all of Rome at your feet.......an experience not to be missed! Around 6PM all the churchbells start ringing and it is just magical. As for the apartment - I have read some negative reviews on some of the apartments, but the one we had was just perfect. Two big bedrooms, a cute little kitchen, as nice a bathroom as any we had in Italy, and this really interesting front door. You had to walk across a little square and through a gated courtyard to get to our building, but it was all so charming, and old, and just what you'd expect in such a beautiful, ancient city. If you want to feel like you are really living in Rome, then this is the place! You feel like you are a part of a neighborhhood - we watched the lady across the cobblestone "road" from our second-floor apartment hang her laundry out the window every day - so charming! We loved everything about this hotel, and our "Roman Holiday"!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, first-rate staff”
Reviews.Author: ArzuS
Reviews.Content: Stayed in November with my family in one of the hotel's flats off the Campo square - ours was located in a 600-year-old building right across from the main hotel building. Be warned: as the flats are in old buildings, the ceilings are low and furnishings are antique. The extra bed in the living area was just a regular cot, and not an extremely comfortable one, at that. The hotel itself is newer and probably much more luxurious, but those rooms were not an option for us, being 3 people. However, for a short stay this was not a huge problem for us, as the location is very central and within walking distance to almost all the major Rome sites and shopping district, along with excellent restaurants nearby. Also, the charm of the old flat outweighed the lesser level of comfort. Good points: besides the location, the hotel staff is excellent, friendly and always helpful, I can't say enough nice things about them. The breakfast was plentiful and tasty, with good coffee & service. Also, the flat was immaculately cleaned and made up each day. Points which need improving: Being November, the flat was cold and the only working source of heat was an A/C in the living room. This was fine for anyone sleeping in the living room's cot, however the main bedroom was always cold. The only English channel on the TV was MTV...! Also, the cot in our flat had a noticeable sag in the middle and the hot water service was intermittent in the shower. Our main source of discomfort, however, was during our first night (a Saturday) in the flat, which overlooked the main square. There are several bars and restaurants all over the Campo de Fiori square, and the noise from people in the square during this night was so loud (despite the double-glazed windows) that we couldn't sleep until nearly the middle of the night. To be fair, this was only the case for the Saturday night of our stay. Therefore, I would definitely recommend a room not facing the square, if possible, for one's stay. Due to the location, the great staff and choice of wonderful restaurants nearby, however, I give this hotel a 4-star rating out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Never gonna find a better place to stay in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jared32348
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before now, but truth be told, I have never had a reason to until now. The Hotel Campo de' Fiori is the cream of the crop when it comes to personality, friendliness, accomodations, hotel staff, hospitality....this list could go on and on. Having never traveled abroad, I must admit I was nervous and a bit homesick at first, but I was welcomed with warm smiles and very gracious people who treated me as a member of their family staying in their home. Recommendations were spot on and directions were easily understood, even for this unseasoned traveller. The views from the rooftop terrace were breathtaking and the rooms were very comfortable and I cannot find one single thing to complain about. Please, on your first or your fourteenth trip to Rome, stay with Valentina, Matteo, Barbara, Gabriele, Angelo, Adam, Andrea & Andrew at the hotel Campo de' Fiori. I promise you will not be dissapointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever....”
Reviews.Author: MomCat1992
Reviews.Content: I have already submitted a lengthy, detailed review on this hotel that covered my past few stays. I decided to contribute one more brief review based on my most recent stay at the beginning of November (2011) for five nights. Everything remains as I write in my original review - all wonderful but I just wanted to add that, in addition to the many appealing features of this little beauty, I was more struck than even before regarding the staff here. I have been in many hotels, not only in Italy or elsewhere, where the staff is perfunctory, answering questions when asked, being polite enough, etc. But, as someone who chooses to usually travel solo to Italy, I was even more appreciative of this hotel's very special staff members than even during past visits. Especially when solo, it is nice to come back at the end of the day and be greeted warmly and asked about your day. It is not something I need, but found it very welcoming. I don't like to intrude on staff unless I need something as I know they are working but it is very nice to have that warm brief schmooze, for lack of a better word. I usually pop in and out of this hotel a number of times a day - sometimes up to 4 or 5 times a day and evening (and, that is why their perfect location is so perfect) and it felt almost like I was at home, coming back and being greeted like an old friend. Even teased a few times, which really made me feel at home. They were also very welcoming when friends of mine came by to meet up with me. Many hotels aren't all that friendly to non-guests. But, my had stayed at this hotel a few years ago (they couldn't get a room this time) and were keen to stop by and that was fine. I also had some other friends meet and spend a few minutes in the front of the hotel where they have seats. These are friends who frequently visit Rome and stay in another hotel all the time. They fell in love with this marvel of a hotel and said that next visit, they will stay here. (I did keep the friend visits to a minimum not to take advantage but I appreciated they did not mind.) I like sharing the goodness that this hotel is though I fear that means the more of us previous guests that do, the harder it will be to get rooms but, I happily will take that risk to encourage travelers - and maybe even particularly a special word to solo travelers - that this place does not seduce you just once or twice, it maintains its charms and stellar service with each subsequent visit. Again plotting next return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Carlos C
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is like a little treasure hidden in the middle of Rome. Its "boutique like" style is perfect for a family stay, offering excellent and beautifully decorated rooms and apartments (in the case you might need more space). Rooms are very clean and bathrooms very modern and comfortable! In the front desk you can always find very nice and helpful personnel, who are able to offer you the best choices for a pleasant stay in Rome. Its location also helps, once it is very close to most of the ancient Rome sites! Carlos Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, romantic, intimate hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NordAlva
Reviews.Content: Refined rooms decorated in antique style and with modern bathrooms. Friendly staff and perfect location in "old Rome" with walking distance to the Vatican, Fontana di Trevi, Colosseum, Forum Romanum etc. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: anna12321
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very friendly and entertaining, helped us get directions to various tourist attractions good location, near everywhere, but it's easy to get lost! But if you do get an apartment, be prepared to climb stairs as it is not at the main hotel front desk location. Rooms very nicely decorated! Though one thing to point out was that the heater was somewhat inadequte to keep us warm being in only the living area, and not the the single bedroom and toilet.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: C-Crummer
Reviews.Content: Welcome to Rome! This is a quaint boutique hotel with the best location and staff. The rooms are romantic, cozy and Romanesque. We slept with the window open to smell the bread cooking, and the pomodoro sauce slowly cooking...the best sleep of my life. And within walking distance to everything, and the roof top terrace is beyond words....we will be back, for sure! And than you everyone for taking such good care od me and my Mom!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - Location, Rooms, Staff”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: You cannot stay in a better location than the Campo De' Fiori when in Rome - a bustling little piazza in the middle of it all. The rooms are historic vintage Rome - you feel like you are going back in time 300 years - gorgeous. And the open air roof top deck affords you amazing 360 degree views of the entire city. You can walk to absolutely everything in Rome from this Hotel - the Pantheon, Coliseum, Roman Forum and the shopping districts. All of this is enhanced by the Hotel CDF's amazing staff of people who are fun, funny, caring and helpful. They were simply the best hotel staff I have ever encountered - on top of arranging transportation, they even went so far as to help me question and negotiate my Hertz car rental bill that I thought was wrong - they called on my behalf and resolved the issue in less than 10 minutes - given my limited comprehension and ability to speak Italian, this likely saved me a full day's headache. Lovely hotel and even lovelier people. I will definitely return to Rome and I will definitely stay at Hotel Campo De' Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and exceptional experience”
Reviews.Author: beksie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at Hotel Campo De' Fiori for our honeymoon last month, it was the nicest hotel we stayed at during our stay in Italy. The location was amazing with the hustle and bustle of the Campo just outside (but without the noise in our room like with some other hotels in a busy area), it was the most romantic hotel and perfect for the start of our honeymoon. The views from the gorgeous rooftop terrace were amazing and we could see the whole of Rome stretched out for miles. We enjoyed a fantastic buffet breakfast in the quaint breakfast room downstairs each morning. Not only was the hotel itself great, but the staff were astounding! They made the stay extra special. Valentina, Andrea(s) and the crew were very attentive and helped us out a lot during our stay. My husbands bags were lost by the airline and the staff not only constantly called the airline to follow up but also assisted with getting my husband's medication from a nearby pharmacy and Valentina personally walked us there and explained our situation to the ladies behind the counter. What truly wonderful and beautiful people they were! I would stay here again in a heartbeat and recommend to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2010 and never got round to reviewing it, but here goes: The Hotel Campo de' Fiori is without question the loveliest hotel I have ever stayed at. The location is perfect and the rooms are so, so romantic. The stunning roof terrace alone makes it all totally worthwhile. Finally, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Although it's quite expensive (however, thanks to the location, you'll never need a taxi) and the coffee at breakfast is awful (you're much better off heading out onto the Campo for a caffe latte anyway), it really doesn't matter. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Love this awesome townhouse!”
Reviews.Author: Debra H
Reviews.Content: My daughter was living in Arricia attending college, so I came out for my 3rd visit to Rome. This was by far the best for many reasons! This place has the best location as you can see from all the other reviews. Paulo and Emanuelle were such good hosts and the nicest people! Both my daughter and I loved the rooms. They were clean and very Italian! It was great to be able to get fresh fruit and veggies every day. Paulo even took us for a ride on his scooter through Rome for an official guided tour. When we come back and we will, we will stay at Hotel Campo De 'Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: 77Traveller_11
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have used the internet for 20 years (yes – before html, when the only users were geeks downloading ftp files), and I have never written a review, and only partially trust those who do. This time I have to. We chose Hotel Campo De' Fiori based on the Trip Advisor ratings and its geography: we were visiting my son and he was staying close by. I was concerned with what I had read about Italian room sizes, out-of-date and/or unsanitary bathrooms, “free” breakfasts that were nothing more than bread and expresso, etc. Hotel Campo De' Fiori did not subject us to any of that. What we did get was a hotel and room with dark thick highly polished wood trim and doors throughout (the wooden door on our room was 3 1/2” thick), a gleaming black tile and chrome bathroom, a shower with an overhead “rain” nozzle and a hand wand, free high speed internet, a daily free breakfast in a café style room that included a wonderful variety of sweet rolls, cakes, and crescents, eggs, sausages, salamis, cheeses, espresso, cappuccino, juices, etc., and a roof garden with views of the National Monument of Victor Emmanuel II, the Pantheon and St. Peter’s. The staff was as impressive as the facility: always smiling and asking to help (in impeccable English), they found and recommended restaurants for every taste and occasion (including searching for and finding one for our family’s Thanksgiving dinner (with turkey), they helped us coordinate with our son, arranged for taxies, and they jumped in and took charge when a US credit card company (not the one we using to pay our bill) sent a warning about using the card overseas and demanded an immediate overseas call. The maid service and the young lady who brought us Cappuccino daily at breakfast were equally attentive and charming. I confess that the room was smaller than we are used to in the US. It was however, nicely decorated and big enough for the bed, a desk and chair, an armoire (including a safe and a standard hotel size refrigerator (which was standard – no request needed). We had no complaints about the room size. The hotel is on 50' from the edge of Piazza Campo De' Fiori, on a cobblestoned alley perhaps 20 feet (4-5 meters?) wide between the Piazza and the Corso Vittorio Emanuele II. The Piazza has many restaurants and a daily open market of foods, trinkets and clothing. From there my wife and I – in our fifties and in less than perfect health – walked to the Pantheon, St. Peter’s and the Piazza Navona.
