The Colosseum, the National Monument of Victor Emmanuel II, the Roman Forum, the Trevi Fountain, and the Spanish Steps are all within walking distance for younger guests. Lest I be accused of being too easy to please – I am known as a bit of curmudgeon, and did have objections to some encounters with tradesmen, gypsies at the Vatican, and taxi drivers during our visit. I agree with the writer who says that it had no iron available, no laundry service, and no toaster in the breakfast room. But we did not care or notice - the Hotel Campo De' Fiori is a boutique hotel with perhaps 20 rooms, and we did not plan to do laundry or cook toast when offered all that WAS available (my son uses a nearby coin operated laundry and dry cleaner). The Hotel Campo De' Fiori did not disappoint, and in fact exceeded my expectations daily. Other than being able to see our son, it was likely the best part of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Gina G
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo de Fiori is hands down the best hotel that I have ever stayed at. The location of the hotel is directly in the heart of shopping, dinning, drinking, and incredible site seeing. The rooms are decorated beautifully. There is an indescribable terrace on the top floor that you can bring a bottle of wine to and relax while looking out over all of Rome. I would like to give a special thanks to the most caring staff that I have ever encountered in all of my traveling-- Valentina, Barbara, Gabrelle, and Andrew. They went above and beyond any expectations to make sure that my mom and I were having a great time, comfortable, and safe. They even made sure that we made it to our next destination after we check out of the hotel AND they helped us when we were stranded in a completely different city and no longer guests at the hotel. I had so much fun staying at hotel Campo de Fiori that we stayed an extra night. My next trip to Rome, I will not stay at a different hotel. Hotel Campo de Fiori has made a life-long customer out of my family.

Reviews.Title: “So close to all!”
Reviews.Author: Leif Inge J
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in Rome is Hotel Campo De Fiori! I have stayed there 4 times in a row for the years 2008-2011. This hotel is a must if you want to live close to everything in Rome. It is situated in the market place Campo de Fiori and just 5 minutes walk from Piazza Navona. You can walk to Coluseum in about 20 minutes and to The Church of St. Peter within half an hour. The hotel has a lovely terrace on the roof where you can sit down to have a drink and "see Rome by night". The Management is lovely and the rooms very special decorated! Lovely bathroom! Do not hesitate to use this hotel when visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: AtSeaAnne
Reviews.Content: From the time I made the reservation two months ago to the morning we checked out, the service, the ambience, the breakfast, the location and the views were fantastic. This is the perfect place to stay in Rome. Walkable to much of Rome's wonderful sites, making it easy to explore Rome. Our four day stay was great and we will return to stay here next year. All staff were extremely helpful. If you like Kimpton Hotels, Campo de Fiori has that "feel." Loved the rooftop terrace late at night and early in the morning. Terrific breakfast with a nice variety of breads, cereals, fruit, eggs, sausage, yogurt, coffee, juice, cappacino & expresso. Love these boutique type properties. Made our Rome stay perfect! Thanks to the entire staff for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Angie E
Reviews.Content: I had experience of this hotel three years ago when I stayed with 3 friends in one of their apartments and the friendliness of the staff, the location (walking distance to all major attractions) and the fantastic roof terrace (360 degree views of Rome) meant that I had no hesitation in booking a room in the hotel for our Honeymoon. We were not dissapointed. Staff, location and terrace remain first class and the unexpected bottle of celebration bubbly was most welcome - Thank you very much. Our room, 301, exceeded expectations. Clean, larger than I was expecting (I have stayed in shoeboxes in other capital cities for a similar price!), beautifully decorated and the ultra modern bathroom with a two way shower, bidet and speakers was well above average. Although not cheap, the 50 euro each way taxi transfer from the airport is a must in my opinion. Smart, polite, on time drivers in high quality cars deliver you to and from the hotel relieving you of the pressure of finding your own way by public transport. The only way to start and end your holiday! The breakfast is excellent and abundant and the basement room very nicely decorated and set out. Again, staff very attentive and eager to please. Despite the central location, noise was never an issue either in the room (double glazed) or on the terrace - very peaceful and relaxing. We will certainly be returning to celebrate a future wedding anniversary so see you all again soon. Many thanks Angie & Rick

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, very romantic!”
Reviews.Author: FRMPBH
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel's decor and location. It was great, there is an awesome farmers market everyday in the square right next to it. The location is unbeatable, 5 mins walking from most of the best attractions in Rome. The rooms were a bit pricey given the size of them but you are paying for the experience and location. Hotel staff is very nice and friendly (Oliver, Andrew, Gabrielle). They gave us great recommendations, one was for a personal Vatican tour that was unbelievable, which made our entire Rome trip (and no I'm not religious nor into art).

Reviews.Title: “Bello! First rate in every way!”
Reviews.Author: CinnamonGirl007
Reviews.Content: My two adult daughters and I stayed at the Hotel early last Summer and loved it! Every need was attended to, we enjoyed personal service and were very happy with the location(charming) and just off the main square so a bit more quiet.....the rooftop is amazing, esp. at night-views abound! Safe, clean and very comfy. It's a classy place to stay in Roma, and the shops are close at hand, food is abundant and good in the Piazza and the atmosphere is all Italian. Breakfast was hot and very well prepared and abundant--just go, you will love it!!! These folks know service, and are kind and caring too. Wanted to stay longer--next time! Remember in Roma, rooms are smaller and higher priced everywhere.....if you want more room- pay the extra, or just enjoy the luxury that every room affords. Bello!!! Peach and the girls

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: TwoMillionMiler
Reviews.Content: We'd read reviews on both Trip Advisor and Fodor's and the reviews on Trip Advisor are far more accurate. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful in helping us get settled, providing excellent recommendations for dinner, and offering to help us set up tours around Rome. Our room, 302, was away from being directly over Campo and was very quiet. We loved the Terrace - the views are amazing. We'd done as many, buying some wine and cheese from one of the stores along the Campo then watched the sun set from the top of the hotel and came back day after day to enjoy the vista. The rooms are average in size but very unique. The baths are modern (very modern) and everything is quite comfy for the price. We were given an upgrade at the time of booking, which was a very nice gesture. Location...location...location. Walking distance to just about every major site in the old city or the Vatican within about twenty minutes. There's some reasonable shopping in the area and you're a twenty minute walk from the Spanish Steps if you feel the need to part with many dollars while shopping. The hotel arranged our transportation to/from the airport and both trips were on-time. Breakfast is more than the standard European breakfast and is a nice addition. The breakfast room is attractive and the boutique hotel atmosphere comes through as friendships develop over breakfast. This is a great property and we were very pleased with the value. We'd love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Tcuherman
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff is really great and goes out of their way to accommodate. Great location, good breakfast, and nice, clean rooms. Rooms are a tad on the small side, but ample enough for your needs with modern bathrooms. Only issue we had was with some loud patrons utilizing the upstairs terrace and literally screaming in the halls. It was past 2 am and we had an early tour. We're on the 6th floor, close to the terrace entrance. Can also be a little loud in the morning when they clean, so if you're a late sleeper bring earplugs or request a room away from elevator below floor 5. Really outside of the isolated incidents the noise is tolerable. Terrace has great views of the city, nice seating area for drinks and lounging.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: al w
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the staff at this hotel. They are outgoing, attentive to guests needs and always cheerful and willing go the extra mile to make our vacation in Rome perfect. The hotel has a great central location in Rome with easy walking to all the great sites as well as shopping. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Audrey J
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy... we had the best experiences here! Valentina was an angel.. giving us good local restaurants to try in every neighborhood, the areas to see and how to do it all in just a few days! Gabriel was always available to assist us with any and every question. We checked in and out twice during our week in Italy - going to Florence for 3 nights in between - and the speed and ease of checking in and out was amazing. We changed the bill from one person to another one time. They have 2 iPads so you can check your email in the mornings which is very nice before heading out on your day. We stayed in two different apartments and loved them both! We requested 3 single beds. Our first apartment had 2 singles in a big bedroom and one single in the living room. New bathroom with tile - very very spacious even by US standards. The second apartment was even more spread out with a completely separate kitchen, hall way to bathroom, nice size bathroom and two separate bedrooms - one bedroom had a huge double and the other two twins. So spacious and Gabriel took our bags for us to the apartments. You are right in the heart of the city.. but really close to the market which becomes restaurants at night and close to many attractions. The last day Valentina not only told us where to go and what do but saved us by insisting the taxi driver come up to the front door of the hotel. We were 3 ladies traveling together and always relied on their recommendations and warnings. We also used the car service from the airport - 50 euros is well worth the trip!! It is a long ride from the airport... both times our car service was a nice top of the line Mercedes. When we came into the train station Valentina had warned us that the drivers might try and take advantage and charge us more to come back to the hotel. This is illegal in Italy but happens if you aren't prepared for it like we were. It should only cost between 12 and 15 euros from the train station. So we saved a ton just following their advice. We got a great driver who charged us 13.40 euros and it was a really nice Audi. ;-) The people of Rome really are the highlight of any trip there. None of us had ever been to Italy before & so was not sure what to expect. We had no idea we would find two of the most helpful, kind and wonderful hosts in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Our "Home" in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Greg M
Reviews.Content: We booked a Triple Deluxe Room (#202) for 2 nights prior to an Eastern Mediterranean cruise. We chose this hotel due to the strong reviews we found online (here) and its proximity to Rome's major attractions for this, our first, visit to Rome. We were very pleased with the location - in the heart of historic Rome and within a 15 minute walk to all major attractions; adjacent to the Piazza Campo de' Fiori and it's wonderful open air market and restaurants and the panorama from the rooftop terrace. We booked our ground transportation and private guided tours through the hotel and all went off without incident. We were met by our driver and guides promptly and shown the wonders of this city. The hotel staff were knowledgeable and courteous and quite helpful with their recommendations of local restaurants and experiences. The room was clean and well furnished in antique style without feeling stale or stuffy. The en-suite bathroom was tidy and clean as well. In all we had a pleasant stay and a memorable introduction to Rome. Thanks to all!.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arlazzaron
Reviews.Content: We are in the hotel right now and we will stay 8 nights. Great location, staff, beautiful place. Best choice for sure. Graziela/Anderson

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Sean P
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we chose this hotel from tripadvisor. Just want to confirm all the good reviews for this place. Great hotel, totally recommended. I have stayed for 3 nights and I can' find anything to complain about. Location was great, exactly in the historic centrenof Rome, big rooms and helpfull staff. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming ambiance, friendly and helpful service!”
Reviews.Author: Lenore38
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Italy and Rome was our first stop. We went with the hotel's suggested "First time in Rome" itinerary and it was absolutely wonderful. They made sure we saw the sites without the crowds. The guides tailored the days to our specific requests and were incredibly knowledgeable. It was just two of us with a single guide and it was just like being shown around by a friend. Recommended restaurants were right on target - no tourist traps and OMG, the gelato is to die for! The room was beautiful and the bathroom was modern. Excellent facilities in the room and free WiFi throughout hotel. Breakfast was in a charming dining area. Great morning cappuccino and a tasty array of pastry, cheese, fruit, meats, breads and even eggs. The crowning glory of the hotel is the rooftop terrace with spectacular 360 degree view of Rome. It's a great place to enjoy some wine at sunset and watch the birds as they circle the city while the bells chime all around! The hotel location is absolutely amazing! We were walking distance to everywhere, yet tucked away just enough to be off the beaten track. It's right on a piazza with a daily flower and vegetable market, surrounded by restaurants and shops. This was our 30th wedding anniversary and the hotel sent us a lovely "goodie basket" and bottle of wine - it was a gracious gesture and we really appreciated it. Grazie mille for a great time! We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for centro storico”
Reviews.Author: Brian_de_Kilburn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of centro storico, by the liveliest square in Rome (Campo de’ Fiori), and a few steps from one of the most elegant (Piazza Farnese). We chose to stay in one of their small apartments (dependance) rather than in the hotel itself. It was just round the corner from the Campo in Vicolo di Giglio, up a steep narrow staircase. Nevertheless, it was really quiet even when the Campo was full of noise. We liked being in an apartment up a narrow staircase: it made us feel like residents. Had we stayed more than three nights, we would have shopped in the market and cooked for ourselves (occasionally). In any case, it was nice to be able to make ourselves tea and eat our pizza al taglio at a table, and to have a fridge to store water and milk. The bedroom was pleasantly decorated with a small but adequate bathroom (just a shower) and a small but adequate kitchen. The bed was very short, and we wouldn’t recommend it for anyone taller than 5’6”, and a large person would have trouble with the bathroom. There was no hotel wifi in the apartment, but it is possible to register for the free local wifi system – though we didn’t do this. The housekeeping was impeccable; everything was cleaned and tidied every day to a high standard. The hotel itself is decorated in an old-fashioned style – quite pleasant. Breakfast in the hotel was adequate, but order cappuccino rather than coffee, which comes in pots and was undrinkable. There is a fantastic roof terrace with views over the roofs of Rome and down into the square. A real plus. It would have been an even bigger plus if one could order drinks up there. The front desk was really well-organized, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment disappointing...great location though!”
Reviews.Author: bon_vivant_traveller
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in an apartment at Hotel Camp De' Fiori. The location of the hotel was excellent in every way but in our view, even considering the great location, the apartment was poor value for money. As background info: - this was not our first trip to Rome, we have stayed many times before including in a range of other (both more expensive & cheaper) accommodation in Rome during this most recent trip - the very reason we visit is for the wonderful historical urban ambience that only a city this ancient exudes - we enjoy the noise, dust and grime - it goes with the territory and gives the city character! - whilst we frequently stay in luxury hotels, and also many hotels, hostels, and B & B's at the other end of the scale, we did not expect luxury at the price we paid - whilst coming from Australia, we actually live in a small home so weren't expecting a huge apartment - we have no complaints about the apartment's size - we appreciate the building is culturally significant and unique but so it other accommodation in Rome we have compared it to in terms of value for money - we travel extensively and frequently all over the world - making us reasonably qualified to make a personal observation about relative value for money. So - yes indeed the hotel is beautiful, the location perfect, and no doubt there are many thousands of very very happy guests, it is just unfortunate, in this instance, we were not one of them...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MissLauraLeigh
Reviews.Content: I have to say that we loved this hotel. It's location is perfect to walk to everything we came to tour and see...the Colosseum, Vatican, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Roman Forum, and more. The decor is beautiful, breakfast great, customer service amazing. Our room was so quiet, we never heard another guest! I had emailed the hotel while visiting England the week before our arrival in Rome, and asked if we could store a large piece of our luggage while we toured several other towns in Italy before arriving back in Rome for the last few days of our trip. We utilized their privately arranged driver (which I would highly recommend...much nicer than waiting for a taxi). He picked us up at Rome's Fiumicino Airport on our arrival to Italy, drove us to Hotel Campo De' Fiori to drop off the luggage we wanted to store, then took us to the main train station in Rome to catch a train for Florence. It was so helpful that they would store this for us, as it saved lugging an extra unneeded suitcase thoughout Italy on the trains. When we arrived back in Rome, we were warmly welcomed and shown to our room, given maps and information about dining, directions...everything we needed. The restaurant suggestions they gave were perfect! The views from their rooftop deck are breathtaking. We went up to it each night to enjoy a glass of wine and the perfect weather and views. The front desk staff arranged for another private car driver for us on our return to the airport for our flight home. Stay here...you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGizmo
Reviews.Content: we loved our stay here. it's a lovely, charming boutique hotel in a fabulous location. Our room was tiny but gorgeous. We had a great view. The rooftop patio is not to be missed. It's lovely and spacious. We had just come back from Chianti and went up to the rooftop with a nice bottle of wine and enjoyed the sunset and the wonderful view. The staff is lovely and go out of their way ro make you feel at home. The location is great. There are tons of restaurants in walking distance and there is always something going on in the piazza. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central but can be NOISY at night”
Reviews.Author: ForestGrove
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but no A/C meant noisy nights as people often sat in the small square outside the door drinking and singing until quite late. No parking, no elevator, but nice rooms. Bit expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jubeeTunbridgeWells
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the Campo De'Fiori hotel. The room we had (402) was nicely decorated and more spacious than expected.The bed was extremely comfortable and there was plenty of storage space. Thoughtful extras were bottles of water in the (otherwise empty) fridge and a bottle opener (they actually want you to bring in your own wine to enjoy on the roof terrace). There is also a little terrace in front of the hotel if you don't have a head for heights. The breakfast room was a charming place to start the day. We particularly liked the fact that the tables were beautifully set and the soft background Mahler. Not sure where all the other guests were as it was never very busy (not complaining - this was a bonus!). As everyone has noted - the staff are lovely and really help to make you feel very well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ihatepickinganame
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous, within walking distance of all the major sites. Rooms are small, but standard for Europe. We stayed on the top floor with a balcony, but it wasn't necessary as the roof top garden is a great place to sit and have coffee in the morning or a glass of wine in the evening. The staff was wonderful and the guides they booked for us were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant buotique hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Steve36
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the welcome and were blown away with the room, first class, very quiet (we slept in the first morning as it was so dark and quiet and the bed was so comfortable). Very nice bathroom. The highlight of the hotelthough is the rooftop terrace which provides a great view of the city, the piazza beside the hotel, and a great place to relax, have a drink and chat to fellow guests. Central location is a real bonus as it is an easy walk around the main sights of Rome. For the quality of the hotel, great service and central location this hotel is a real gem and great value.It doesn't matter there is no restaurant or bar as there are plenty right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Broadlp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and provides and easy walk to most of the sights in Rome. The rooms are nice with new bathrooms and a very clean. The staff are fantastic, extremely helpful and all speak English very well. One of the great features is the roof top gardens. A marvellous place to relax at the end of the day with a bottle of wine (or two) and some great local food easily sourced from shops around the hotel. This was a great place to meat other travellers and swap stories. The only downside is the breakfast...the worst eggs we tasted all trip! (Sorry)

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous staff”
Reviews.Author: Gana B
Reviews.Content: The room was small and looked out on an airshaft. However, I didn't spend much time there, and otherwise it was very, very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful, even assisting some friends of mine who were not staying at the hotel to get to the airport. The breakfast room on the lower level was adequate, and again the staff was gracious. The hotel's location is perfect and within walking distance of the Vatican, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, etc. if i return to Rome, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly greeting in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: massachusetts-yankee
Reviews.Content: Lovely, welcoming, English-speaking staff, in this charming (i.e. rooms are a bit small, but more than adequate) hotel in a picturesque and convenient location. The roof terrace is something out of a wonderful old film. Breakfast is average and there is no restaurant, but the neighbourhood is full of very nice restaurants that the staff recommends and books. We were two grandparents with two lively 11 year olds in tow and were warmly greeted and looked after at every turn. All in all a fabulous time that definitely calls for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Megsiemay
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all expectations by far! The rooms were opulent, breakfast was delicious, and the roof top patio views were stunning. My mother-in-law's only complaint was that there weren't tissue boxes in the rooms. Triumph! Hotel Campo De' Fiori is located perfectly so that visiting the forum, Pantheon, and other sites, as well as the Vatican and St. Peter's is only a few minute walk. Not having to depend on taxis was extremely nice. There is no better located hotel. It served us incredibly well, and the daily fresh market in the Campo was a lovely bonus. The staff at the hotel also arranged a private tour for us. The guide was knowledgeable and extremely personable, getting along well with all family members. The transportation arranged was also well done and well priced. Over all, the next time I am back in Rome, I will definitely hope to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susanilz5
Reviews.Content: This little gem was lovely. The rooms are small which is to be expected in Rome but very comfortable and functional, and the room decor is dark and traditional, not for those looking for modern contemprary furnishings. I loved the decor! The comfortable multi level roof top terrace was a great place to relax after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel is situated in a good location to most attractions but it was a little further walk to the Vatican and the Colleseum then I expected. If your time or energy level is limited it's easy to have the hotel call you a cab. It only takes about 3 minutes for one to appear at the door. Plenty of restaurants in the area, and the Campo is lively at night. Noise was not a problem and the beds are comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful, and English is spoken. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and location”
Reviews.Author: shoppermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 6 wonderful nights here and highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very accommodating, especially Gabrielle, and were always available to help us with dinner reservations, great places to shop and booking tours. The location is just perfect - near great restaurants, major sights, stores, and within walking distance of most of the major attractions. The rooftop terrace is beautiful and quite romantic. Our room was a bit on the small side but had a nice bathroom -besides how much time do you spend in your hotel room when you are in Rome! Even though this is a busy area, our room was very quiet and we never heard any noise from the Campo nearby. It is nice to be able to walk outside and have the great marketplace right outside your door! We would return to Hotel Campo De' Fiori next time we plan on visiting Rome. It is a gem in the center of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: alan h
Reviews.Content: Great central location, convenient for sightseeing, shopping and dining. Stayed in one of the hotels spacious apartments with a full kitchen which came in handy for morning coffee, etc. Our apartment was on the 3rd floor so lots of stairs to walk up which will get you in training for the Cupola at the Vatican!!. We enjoyed the views of the city from the roof garden of the main hotel, its very romantic at night to take a bottle of wine up there and relax. The square below has good restaurants, street performers come and go during the evening and there is a market there during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position and excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MalcolmJhb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome in July for 6 days. She is skilled at finding just the perfect places to stay and this one was as usual an absolute gem. It is perfectly positioned on the Campo de Fiore where you have a bustling market during the day and wonderful laid-back warm resturants in the evenings. You can walk to almost all of the attractions of Rome from here. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and inviting, the breakfasts were excellent and friendly in a lovely setting. After a hot day's sight-seeing you can use the roof terrace with its romantic views of Rome and just relax. We'd certainly return here when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully romantic room and terrace”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. We were in room 601 and it was so romantic. We loved our private balcony. Service was great - every request was granted. If there is one small deficit, breakfast was not as good as others we had on our trip. Coffee was weak and server was definitely over extended with the number of guests. The location is fabulous. You can walk out into Campo De'Fiori and find many fun places to eat or to pick up wines and snacks to enjoy on the terrace. We'll be back on our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ValleyDrive57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and four other friends had one day to visit Rome before we took a cruise out of Rome. We wanted a hotel that was near all of the statues, ruins and fountains but also had the best that Rome offered. This hotel was the place. From the moment you walk into the hotel the people behind the desk were friendly and informative. The hotel has been recently been remodeled and it is absolutely beautiful. The breakfast that is included was more than enough and the coffee was excellent. Our room was fantastic and the roof top view was breathe taking. After a day of sight seeing we took some wine to the top of the hotel and soaked in the beauty of Rome and the hotel. I would go back to this hotel the next time we visit and would like to stay longer than one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great for First Time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Patrice H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decorations, very modern bath room, tiny elevator. Hotel is located steps from popular piazzas with daily farm market and artist displays. Lovely to mix with tourists in evenings. Great restaurant steps away (none in hotel). Great rooftop terrace. Walking distance to major sights. Some of the staff pushes expensive personalized tours, but overall most are helpful. Breakfast good. I found it overall expensive compared to other venues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Nick S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed in this hotel on our honeymoon in one of their top floor rooms with a private balcony. The location of this hotel was absolutely perfect for the tourist visiting Rome located equidistant from the Vatican, the Colosseum, Augustus Caesars Tomb and routes to the airport (FCO). We were able to walk to all sites within 20 minutes. As well, the piazza Campo de Fiori, located just outside the hotel was entertaining and offered satisfying dining choices at all hours of the day. I must compliment the hotel staff on being especially responsive and providing for a pleasurable experience. I would highly recommend staying in this hotel when on vacation in Rome. However, I would add to my review that I found the room that we chose to stay in, the top floor room with Private Balcony, to be less than worth the value that was paid. The room is quite small as observed by other reviewers and the balcony, although providing a view of the Vatican, is not worthwhile considering the beauty of the rooftop deck that is available to you. As well, being so closely located to the rooftop deck, there is noise at all hours from people going in and out, which made our stay in this room less than perfect. One other note was that sometimes, even on vacation, you may wish to just stay in and watch TV in your room; the lack of English language TV available to those of us that do not speak Italian made this not possible. There are only two English language channels offered at this hotel; CNN and BBC. They do offer movies on demand but charge a rather steep 8 euros for the privilege. The hotel is absolutely recommended, taking on the extra expense for the top floor room.... not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: 67Teresa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of Campo de' Fiori's self-contained apartments for a week while exploring Rome. The location was fantastic to explore many of Rome's famous sites. It was a short taxi ride away or for the adventurous like us, we walked to many. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. They helped set up guided tours on our behalf before we even reached Rome, this was very handy. The apt was spacious, very clean (daily cleaning and towels changed), and sheets changed several times that week. The kitchen was fairly well equipped and we were able to cook several meals. Only downside, the oven didn't work and when we inquired, it was due to safety reasons. It is close to lots of restaurants, grocery stores, self-serve launderia and the river which is absolutely wonderful to walk along on either side. The roof top terrace of the hotel was available for our use. Several evenings were spent up there soaking in the nightscape and drinking some great wine and nibbling on cheese! A must do if you stay here. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The very best spot in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline D
Reviews.Content: What gem of a hotel. The staff went out of their way to help us with dinner suggestions, reservations, tour guides etc. Can't say enough about this boutique hotel and its staff. If I say too much it will get booked and I may never get back in. Enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Che Bella - A Gem in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Bellalingua
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo De' Fiori If you want to stay in a classy, real Roman small hotel in the heart of Antica Roma - then choose no other! I found this gem of a hotel when I was helping a friend find a place for her stay in May 2011. Unfortunately, it was booked as they only have 23 rooms . The roof terrace pulled me in from the opening of the website. In reality it will take your breath away - the views are spectacular!!!!!!!!!!!! And the prefect place to end a day with a bottle of wine and all Italian delicacies. Or to live "dolce fa niente" ( the sweet of doing nothing ) any time of day. But I have to rewind to explain. Because the hotel was booked, I found a flat for 2 of my friends across the the way from the hotel in Piazza Biscione in May 2011 . While they were there, ,they needed a cork screw and ran across the hotel to borrow one, as there was none in the flat. There they befriended Matteo at the hotel's front desk. Suffice to say, he and the staff at the hotel were life savers for my two friends. And they were invited to the roof terrace where the panoramic view Roma will take your breath away. My friends told Matteao that I would be coming to Rome in Sept 2011 and that she hoped he would allow me up as well. I rented a flat myself, ( not connected to this hotel ) just on the other side of the Piazza Campo dei Fiori and so the night I arrived I wanted to see Roma by rooftop so I took myself and a foto of my friends and went to the hotel. I was lucky to find Matteo and Andrea behind the desk, and asked if we could visit the roof top terrace. From the moment we walked in we were warmly welcomed. They showed us around and gave us some history on the building. To see Rome at night from a Roman rooftop, you have to live it to know what it is!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Then the next day we met Valentina - a sweetheart and one of those gorgeous Italian young women, and several other staff members throughout the week. All just a joy to know. The entire staff made our stay in Roma that much more the better for all the help they gave us as we passed by every morning to say hello before we started on our way. And any guest who happened to be checking out while we were there, had nothing but accolades for this gem of a hidden treasure and all the staff who work there. For myself and the person I traveled with, we were treated just as if we were guests of the hotel or their flats. Suffice to say, if you plan on a visit to Rome, want to be in a great hotel, with great people, in a great location in the center of town, then book this place as fast as you can and go and enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Also note, they have flats ( dependencies ) apartments for rent as well, all over the Piazza Campo de Fiori- so ask about that as well . On a scale of 1-10, this place gets a 50! I have traveled and this smaller, more intimate hotel, in an ancient building is far better than any large hotel in my opinion. And as you should, you will feel like you in Roma. Dont's miss it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Tante, tante, mille grazie, Matteo, Valentina, Andrea, Andrea, Gabriele, Adam, Mr. Severino e Barbara! Un grosso bacione Mancano tutti voi e Roma pui' de quello che sa Ro (RoseAnn Tripodi ) and mi amica from the May visit Contessa Helaina Ciaramella ( she sends her love )

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Hotel Campo De' Fiori”
Reviews.Author: laura g
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel 9/19-9/21/ 2011 the staff is superb....especially Valentina...she is a jewel. The hotel is in a great location...we walked to the Trevi fount....the Spanish steps and the Coluseum. There is a wonderful traditional italian market in the piazza behind the hotel...as well as several good restaurants. We stayed in one of the apartments since the hotel was booked. At first they put us in a large apartment, but there were too many stairs for my partner's mother, they recognized this right away & moved us to a different location with fewer stairs. The staff is superb. Valentina booked train travel for us...suggested we leave some baggage at the hotel when we went to Florence for 2 nights...booked a Vatican tour. She helped us in numerous ways...and always so pleasant & kind. We talked to other guests who have stayed there many times over the years. We plan on returning to Rome next year & I see no reason to stay anywhere else. There is also a really nice roof top area for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel captures the hear of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: DianaandMike
Reviews.Content: Opening the windows in the evening to the sounds of music and nightlife was magical. The roof terrace was the perfect place to enjoy wine and appetizers from the corner deli. We fell in love with this very special hotel and location in Rome. Rooms were exquisite, location ideal and service warm and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommeded”
Reviews.Author: lubelle4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo di Fiori is very charming. It has been decorated in a unique style and I would venture to guess that each room is different. The bedding was extremely nice. The rooftop patio with three levels is absolutely fantastic! We utilized it at least twice a day. It has a great 360 view of Rome, with olive trees and some flowers on the patio. The furniture is nice and the floor is tile. What a great place to sit, drink wine and savor Rome. The breakfast was very good. It is served in the lower level, which is also very nicely decorated. Maria who staffed the breakfast for most of our stay was extremely pleasant and brings your coffee or tea. The desk staffs are primo! Barbara, Valentina, Gabriel, Matteo, and everyone, go out of their way to help you. I can’t tell you how many times we asked for directions, but they always pulled out a new map to show us the route. My husband and I agree that the staff ranked among some of the best we have ever encountered. The location of the hotel is great, within walking distance to all the major attractions, which of course includes Campo di Fiori. There are plenty of restaurants, bakeries etc. right there. There is also a self-serve Laundromat less than 4 minutes away by foot. The Laundromat also serves as an internet point if you need to use a computer. The hotel does not have a computer for their guests. (We left ours at home to lighten our baggage.) Despite the lack of a computer the staff was more than willing to check on the availability of tickets and checked us in for our return flight home. If we return to Rome, we will probably stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ginnyips
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I spent 11 days touring Rome and Sicily. This was the only hotel in Rome I have ever stayed in with comfortable beds. Most reviews of Italian hotels complain about the hard beds, which is true, but not at Campo De Fiori. This was our delight! 3 friends and I also enjoyed the perfect location, easily walking to Piazza Navona, the Vatican, the Coliseum, and other sites of ancient Rome. The piazza was filled with a marketplace which disappeared at night as the restaurants, bars, gelato shops, and bakeries came to life! We thought it would be a noisy place to stay with so much going on outside our window at night, but it was not! The shutters provided plenty of noise elimination. The staff was excellent and I would definitely stay here again. Next time, I'd like to bring my husband, because this is a romantic hotel as well! The rooftop "living room" has plenty of space and is perfect to bring a camera, a bottle of wine, and cheese, for an evening escape.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: LindsayFamily1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this excellently located hotel, it was very comfortable, the staff were excellent organising tours through Eyes of Rome, airport transfers and recommending local restaurants. The roof terrace was a real gem. We would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favoirte hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BethJag
Reviews.Content: This was our favorite hotel in europe during our past vacation. It is so beautiful- the roof top is for sure the best part. But the room was great and so comfortable too. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The loaction is great- what else could you ask for. We will for sure stay here again!!! A great place.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Terrace Escape”
Reviews.Author: swflgopher
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel speak for themselves, it's all true. The staff was multi-lingual, helpful, informative and friendly. The room was well appointed, good size and spotless. The hotel is in a great location for walking to all of Rome's attractions. If we had to choose one thing, my wife and I loved the rooftop terrace. It was wonderful to unwind and relax there every evening with a bottle of wine and review our days exploration-highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the heart of historic rome. Perfect location for seeing all the sights”
Reviews.Author: Dante_the_Florentine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a total of 5 nights at the Hotel Campo De' Fiori, and loved everything that the hotel could offer. The hotels location was perfect for using as a base for exploring all the sights of the Eternal City! 5 steps from Campo De’ Fiori and 5 mins from Piazza Navona, perfect for walking through the city during the days, and even better for that evening ‘La Passeggiata’ stroll. We never once opted for taxi’s or public transport while in Rome as the location of the hotel was central to everything, and a comfortable 15-20min walk to Vatican City, Coliseum, Spanish Steps. Etc. The hotel is beautifully decorated in vintage Italian period styling, with lovely communal waiting rooms, with the basement library also functioning as the dining room where they serve breakfast. The bedroom was comfortable and as spacious as other hotel rooms we’d experienced in Italy. The hotel also had a wonderful rooftop patio, which was perfect for enjoying a relaxing glass of wine before heading out for dinner, and afterwards to absorb the picturesque scene of Rome’s rooftops and cathedral domes at nightfall. Added Bonus: The hotel also has a luggage storage area, which was perfect as we travelled to the Amalfi Coast for 3 days, before returning to Rome and the Hotel Campo De’ Fiori. Having this amenity was such a benefit as it meant that we didn’t have to worry about the hassle (or expense) of dropping our bags off at Termini Station. Overall, our stay at the Hotel Campo De’ Fiori was perfect, and just what was needed to make the most of our visit to Rome. The room rate was slightly higher than other hotels we reviewed, however the location of the hotel to all the historic sights, and the plethora of wonderful restaurants on Campo De; Fiori and Piazza Navona more than made up for this. (There was no need for us to pay for taxi’s or waste time on public transport, as we were living in the heart of the city.) I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends, and anyone wanting the perfect hotel to absorb the delights of the Eternal City!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Romance & Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: JandJLancs
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in Rome, first trip, special anniversary, so wanted to stay somewhere extra nice & we found it, in Hotel Campo De' Fiori. Position: right in the centre of Rome, so all the well known "sights" are within walking distance, which we consider to be a plus, because there is no better way to see a city than on foot. The hotel borders a busy piazza, edged with restaurants, with a market in the middle, so lots going on. Hotel: small & privately owned, which we prefer, as you tend to get a better service. The hotel website indicates that all the bedrooms are individually furnished; judging by the photos on the website, all are done in a similar baroque style, as are the public rooms; we found that quite stylish & a change from the usual bland hotel style. An earlier reviewer didn't like the furnishings, but such things are all a matter of personal taste & the photos on the website do giver a pretty good indication of what the rooms are like. The bedroom was big enough,had a good-sized comfortable bed & good air-con. The bathroom was smallish but what I expected for a city-centre hotel & was nicely fitted,with a good shower. We had no problems @ all with noise from the square. We liked the basement breakfast room - no windows, as another reviewer said, but lots of furnishings to look at! It's a buffet breakfast & the choice is excellent. Rooftop: incredible! You get the most amazing views right acroos the city, in all directions. It was a joy to sit-up there every evening, glass of wine in hand, before going off to eat. As to the hotel being unlicensed, so that you have to provide your own drink, there are shops in the square where you can buy what you want, a fridge in the bedroom for icecubes & chilling, so what could be easler, not to mention cheaper? Lots of people got "nibbles", like olives, to take up to have with their drinks. Sit, relax, unwind after a hard day's sight-seeing; look @ the stunning views & listen to the church bells - unbeatable! Incidentally, we didn't have any problem with the lift - yes it is small but it's quite fast & we never waited that long (it is only a small hotel, so doesn't have that many rooms/people staying there) & there of course stairs! Yes it does only go to floor 5, so I can see that if your bedroom is on floor 6 then lugging a suitcase from floor 5 to floor 6, by the stairs, would be an aggravation. We didn't have to do that & walking up from floor 5 to floor 6 to get to the roof terrace wasn't a problem (even carrying a wine bottle & glasses!). Service: Couldn't fault. All the reception staff were friendly & very helpful. They gave us clear directions to get to places. We did ask for suggestions for restaurants & were very happy with the 3 places we went to as a result. The lady who gets your tea/coffee/whatever for you @ breakfast is friendly & pleasant. And the "unsung heroes" - ie those who quietly & efficiently clean & tidy your bedroom whilst you are swanning round Rome - did an excellent job. Finally, we used the hotel-arranged taxi transfer both from & to the airport; on time, no problems @ all. Not the cheapest hotel, but we wanted a small hotel, with a bit of luxury, in a central position, and this certainly fitted the bill. I would both recommend it & use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico !! Perfecto !!”
Reviews.Author: CinqsurCinq
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Hotel's Apartments adjacent to the Hotel by Piazza Campo di fiori for 5 nights as the Hotel was fully booked and with family of 5 it was perfect and felt like locals going back to our Apart at night and it was v quiet, peaceful, well appointed...only problem was on 3rd floor so if you have lots of luggages it is incovenient on arrival & departure day obviously as v narrow stairs so bear in mind. Otherwise the condition of the apart were fine for the rate, no breakfast so we had one day at the Hotel which was just ok despuite the beautiful room it was served in...v small and congested plus food selection a bit on the ok side...so suggest you go to other cafes in the piazza or streets...the key feature of the Hotel are the terrace which is amazing and so romantic, well decorated and private been few times with our own drinks and tapas, the Mger gave us a bot of frizzante(sparkling wine) and snacks which was very nice from them and stayed few hrs watching rome's roof scenery and the action as quite high up perfect for photographers...the second feature is location, v good, central, close to the "happening piazza campo di fiori and other attractions, third plus was the deco of the hotel which is v nice, cosy, baroque style in some place and typical of rome's feel...staff were v pleasant, good english and v professional...so highly reccommend to stay there as couple at the hotel and as family in the apart. as felt it was convenient and were like romans...go to Bafetto 2 for the best pizza in rome next to the hotel...wow this is heaven and authentic pizza...dont look for service or style just eat pizzas and drink plenty chianti as outside venue...again a magnifico stay thanks to the campo di fiori Team...Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: seckillion
Reviews.Content: We were so happy that we chose to stay at Campo De Fiori during our first trip to Rome. The staff was quick to help with questions via email prior to our arrival about sightseeing, dining, travel around the city, etc. Our accomodations were great. We were a party of 5 and stayed in one of the apartments across the courtyard. It was quite spacious with plenty of room for us all. Everything was very clean in both the apartment and the hotel. Recently renovated hotel, and it shows in the details. The rooftop terrace is beautiful and we used it every night to relax and have some wine. Whatever we asked for, they were more than willing to accommodate us. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “terrific staff, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: montonefan
Reviews.Content: This a very attractive hotel in a very central location. The entire staff was especially friendly and helpful (thanks Valentina). The double glazed windows block out the noise from the busy piazza at night, breakfast is very good, and the rooms very pretty. Rooftop deck is a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Galadriel72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in late June 2011. This hotel is located in the center of Rome and within walking distance from so many attractions - a great plus. The panoramic terrace on top is simply breathtaking - you get a 360 degree view of Rome and it is a great place to chill out before or after dinner. Quite surprisingly, it was never crowded! We did wish there had been the option to order drinks there - sadly, the hotel has no bar - not a huge problem given the many options in the square, but sometimes you just want to be lazy! The rooms are beautiful - unfortunately, they did not have our first choice of room for the entire duration of the stay, so we had to move after 3 nights to another room. They did move our luggage and made the experience as smooth a possible, so the only nuisance was to re-pack our suitcases halfway through the stay. Both rooms were unique, very tasteful and rather baroque, which we did enjoy. The first room was on the top floor and a tad smaller but did have our own private balcony,which we did really enjoy! Bathrooms are tiny - pretty standard in central Rome. We had absolutely no problems with noise and the rooms were well air conditioned (a tad too cold for my taste, but perfect for my American husband. Breakfast is served in the basement and pretty standard fare. The server at breakfast was very nice and happy to accommodate my husbands 'two cappuccinos' routine; she was actually the only one in the hotel who was not very fluent in English (not a problem for us since I am Italian) and despite this, I noticed she was going out of her way to help other English-speaking couples (including one with a 'to go' order of coffee). Service from the front desk was excellent, very helpful to book tickets, give directions and promptly book taxis. We did not ask for any restaurant recommendation since we are quite familiar with the city. (There is a restaurant just around the corner called "Costanza" which is just great - it is a known go-to place for many American expatriates). Overall, a great stay well worth the money, and we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyrural
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in early Sept 2011 on a vacation with another couple. What can I add to what has already been said in these reviews? Great hotel, super helpful staff, excellent location and we really enjoyed the rooftop garden/lounge....every evening for wine (they happily supplied glasses, opened our bottles, etc) , cigars, etc. Each restaurant the staff recommended was great...and non-toursity. They also helped out with a tour guide when we needed one. Not a budget hotel...but you do tend to get what you pay for. If you can, stay here by all means!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ALAN S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days at the end of August. My wife and I were on our first visit to Rome and doubt if we could have chosen a better hotel and location. Comfortable, clean, friendly and welcoming. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pilldok
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a better base of operations for our 3 days in Rome. The staff was professional and courteous. Accommodations were immaculate and quiet (courtyard view). Staff was incredibly helpful making arrangements for meals, taxis, tours, ,etc. Location within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions. Thank you for making our first trip to Rome so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “So happy with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kiwiyankee
Reviews.Content: The Tripadvisor reviews are right. This is a great little hotel. Close to everything, rooms have character, lovely service, nice rooms, rooftop is great. We had a room at the back of the hotel-so no great view but nice and quiet. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Faultless and Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Realessexgirl
Reviews.Content: In Rome, like many cities, accomodation is tough to find if you have children, especially if you don't want two rooms. Hotels seem to think that the word "family" amounts to two adults and one child, not so the Hotel Campo De' Fiori. What sets this place apart, is the dependances (apartments) which in our case had two double rooms, small kitchen and bathroom, perfect for the travelling family. We were in F2. Decorated in beautiful old Italian style, our apartment was a real wonder. There are, of course, other things that make this Hotel special. The location, the staff and the incredible roof terrace, which is an absolute must. We, cannot recommend this Hotel and its dependances enough. Thanks you so much for making our trip so special.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll come back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: rhpvdbos
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very kind and very helpful personnel. The roof garden is absolutely great! Very nice view over Rome. The rooms are lovely! The location is perfect: at the Campo de' Fiori and near the ancient centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highkt recommended”
Reviews.Author: DDembitz
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, helpful, and wonderful in every way. The rooms are beautiful and the location is perfect. The roof/patio is a great place to relax for "happy Hour' and to meet many new friends from all over the world. I would always stay here when I travel to Rome. Special thanks to Barbara and Matteo. Diane Dembitz, Tempe AZ

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anyplace else in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: holly p
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel charming, perfectly located and clean - They arranged a private tour for us at the Vatican Museum that was out of this world. But the most impressive part of my visit was i left my credit card and photo id in the hotel safe - and they went to great lengths to return it to me. I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, clean, friendly, beautiful, PERFECT location!”
Reviews.Author: NCYankeeSusie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments (2 adults, 2 teenagers) located just around the corner from the main hotel (unit F2)--probably a 2 block walk. Area felt very safe. Our apartment was on the second floor, not a problem to get the luggage up there at all. Two bedrooms, plenty of room. Kitchen very small, but we weren't planning on cooking on vacation anyway! It's a vacation! The location was perfect! There is a nice open air market with fruits, veggies, pasta, and tourist t-shirts--next to the hotel every morning. The staff at the hotel were awesome, so friendly and engaging. Spoke excellent English. The breakfast each morning was everything you would need: pastries, yummy coffee, cold cut meats, eggs, cheeses, juices. We were stuffed! The view from the top terrace of the hotel was so pretty at night, make sure you go up there! The hotel is an easy 10 min walk to the Panteon and other cool areas! This was our first trip to Rome, and this hotel is the place to stay. I can't believe that it doesn't have a higher ranking. Whatever you do, don't take a travel agent's advice and stay near the Spanish steps! It is so noisy and crowded there and full of people hassling you to sell you stuff--annoying. Hotel Campo De Fiori feels like a home away from home. On our next trip to Rome, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Clontarf6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights, some in the hotel and some in one of the apartments on the square. If you like Italy you will love this hotel. The staff organised our transport to and from the airport, which made things a lot easier. Breakfast was standard enough fare for continental European hotels. We did not have any other meals there. Hotel rooms were refurbished recently and are in very good condition. The apartment was more 'authentic' which some liked and some did not. Staff were pleasant and helpful, with suggestions for restaurants and a handy map of the city. The location is great, half way between the Forum and the Vatican, a short stroll from Trastevere. Imagine being able to stroll across to the Trevi Fountain and watch it being switched on (8.30am when we were there)! The hotel has a rooftop terrace which provides an unusual vantage point. Do be aware though that the central location means that street noise can be a problem, and having a market in the square means that you may hear the stalls being set up early in the morning - this impacts on our rating of sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great staff, options for everything”
Reviews.Author: Dave1824
Reviews.Content: For site seeing the location is great. 20 minute walk NW to Vatican, 20 minute walk NE to Panthenon and Trevi Fountain, 20 minute walk SE to Forum and Colosseum. For local amenities it is also awesome. Campo De Fiori square has an oipen market 6 days a week so everything is at your fingertips: Fresh fruit and vegetables, olive oil, balsamic vinegar etc, and then the bakeries and deli / meat markets are all right around the square every day. Can't beat it. The hotel is very nice, terrace on the rroof is a plus also for relaxing in the evening. They have regular hotel rooms, which we didn't see, but we expect they are well furnished. We stayed in one of their "dependence apartments" which is actually across the square from the hotel. Private entrance and stairs lead to your 500 sqft two room effiiency apartment with kitchenette, living room and bedroom. Awesome deal. The aparments are on floors 1-4 and there is no eleveator, so you have to be prepared to climb. We had the top floor and thought it was great. Ask the staff about restaurants, we did 4 different nights and were never disappointed. When they say La Scala, go!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greg P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married during this trip to Rome and we had a blast! Our family & friends were with us and most of them also stayed at the hotel or their appartments just next to the hotelbuilding. What makes this hotel so special is first of all the service! The staff treats you like a real guest and not just as a client. The hotel itself is very beautiful in a fresh roman style and has a big roof with a divine view over Rome. Location of the hotel is perfect because you can walk to the Vatican, Coloseum, Fontane di trevi, Piazza navona... (and more) within 30 minutes! Just around the corner (15-20m) is a big square with everything you may need:) What more do you need in Rome? We will return, thats for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful central hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: PKWGMichigan
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday and had 3 wonderful days at Hotel Campo de' Fiori....we stayed in Room 602, a beautiful room with private terrace. The view from the Rooftop terrace is amazing and the antique decor in the rooms make this a very special stay. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We had 3 tours arranged by the hotel and I can't speak highly enough about what a special experience that was....our group of 4 were met at the hotel by Luciana the private tour guide and our reservations etc were all set for a 3 hour tour of the Vatican....it would have been so overwhelming without her guiding us. The area is fantastic and the hotel's recommendations for dining are great....we just loved this location and the hospitality....I must have looked at over 200 hotels in Rome and there is no doubt in my mind this hotel was THE BEST CHOICE!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great find! Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SwimMom98
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is tucked away in Campo de Fiori Square in Rome close to Navona Square and basically close (within walking distance) to all of the attractions that Rome has to offer. Just walk out the front door and find many outdoor restaurants, walk up sandwich places, and the all important "Blue Ice" gelato store. The rooms were small, but just rennovated with high decorative ceilings and really unique fixtures. The bathrooms were really nice, also brand new. The three level rooftop was so cool. You could see all of the famous sites of Rome from it...plus lots of comfortable seating to have some cocktails and hors d'oeuvres. We reserved two rooms because we are a family of 4 and it worked out very well. For the price (130 euros per night) which included breakfast was well worth it! Staff was also very accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with perfect location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jan S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel four- five times in the past and have always been very satisfied. The hotel is located at the market at Campo dei`Fiori in the ancient part of Rome, e.g. at short distances to Panteon and Pz. Navona. The roof terrace gives wonderful views of the city. This time we had an important family celebration in the city and the hotel organized a pick-up at the airport as well as the transportation to the airport at departure, it all worked as intended without problems. At arrival early in the morning the hotel gave a glass of wine at the terrace thus starting our celebrations, and they recommended a very good and affordable restaurant for our dinner later. The staff in the hotel is very friendly and most helpful. The rooms, we had seven, were all nice and clean. Jan S.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel, fantastic staff and service”
Reviews.Author: SanFran11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem! Terrific location and accommodations, but the absolutely outstanding staff really made our stay memorable. Barbara and Gabriele went out of their way in recommending restaurants (as well as advising which of our choices were not great), what to see and things we should do. They, together with Valentina and the rest of the front desk staff, really made our stay unforgettable. Hotel Campo di Fiori is in a great location in the old city within easy walking distance to most attractions. It is in a vibrant area but with almost no traffic. The market and restaurants around the corner were always busy, but our room overlooking the Campo was wonderfully quiet. The room was not huge, but decent size with more than enough room and very nicely furnished. The contemporary bathroom was great. The hotel has a really wonderful roof deck with views in every direction. It was great to be able to read a book, enjoy the sunshine and a glass of wine and look out over Rome. Breakfast is in a charming breakfast room. The selection was very good and everything was well prepared. There had been a problem (beyond the control of the hotel) when we arrived. They did everything to ensure that we were not inconvenienced by it and then surprised us by very graciously paid the cost of our limo to the airport. We could not recommend this hotel more highly. Thanks to all those who alerted us to this gem on Tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at Hotel Campo De' Fiori”
Reviews.Author: Iamzediam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed an incredible 4 day stay at Camp De' Fiori. The hotel is situated in an ideal location that enables guests to easily reach all the wonderful attractions in Rome. Our room size, although economical, was comfortable, well appointed and quiet. What sets this hotel apart from others we have stayed is the staff. The attitude of the entire staff is nothing less than remarkable. I had numerous email conversations with Matteo and Barbara prior to our arrival. They could not have been more enthusiastic and helpful with all of our questions and requests. I am truly grateful for all of their assistance in planning our stay in Rome. I'm sure there are many luxurious places to stay in Rome, but if you are looking for a well located, comfortable 4 star hotel with a staff that truly wants to make your stay special, then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: prettymongoose
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed in one room here for four nights before the departure of our Seabourn cruise. It proved to be an excellent choice. To put the review in context, please know that I am one of those travelers who values architecture, design, and a special sense of place more than a mini fridge and closet space. Location: I've stayed in three different Rome hotels, including one 5-star, and this is by far the best. The location is hard to beat. Not only is it close to the historic sites and monuments you want to see (Pantheon, Forum, Trevi, etc.) but it's adjacent to the "real" Rome--the neighborhoods where the restaurants, shops, and streets bustle with Italians and not everyone is clutching a guidebook. The service: The concierges, especially Daniella, were incredibly helpful, setting up everything from a private tour (tip: Do NOT try to get into the Colosseum or Vatican without a private guide--you'll spend your entire vacation waiting on line) to airport transfers and dinner reservations, all of which were great. Our favorite restaurant in Rome, by the way, is nearby Riccioli Cafe (Via delle Coppelle 13). The atmosphere is relaxed, the prices are modest, but the wine list comes in two volumes and the food is impressive, even to this New Yorker. The hotel: The hotel itself is very charming although we crammed my tall, 12 year-old daughter into our room and it made for tight quarters. We stayed in the main hotel and not the apartments because I'd rather be cramped than give up an ounce of charm. The bathroom had a shower, no tub, but was attractive and sleekly modern. The room itself was charming and the beds were comfortable. If you've stayed in Rome before, you know that's a rarity! If we had been traveling as a couple, l would have tried to get one of the more romantic rooms on the top floor but otherwise, I have no complaints. We experienced none of the problems with the cleaning service that other reviewers reported. Other notes: The rooftop terrace is indeed very special although during our stay, it was strictly BYOB and snacks. From reading the other reviews, I had got the impression that the hotel serves snacks and drinks up there. The buffet breakfast consisted of fruit, cheeses, meats, cereals, yogurt, pastries, breads and rolls with an attendant serving hot beverages. The cappuccino was delicious but the juices tasted oddly artificial and sugary. We love Campo De'Fiori and will happily stay there again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: sondra62
Reviews.Content: I would so recommend this hotel for the location, the accomodations, the friendliness of the staff and the amazing roof garden. I thank Travel Advisors for sending us in the right direction in the first place

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service-A very unique experience”
Reviews.Author: vivek000
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel Campo de Fiori in late April on our honeymoon. We thought the hotel was almost ideally located, very close to all the sites and some interesting restaurants nearby. Pros: 1. Service: The employees at the hotel were flawless. Everything we asked for was taken care of, and they are genuinely nice people. 2. The room was neat and cleaned well each day. Also, it had good sound proofing from the nearby street, which can become noisy at night (especially near the weekend). 3. Breakfast: In a really beautiful room downstairs they serve breakfast. It isn't a complicated affair, but decent enough in selection. 4. Complimentary wi-fi. I really think this is now a must for travel. Being able to stay connected is so useful, and make planning your daily trip a lot easier. Cons: 1. The room we stayed in was small. My guess is that this is pretty much par for the course in any great city on the continent. 2. The decoration in the room is nicely done, but was not to our taste. It seemed somewhat dark. Although, to be honest, we didn't spend a lot of time here. 3. Don't take the guided tour! It is not worth it! I will go into this last one in more detail. We took a 3 hour private guided tour of the Vatican Museum arranged by the hotel and it cost us around $240 USD (2 people). The guide was competent, but she overcharged by $20 USD (which the hotel helped us get refunded). For what the guide offered, I thought the tour was unexceptional. You are better off getting into a tour group, you learn all the same things. I think the cost is the same for 4 people, so in that case the private tour only costs about 2X per person compared to a group price. 4. The market next door seems like a great idea, but it really is not that great. The prices are high and selection in limited. Two final recommendations. Try the pizza in the bakery in the back corner of the Campo de Fiori. Everything there is quite good. Also make a right out of the hotel, and travel across the plaza. As you go down one more street, you will see a small wine bar on the left. They have very nice wines and desserts.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: rolandsf
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Campo de' Fiori! The location was ideal, in walking distance of the main sites. The owners obviously take great pride in their hotel. It is very tastefully decorated and impeccably maintained. The hotel's roof deck offers stunning views of the city and is ideal for receiving guests, relaxation, or sunbathing. The front-desk staff, Barbara and Andrea, are exceptional, and gave us great recommendations for restaurants (Roscioli Restaurant, Via dei Giubbonari--a 5-minute walk) and what to see and do. Their polish and warmth were a highlight of our stay. Our room, though not large, was good size by Roman standards. It was nicely appointed, comfortable, and quiet. We will definitely recommend Hotel Campo de' Fiori to all of our friends planning a Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with perfect location and unbeatable staff”
Reviews.Author: radiospike
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a really nice room, clean and comfortable, and a great breakfast. The rooftop terrace was the perfect place to enjoy each night after a busy day or touring. The location is perfect - easily within walking distance from the major Rome attractions. But the real hidden gem of Campo De' Fiori is the staff. Barbara, Valentina and the other staff at the front desk were very helpful and courteous. When I wanted a private tour guide for the Roman Forum, they found a great one for us within minutes. When I asked for restaurant recommendations, they made reservations for us at the best restaurants in town. They made my birthday and our second honeymoon unforgettable. This beautiful hotel is right on one of the most charming squares in Europe, you will not regret using Campo De' Fiori as your home away from home in Rome... I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Doing Rome right”
Reviews.Author: Tsf14
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo di Fiori was an ideal getaway for my wife and I on our recent trip to Rome. The location is absolutely ideal for immersing yourself in the old city. We were in a walking distance of everything from the coliseum to the Vatican to Piazza Navona. Our private balcony was geougeous and the rooftop terrace breathtaking. You could feel the electricity coming off of the bustling campo de Fiori each evening. The market each morning was also a treat. The staff was incredibly helpful and recommended great restaurants around the hotel and over the river in Tresteverre. The only downside was the bed, which was a bit hard. However, we found this to be the norm in many of the hotels we stays at in Italy. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful city, beautiful hotel and beautiful staff”
Reviews.Author: jrusso46
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome and this location was preferred because we had a large group (8) ages 6 to 60 and we like to walk. Other than the Vatican and Sistine Chapel (private guide set up by Hotel - recommend highly no lines, very educational) we walked everywhere. Along the way we enjoyed the many restaurants and shops of Rome. Campo De Fiori fit our bill perfect, we rented apartments, they were very spacious and allowed us to relax in a home atomosphere after our daily excursions then come back and relax in an apartment setting (living area and kitchenette).The hotel part had a roof deck for early evening relaxation of wine, salami, cheese and bread (all purchased in adjacent piazza). The staff was the best part, alway smiling, proficient in english (and patient with our attempt to speak italian) and always ready to assist. The made tour reservations, dinner reservations, transportation requests and hauled our 12 bags in and out of van and up and down the stairs. We found Italy in general to be very efficient, and our hotel apartment was just that, all we needed for a comfortable stay. it is not a 5 star luxury all amenity hotel, just a perfect place to stay to experience Rome and all it has to offer and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Syshadd
Reviews.Content: We went there for five days in beginning of June, and what an amazing place to discover the city!! Its central location in the heart of Rome makes it really easy to discover the main attractions on foot. And by the end of a busy day, you can go on the roof terrasse and see an awesome panorama of the city while drinking a glass of prosecco. We had a deluxe room, and everything was as seen on photos. It was really quiet, and clean. The decoration was romantic, and the bathroom brand new. We would have appreciated a bath though. Service at the desk and breakfast was incredible. Staff members talks at least english, french and italian of course, and are more than happy to help for reservations and advices in general. I would highly recommend this hotel, and go back there for my next Roman vacations!!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SophieAms
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel - it is in a great neighbourhood and good location for accessing not only the famous sights of Rome, but also less touristy areas and eating places, such as the pop up bars by thw river. We received a free upgrade to an amazing room on the top floor with its own balcony - a very special room. The hotel has a beautiful roof terrace, where you can bring your own drinks etc and watch the sun set over Rome. The hotel staff were also extremely helpful and friendly. Only downside was that breakfast is served in a dark room on the bottom floor, and while it had a wide selection, wasnt amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ajdgpark
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel after reading about it on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. On booking we opted for pick up from the airport (FCO) which the Hotel arranged. On our arrival we were collected by a smartly dressed man who showed us to our car, a Mercedes E Class. Very nice. We would recommend this as the most stress free way to get from the airport to the Hotel. Well worth the 50 Euros. On arrival at the hotel reception, we were greeted by very friendly staff and checked in quickly and efficiently. We were given a map and initial directions to all the local sites.
