We had booked a deluxe double. Although this was not the largest room that we have ever stayed in, it was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated and furnished. Similarly, the shower room, whilst small was immaculate and ornate. To our delight we were at the back of the hotel and found the room to be very quiet, despite our proximity to Campo De' Fiori. The room had a very small balcony, which we never used, except for drying the occasional item of clothing. Breakfast was another pleasant surprise and surpassed our expectations of a 'continental breakfast'. The breakfast room was a converted cellar and was beautifully presented - the choice were good and the quality equally so - the service at breakfast was also always excellent. This hotel is very centrally located and within 20 minutes leisurely walk from all the main visitor attractions. One of the best features of this hotel is it's stunning roof top terrace which provides a fantastic place to relax and enjoy the wonderful vistas of Rome. Although the hotel does not have a restaurant or a bar, the hotel staff are quite prepared to allow guests to bring in their own food and drink purchased from the many local markets. There was nothing quite like sitting on the roof terrace during the day, or night, sipping wine and just relaxing amongst the well cared for flowers and plants arranged about the smart terrace furniture. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It offers excellent value for money, a great location, good rooms and service. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “DREAM HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: suzannerose
Reviews.Content: I took my 2 adult daughters and my mother to this hotel after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor. It was all that everyone said and more! It is a perfect little hotel right on the Campo di Fiori,which we all LOVED. It is close to everything and easy to find. The Rooms were SPECTACULAR! it truly is what you want your first,(and last), experience to be in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel centrally located in Rome”
Reviews.Author: OrpheusTexas
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from Italy and stayed at the Hotel Campo dei Fiori in Rome. We enjoyed the wonderful location of the hotel at the Campo de Fiori which is a fun place at night and transforms into a food market at daytime. You are within a few minutes walk of the Vatican, major sites like the Trevi Fountain and of a wide array of dining options. The hotel rooms are well appointed. We were a big group and booked several rooms/dependences. The room on the sixth floor with a balcony was very romantic. The dependences are bigger and provide more liberty and flexibility. Do not miss the rooftop garden with it's view of Rome. It is great place to hang out with a bottle of wine or limoncello after a full day of sightseeing. The staff are friendly and very helpful in booking tours and restaurants. They respond promptly to my email requests even prior to arrival in Rome. We look forward to staying at the same hotel on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great but noisy location, not happy with the appartment”
Reviews.Author: mcluxiland
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome by car (a jeep with rooftop) and thus were limited as we needed a secure place to park our car. This was all available in a nearby garage 5 minutes from the hotel (you will need to leave your spare key, and it costed 100 euros for 2 nights 1 day.). The hotel staff was very friendly and organised the vatican tour for us with a guide highly recommend it, Massimo our guide also made it interesting for our children. Whilst i cannot judge on the hotel I was really disappointed by the appartment, it was very close to the hotel, but the ground floor was all boarded up with graffiti, we stayed on the first floor it was very gloomy and dark and the air conditioning was only in the living room where our two children slept, so they got quite cold as we needed it on high to have the cold come to our bedroom. The shower cubicle leaked and after 4 of us showering we had a bit of a flood in the bathroom which was very tiny. my 9 year old daughter was frightened at night and spend the night in our bed. The campo de fiori piazza is very noisy both at night and early in the morning as they set up the market but I believe that is Rome in most places. We had breakfast at the hotel which we found overpriced and not fantastic as it was not included in our overnight rate. Again the hotel may be fine I cannot comment but I would not choose the appartments again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: IrishAli
Reviews.Content: We were booked here for 6 nights, but only stayed 5. When we arrived, we were notified that there was some sort of maintenance issue on our floor and they moved us to another hotel around the corner, to a room that was not nearly as nice as the room we ended up in the the HCF. It was disappointing. They did, however, move our luggage back over the next day to our fixed room while we were out sightseeing. The room was very nice, and the roof deck area is spacious and gorgeous. We sent every evening up there with wine. Except the first night, because the interim hot had no roof deck, which is why we booked this hotel in the first place.....but anyway. I felt that they should have offered us something for the inconvenience....we had to wake up extra early to pack our luggage before we left for an early tour on our Honeymoon, and it left a bad taste in my mouth. When I mentioned it to the front desk ( our unhappiness with the lack of roof deck, having to get up early), I was met with a shrug. Other than that, our stay was nice. The hotel has an ideal location. You can really walk anywhere in Rome within 25 minutes. The rooftop is amazing. Tip....go to the grocery store on the other side of the church of San Andrea Della Valle for snacks and cheap wine to consume on the roof. Also, you can get pizzas to go and eat up there for dinner on the cheap. There is plenty of seating and tables. The breakfast is ok. The front desk is helpful The cleaning ladies MOVE EVERYTHING. It took me 30 minutes one night to locate a bag, which had been 'hidden' behind the curtains. My husband's boxers were folded up and put in the closet ( from the top of his luggage, which was on the floor!). It took us even longer to find our displaced camera chargers....which had been removed and put away from an outlet. All in all, a nice place for not a crazy amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great value, great location..”
Reviews.Author: melinda075
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments right off the square. It was fun waking up to the hustle and bustle of the markets right outside out door. It was 41 in Rome that week so the a/c was a relief to have. The outdoor terrace was charming although we did not get to completely take advantage of it because of the heat. It was handy being able to use the hotels wifi on the terrace as well as the lobby, although it does not reach the apartments. The front desk arranged for a driver to take us to the airport. I realized just before I went through immigration. Had left my I pad in the van. Silly of me! I really thought I would never see it again and I felt sick to my stomach. I rang Adam at reception and he quickly contacted the driver and within 30 minutes I had it. I was very grateful!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, but housekeeping little heavy-handed”
Reviews.Author: kitty56003
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing and the rooftop terrace was awesome. The price is not bad when you compare the hotel to others of it's class. Only thing: they have a policy that the housekeepers should move your stuff around to provide a sense of "order". For us, this turned out really bad because they moved --all-- our stuff around. I couldn't find my bag -- found it later on a shelf in a closet we weren't using. My razor was missing form the shower. I never found it. :-( It had sentimental value. We asked them twice to stay out of our room, but they went in anyway and moved things around again. The reception staff was very polite and they talked to the housekeeping staff so maybe it won't be a problem for anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: caroline456
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July. Our room was lovely. Although it was small, there was still plenty of space for our luggage and I rate character over size any day. The room was beautifully decorated and furnished, and kept spotlessly clean. Breakfast is very good with a wide range of fresh bread, ham, cheese, cakes and fruit. The lady who served us at breakfast was very cheerful and friendly, even early in the morning! The reception staff are very helpful and friendly and their restaurant recommendations were very good. We had a small issue with our credit card being billed in the wrong currency but they sorted the problem by email extremely quickly and to our satisfaction. Finally, the location of the hotel is excellent. All of the main sights are within an easy walking distance and there are numerous buses that pass close by. From the Leonardo da Vinci airport, we took the train to Trastavere and from there, tram 8 to Via Arenula. From Via Arenula, it is about 3-5 mins walk (depending on your pace!). At €9 per person, this is cheaper alternative to a taxi (which costs a flat rate of €40) for a couple. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will hopefully return there myself one day!

Reviews.Title: “I loved Hotel Campo De' Fiori”
Reviews.Author: MarianneZ74
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about Hotel Campo De' Fiori and I would definitely stay there the next time I visit Rome. The size of the room didn't matter to me at all since it was so beautiful with a very good air conditioner and the beds were so comfortable. The room was very quiet too. The bathroom was very large with marble and a big shower that I loved. The hotel staff were very helpful with any questions that I had and made all the phone calls that I needed. I loved the square with the fruit and vegetable market that was open every morning. It was so nice coming back after a long day of walking and going up to the terrace to read my book and from where I was sitting I could see so much of Rome. The location was perfect with easy walking almost anywhere and the restaurants, bakeries and everything nearby were perfect too.

Reviews.Title: “Book this one for the rooftop terrace alone!”
Reviews.Author: EUROPE2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully furnished, very clean, and the room rate included a very nice European-style breakfast buffet. The front desk staff was excellent. Our room was beautifully furnished, impeccably clean, and the ac worked perfectly, which is important during the summer months in Rome. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were of a higher quality than most hotels. The very best thing about this hotel for us was the large rooftop terrace. It was a great place to meet other travelers and enjoy the sunset with a glass of wine, and the 360-degree views were spectacular. Our only disappointment was the size of our room, since we had upgraded to a superior room we expected something a bit larger than the room we received. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sjerbullard
Reviews.Content: Great way to end our vacation in Europe. Althought the rooms were small- they had great amenities. State of the art sound system in bath from the TV (framed/mounted on the wall) Good variety for breakfast served downstairs. Very happy/friendly staff and service. They even outlined a walking guide for my family to see every major site - since we were on a limited time line. Recommended great restaurants. The staff organized our taxis to the Vatican and airport. The hotel is located in a lovely piazza with many restaurants and shops. This is a great place to stay! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: laminva71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and was easy to get to all of the sites. The staff was very helpful and answered all of our questions. The room was comfortable and the breakfasts were delicious. We would definitely stay there again if and when we return to Rome. Louise and Nelson Milder

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the apartments.... NOT the same as hotel!”
Reviews.Author: manny0210
Reviews.Content: Not normally one to complain, however we booked into this hotel on recommendation from a 'couple' not family who stayed at the hotel. The apartment we stayed in directly opposite the hotel was horrible. I could go into detail but why bother all I can say is if you go there as a family specifcally request NOT to stay in the above mentioned apartment. After complaining we were moved to another of the hotels apartments which was much better. When you are paying 4 star prices you expect better than they were offering. To make matters worse there was a gentleman checking out when we were leaving that was raving about how wonderful the hotel was.... it was too much to listen to. If only our experience had been the same.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place in a beautiful area!”
Reviews.Author: staciesteele
Reviews.Content: We stayed at one of the apartments owned by the hotel. It was very spacious and had everything we needed. The hotel staff were tremendously helpful in helping us navigate the area and in making dinner recommendations/reservations. They did not let us down!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Italian”
Reviews.Author: va408
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff take the highest rating. We traveled to multiple places on this trip and Campo De' Fiori staff win hands down. From the moment we arrived they provided us with useful information until we departed. Even before we arrived they sent us email offering help. The room was charming and the location was the best. We were able to walk every where. The restaurants around the hotel are excellent and reasonably priced. I will definitely stay there again when I travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: parismuse
Reviews.Content: This lovely boutique hotel right off the Campo dei Fiori, within walking distance of all of Rome's major attractions, is a real find. The rooms are immaculate, and lovingly decorated with beautiful, rich jewel tones. The bed was very comfortable, and though the bathroom was small, it had every amenity. There is a beautiful rooftop sitting area, and several rooms (including the one we had) boast a private balcony with a view of either St. Peter's or the Emmanuele Vittore monument. Last but definitely not least, the staff is just superb! From the moment we first checked in (we came back and forth three times, from various points in Italy), we were made to feel like family. Gabrieli, Barbara and Valentina cheerfully helped us with restaurant suggestions, heavy baggage, ice for my husband's sore tendon, a well-timed bottle of Prosecco -- every request handled with a warm smile and a can-do attitude. Breakfasts also were lovely, served in the welcoming breakfast room the basement. We loved this place so much we are already planning our trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Shining Star in Rome”
Reviews.Author: djthomas336
Reviews.Content: As someone who works in the hotel industry, my standards are quite high. This hotel lived up to my standards and exceeded them in every aspect. Upon check in we were warmly welcomed and invited to the rooftop terrace to relax and enjoy the magnificent view. The view is breathtaking and we enjoyed it several times during our stay in the morning and the evenings. The Front Desk staff is very personable and knowledgeable of Rome. Explicit directions and highlights of this vast city made it easy to navigate to all of the attractions. The very modern bathroom and extremely clean bedroom with soundproof windows made for a good nights sleep and afternoon siesta. Breakfast was served in the beautiful lower level that was serene and elegant as well as deliciously prepared. A lovely way to begin the morning. The Campo De' Fiori is away from the extreme hustle and bustle of this exciting city yet close enough to be walking distance to all major attractions. Cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SherandPat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Campo De" Fiori looked as beautiful as the photographs on the internet and the service exceeded all of our expectations. The location was perfect. We could walk most places or take a quick taxi. From the moment we entered the hotel we fell in love with the colors and decorations both in the lobby and rooms. It made us feel that we were stepping back in time. The service was personal and extremely attentive. The desk staff conversed in fluent english and strove to make our stay enjoyable. They suggested tours which turned out to be excellent. They made sure that each day we were going somewhere good and made suggestions for other places that we might like. No question was too small or silly to ask. Although our room was small by U.S. standards, it was perfect. It became our oasis in the middle of the city. Each day we returned in late afternoon and took our siesta. The thick doors and windows shutout the world for an hour or two. Before going out we would visit their rooftop deck which gave us a view of all of Rome. Don't miss it when you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Rome fun and easy”
Reviews.Author: My2Cintz
Reviews.Content: My wife just got back from 5 nights at the Hotel Camp De' Fiori. We stayed in one of the apartments and were very pleased with the accommodations and extremely impressed with the service. The staff at the front desk went out of their way offer suggestions and to book reservations for transportation, museums, even a private guide for the Vatican Tour (highly recommended by the way - lets you bypass the long lines completely). The hotel has a lovely rooftop terrace with incredible views of the city and a great place for a bottle of wine in the cool evening hours. The location of the hotel puts it close to all the major attractions and within walking distance of dozens of great restaurants and shops. On our trip to Italy we stayed in hotels and apartments in Venice, Florence, Cinque Terre and Rome. Hotel Campo De' Fiori was the best by far. You will not find a more helpful desk staff anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: tamblers
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure to spend a few days at this hotel. The staff were gracious and helpful, the hotel was beautiful and the location could not have been better. Not cheap but definitely worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: rbaker336
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Campo De Fiore for three nights this month. The location is wonderful; it's walking distance to all major points of interest. Quintessential Rome yet not as hectic or crowded as some other locations. The views from the rooftop terrace can't be beat, and the ambiance of the breakfast room is quite charming. We loved the decor of the entire hotel and enjoyed the comfort of our guest room and the modern bathroom. However, after saying this I must add that the best part of the hotel was the front desk staff. Friendly and helpful, they turned our time in Rome into an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: markandsue-84
Reviews.Content: It is quite expensive to stay here, but there are alot of great reasons why you should ! The location is perfect - 20 mins walk (in different directions) to all the main attractions- situated on a narrow cobbled street, covered in ivy on the outside, the Hotel Campo di ' Fiori has charm and a warm welcoming feel to it. The hotel is traditionally decorated and the rooms quite oppulant - yes the rooms are on the small side, but this is a 'small' hotel, and I think you will find the size typical of hotel rooms in cities around Europe. I would suggest booking a superior room to get a little more space. We stayed in room 501 - it was lovely (decorated in green and gold) with 2 floor to ceiling windows with shutters opening out looking across at a tiny square. The Campo di'Fiori which is situated right around the corner from the hotel, has a great market during the day, in the evening it is the 'happening' place with the 'young' and particularly in the weekend, it can get quite rowdy, however the double windows blocked out any noise. The roof top terrace is fabulous, and well used. With a number of separate areas where you can take your bottle of wine and watch the sunset in the evening, relax and read a book during the day, or just sit and 'chill' and take it all in. From here across the rooftops you can see the dome of St Peters, the dome of the Pantheon and many church bells dotted around - and the striking stark white Vittoria Emanuelle II monument in the distance. There is a wonderful traditional deli on a corner of the Campo that sells wine, and good quality deli items, cheeses and cold meats, etc. The basement breakfast room is lovely, and they provide a very good breakfast. I read comments from others not happy with the breakfast selection - we stayed in 7 different hotels during our trip, and this was definitely one of the best we had. There was lovely fresh fruit salad each day, and a 'hot dish' usually scrambled egg, plus all the usual breakfast offerings, cereal, yoghurt pastries, cold meats, cheeses etc. and great Cappuccinos. The hotels staff were excellent and so helpful. Gabrielle and Barbara left a lasting impression, they were so friendly and helpful. Barbara helped us make some further travel arrangements and their recommendations for restaurants were really good. Gabrielle gave us the name of a restaurant where his parents go to, for our next stop Siena, we had the best meal of our trip (went back twice). There are alot of negative comments about the apartments - they are not decorated the same as the hotel , but are appointed in a fashion that a family can stay and cook for themselves and have some extra room that a hotel room would not be able to offer them - in a hotel you would have to pay for 2 rooms to accommodate more than 3 people. They are basic, but clean - and typical of living in an apartment in the middle of a big city. I think people expect they are going to an apartment building - but they are separate apartments doted around in buildings close to the hotel, most off the Campo itself. You have to look at the apartments as completely separate to the hotel altogether. Anyway, this is a review of the hotel not the apartments. But we did take a look at the apartments for future reference. I have thrown plenty of coins in the fountain to ensure my return to Rome, and the Hotel Campo di'Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a minute”
Reviews.Author: CfbGuilford
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel!!!! The staff is remarkable and the rooftop is great!!! The rooms are clean and comfortable and you can't beat the location. Valentina arranged our transport and tours and restaurant choices. She is great. The whole staff responded to all of my emails and made our traveling that much easier. Thanks campo for a great time

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: rpcjr18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Hotel Campo de Fiori for two nights, one night each on the front and back end of a 10-day Mediterrean cruise. This hotel is in a great location within walking distance of all the major attractions and close to Trestevere where there are many superb dining options. We stayed in one of the apartments on the front end of our cruise which are located about two blocks from the main hotel building. The room was spacious, well equipped and a very nice modern bathroom. It was not what I would call overly elegant. A couple of drawbacks....we were on the fourth floor with no elevator access although hotel staff gladly carried our five suitcases up four flights of stairs. Secondly, we found the noise level from outside to be a minor distraction. Although the apartments are removed from the main hotel we found them to be very secure and felt very safe. On the back end of our cruise we stayed in the main hotel and found our room to be much smaller than the apartment but very luxurious, modern and a very nice modern bathroom. The main hotel has elevator access and beautiful rooftop terraces. Our room in the main hotel was on the fifth floor and was a deluxe king. The cost was 15 euros more than the apartment and we personally found the room in the main hotel to be much better for us. Besides a great location the best thing this hotel has going for it has a very friendly and accomodationg staff. We booked private tours through them prior to leaving home. They arranged a tour of the Vatican as well as the Colesseum/Roman Forum. The guides were both extremely knowledgeable. I always found the staff quick to respond to my emails. Our original flight to Rome was cancelled. I emailed hotel staff from the airport and asked them to rebook our airport transfer as well as Vatican tour. They emailed me back within an hour saying everything was taken care of. I would definitely stay here again as well as recommend this fine boutique hotel to close friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but noisy whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: Georgios77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in June 2011 with my wife for our honeymoon. The hotel is in almost every aspect excellent. The most impressive thing is its roof garden, where you can enjoy your wine with a great view of Rome day and night. The only problem of the hotel is the very very busy street in front of it. Although the windows offer quite good isolation, the young Italians hanging around dont stop to shout until 2 in the morning. As we also returned from our walk also around 1 or 2 o'clock, it was not a big problem for us. But I can understand that it can be very annoying for people wanting to sleep at 23. Otherwise a marvelous boutique hotel with lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with staff to match!”
Reviews.Author: RibbleValleySteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in early May, I had chosen the hotel based on tripadvisor reccomendations, not something I have done before so was slightly nervous. However prior to our arrival I had contacted the hotel on several occasions with various requests. Each time I received a prompt, helpful and friendly response, which eased any concerns I may have had. On arrival we were greeted by the lovely Valentina, who along with all the staff made us feel pampered throughout our stay. The hotel itself is beautifuly appointed both public areas and the rooms, with the pretty roof garden as a bonus. Location is excellent for all the main tourist sites and was also close enough for us to walk acroos the river to Trastevre most evenings. I would struggle to fault this hotel on anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - love the roof top”
Reviews.Author: SGS95
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two nights of our trip to Italy here. It is a wonderfully central spot, making it easy to walk to all of the sights - Vatican in one direction, Forum etc the other. Be sure to stroll around at night. Our room was on the smaller side, but very clean, well decorated with a nice modern bath. Breakfast was the normal meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, etc. Plenty to get yourself ready for the day. Free wi-fi for those making the next days plans. The staff was always friendly and helpful with recommendations. The square right out front is vibrant with various markets depending on the time of day, and lots of places to eat. On our last night, we were simply exhausted from our trip, and just bought some crackers and cheese and a bottle of wine, and spent the evening on the roof top deck relaxing and watching the sun set over Rome. Overall, you pay a little more for this location, but it was well worth it and made for a wonderful finish to a trip to remember.

Reviews.Title: “One of the loveliest hotels we ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: alinvicen
Reviews.Content: This was definitely one of the loveliest hotels we ever stayed in. We got two nights in one of the rooms decorated in green and gold colors, and had an amazing view of Rome from our balcony. Facing a smaller piazza next to Campo dei Fiori we could see all the way to the Vittorio Emanuele monument, which looks even more beautiful when lit up at night. We had already stayed at another hotel in Rome that week but decided to spend two nights here so that we could experience this side (location wise) as well. After visiting Vatican City we actually spent most of our time left on the lovely hotel balcony though. During our second evening we found a small kitchen nearby that sold nice focaccias, which we brought back to our room along with a bottle of Italian wine. It truly doesn’t get better than that (and Hotel Campo De’Fiori was a big part of it). The bedroom was beautifully decorated and had a romantic feeling. Everything was clean, we had a fresh bathroom, and we never heard anything from surrounding rooms. We also enjoyed the breakfast which was served in a beautiful dining room and had a lot to choose from when it came to the food. The only bad thing we had to say afterwards was that the staff somehow mixed our invoice with someone else’s, and I think we ended up paying a little more than we should have. Still, it was worth it, and apart from that the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with apartment at hotel campo de' fiori”
Reviews.Author: simonrthomas
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my wife and two children aged 13 and 11 for a short break to Rome so as they could see some of the famous sites. I booked the two bedroom apartment as it suited us. We were very happy with the apartment, we were able to let the kids enjoy themselves without the pressure of being in a hotel. We had croissants in the morning from the local baker, and fresh fruit from the Market in the square behind. We were situated a short 10 minute walk from Piazza Navona and 20 minutes from the colleseum. Location was absolutely perfect. The one thing that made our stay perfect was the helpful and friendly staff at the hotel reception, they could not have done anymore to make us more welcome, from advising us on different trips, organising a personal guide to arranging a car to collect us and take us back to the airport. As previously mentioned the square behind the hotel has a daily Market and there are numerous restaurants there as well, location A1. If we return to Rome we will definately stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: h2obury21
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews for this hotel and decided to cancel our stay at another hotel and stay here. We were not disappointed. The staff is so friendly and helpful. They showed us how to get to everything before we even asked, and they even helped us pick out a nice place to eat. The room we stayed in was a little small, but decorated so elegantly it didn't matter. The only negative is that I think they clean with vinegar, so the smell was overwhelming right when you walked into the room, but the smell goes away after about 30 minutes. The breakfast that was included was great, and the room it was set up in was so quant. We ended our trip with take away from one of the resturants that are located extremely close and sat on the rooftop and relaxed. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Its close to a lot of the attractions and the Piazza that is a few blocks away is great if you just want to get something to eat and sit around enjoying the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MollyRose22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights whilst touring Rome. An ideal location to see all the great sights. A fantastic roof-top terrace with the most beautiful all round views. Great staff, lovely clean rooms although slightly on the small side but didnt spoil our time here. Nice breakfast. although I would have preferred fresh orange juice and the milk to be cold. Great area with market every day. Night time is so lively and just a buzz, loved being amongst it all. Loved Rome and the whole atmosphere it was magical. Thank you Campo De'Fiori. I would return. x p.s The Hotel have agreed to return an item that we left behind - thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A great rustic hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Liz1985
Reviews.Content: We had been recommended this hotel by friends who had previously stayed here. As with most people visiting Rome for the first time, we asked friends and family, and of course Trip Advisor, for ideas of places to stay, and this hotel certainly did not disappoint. The hotel is packed full of rustic charm and Italian character, set just off the bustling Camp De' Fiori. From the moment we entered the hotel, we were greeted with a warm welcome and extremely helpful staff. Even though we didn't have the largest of rooms, the room itself was perfect for our needs and came with a spectacular view over the city and a top-notch en suite. And better still, we were staying on the top floor, so we had easy access to the roof top terrace... The roof top terrace is breathtaking and is a real bonus for this hotel. Here we could experience all of the sights and sounds of the city whilst enjoying a glass of wine. Even though the hotel itself doesn't have a bar, they encourage guests to bring their own drinks to enjoy on the terrace and even recommended a fantastic wine shop (Cul du Sac) just around the corner. This is a great location for those wanting to see the sights but don't want to stay in a generic chain hotel. It is set in complete walking distance to all the major sights and Campo De' Fiori itself is a wonderful place to eat, drink and enjoy the daily food and flower markets. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic we loved every minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: Robyn006
Reviews.Content: Great service lovely reception team and breakfast was beautiful and lovely lady who waas serving at this time. We stayed three nights on our first part of our trip then three weeks later decided to leave where we were and headed "home to Rome" that was how we felt about Hotel Camo di Fiori and Rome as a city. Highly recommend this boutique hotel which is so comfortable and centrally located. Thanks for having us we didn't mind paying the account :):)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Great Service & Terrace- A home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: decaturd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Camp De Fiori for 3 wonderful nights this May. The staff was awesome, they went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. They helped us find great restaurants and were always welcoming the minute you walked in the door. Smiles always! The hotel was very clean,the breakfast hit the spot and was great as well, the rooms were beautiful along with the window that opens up to all the sounds of Rome. There is a great market in the mornings , it was wonderful to pick up pizzas , fruits and wine and bring it to their AWESOME roof top terrace! It is a breathtaking 360 degree view of Rome, we would hang out here at night after a long day walking the streets of Rome. The staff even took care of us when we were not staying there, upon our checkout(we were dissapointed to leave but were on our way to Sorrento for 4 days) we mentioned we were staying our last night before we left Italy in the Hilton by the airport for an early flight. They said well rather than sitting at the hotel at the airport come by Hotel Campo de fiori you can leave your bags here, shop and eat and then we will get our driver to take you to the Hilton.....And they did it was great! The service, hotel and the area are wonderful , its so centrally located for walking, we would reccomend this hotel to everyone, it was great!!! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: glynnlrigby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in april, we were in one of the apartments, the apartment was fine a sense of having our own place. The only problem with the apartment was the noise from outside caused by an echo from the tight alley outside, but the room was great, very spacious and clean. Light sleepers might find the noise an issue as it goes on till the early hours as you would expect in a city centre. The staff were very helpful, organizing tickets for the vatican etc, very happy with service. Rooftop terrace is beautiful, the location of the hotel is perfect, right in the centre, walking distance to everywhere. Would reccomend, great trip, thanks to the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this one!!”
Reviews.Author: DStriny
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay at this hotel. I am a classical orchestra conductor (Albany (NY) Symphony, London Philharmonia, Bulgarian National...) Upon entering this story book hotel I was struck by the fact that classical music was playing in all the common spaces. I knew that someone here knew what they were doing, techno music would have distracted from what the ambience reflected, and what the feeling and caring the hotel wanted to give its guests. A beautiful experience in the hotel which is surrounded by the Piazza that by day is a Flower Market and after Siesta is transformed into a very Romantic hideaway with wonderful restaurants and Italian music. Accross the street is the famous Piazza Navona. The rooms on the top floor have balconies that overlook Rome - also a roof deck to indulge in Prosecco all night - very special. I would never stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN ROME, IT SHOULD BE #1 On TripAdvisor!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: michel666
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel and concierge service you'll get any where in Italy, or Europe for that matter. I've lived in 6 countries and have travelled at least to 20, no place have I ever felt so welcomed and so taken care of. We didn't even stay here...... Ok here's what happened. My fiance and I chose this hotel on TA, but when we booked it, we booked through Travelocity.... CAUTION!! DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL THROUGH TRAVELOCITY!!! Travelocity, has the wrong link for this hotel, and thus we were accidentally booked at Campo de Fiori Apartments. However, we still didn't know this, until we were on the train from Venice to Rome, and called HOTEL Campo. The gentleman, Gabriel, was so kind, so helpful, and we realized that we don't have an address for the apartments we are suppose to go to....Travelocity didn't even have their address...and the office numbers they had were two years old and incorrect. Travelocity refused to provide support and help for us to find where we were suppose to go!!! We ended up staying at these apartments after many phone calls, etc. We went to the hotel to personally thank the staff there for helping us. Well we got to the HOTEL, and Gabriel and the rest of the staff treated us like family. They were extremely helpful, offered their beautiful roof deck to us at our leisure, booked private tours for us, gave us great restaurant recommendations and marked all the highlights on the map, and we weren't even staying there. We were truly overwhelmed by their kindness and generosity with their time and hospitality. Honestly, we thought we had no place to stay, on a train and heading into Rome, which we'd never been to.... and just hearing him say "don't worry, come here and we'll make sure you have a place to stay tonight. We'll call for you and figure this out" What more could I say!!! :))))))))))))))))

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Italyguy8
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest hotel in Rome - wonderful staff, great location, amazing rooftop terrace (one of the best in Rome) and the rooms are lovely. This time I stayed in a studio apartment, next to the hotel, and it was delightful - well appointed, daily maid service and very modern and clear. And the staff can't be beat! They will do anything for you.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous time! : )”
Reviews.Author: cnaviroj
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a family with 3 people in early twenties and 2 parents, totaling 5 - we stayed in the apartment style rooms and it can fit 4-5 people perfectly. There cannot be a place with a better location than this hotel! everything is within walking distance. Staffs were very friendly, especially Valentina, Gabriel, and another young person - they were like our friends and were very helpful in every aspect - day staffs are a bit friendlier than night time staffs. A side note: we took a look at the single/double rooms that are not apartment style and it was quite small, but very romantic. Overall, we were very satisfied and would highly recommend this hotel to other people traveling rome. ROME WAS SUPER AWESOME to say the absolute least.

Reviews.Title: “Magical space and maginficent location!”
Reviews.Author: frankie122344
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and it has only gotten better! The staff was professional. Fun, they made us smile and feel so very comfortable. Every hour of the day we were greeted by honest happy hospitality. The breakfast was so good and the young woman running the breakfast new our every need after our first visit. We asked for small plates and a knife for some appetizers we had on the terrace and the next evening when we returned, we had wonderful wine goblets and knives and forks and dished in our room. DO NOT miss out on the terrace. It is available to everyone and the views are stunning (it is why I keep going back). Sunset from there is magical. One more time, I can't say enough about how wonderful the staff was and how at home they made us feel. Thanks Campo de' Fiori!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: Silverspoon56
Reviews.Content: My husband just got back from Italy and this was overall one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in. I don't even know were to begin so I will start with the staff, Adam, Matteo,Valentina, Barbara, Gabriele and Roberto......they were helpful, friendly and extremely courteous. The Hotel had a magnificent roof top terrace with panoramic views of Rome, it was in a prime location. The Breakfast room was gorgeous. I could go on and on but the staff completed a really wonderful stay....in a really magnificent hotel. Can't wait to go back. Thank you to everyone! If you want to book private tours which we would highly recommend do it through the Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amscuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with Flavors of Rome and found it to be an excellent well located boutique hotel. It has a real Italian flavor while having a very friendly and knowledgable English speaking staff. We were there in between seasons (heat or AC) and it was unusually warm so we tried sleeping with the windows open but it was too noisy (we were in the front). The staff immediately produced a fan and with the windows closed all the noise was banished, after a couple of days they turned the AC on despite the early date. Whatever we needed they were there to help us and made us feel very welcome. The two level roof terrace with the view over Rome was a wonderful place to relax. Athough it only has a breakfast room, it is so well placed there are plenty of options around the corner or close by. Also enjoyed how central it was and easy to walk almost everywhere. If I came back to Rome by myself I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “MY SELECT ROME HOTEL FOR CLIENTS”
Reviews.Author: FlavorsofRome
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Rome visitor for the past 20 years and as the creator and host of Flavors of Rome culinary based tours (www.-------------.com), I selected Hotel Campo de Fiori for my clients on my April 2011 program. Although I knew the staff and was familiar with the layout and amenities of the hotel prior to this, my expectations were exceeded by the above and beyond service toward my clients which helped set the tone for a successful and glitch-free 7 day trip. The manager Matteo, Barbara, Valentina, Adam, and Gabriele at the front desk became my partners or the week-long tour - and my friends ever after. The location couldn't be better - walking distance to all the Rome essentials and surrounded by fabulous restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Nyeco
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel with small rooms in a fantastic location. Sadly over-priced for what you get. Notes for travellers: - WiFi is free but get a voucher from front desk for EACH device you want to use. - The aircon turns to heat automatically if you open the window. The recommended tour guide Eyes of Rome is fantastic and well worth it. The staff couldn't be more helpful and courteous. The bars in the Campo de Fiori are ok but go to the Trastevere for food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service but...”
Reviews.Author: milmil888
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Italy and my girlfriend and I decided to stay in a centrally located location. Like other reviewers' comments, you cannot find a better location in Rome - almost every attraction are within walking distance and tons of restaurants and bars around. Also a great rooftop but we didn't spend too much time there as we were too busy exploring the city. Service was also excellent and the staff are really friendly. Unfortunately we would probably try a different hotel next time we are in Rome as the size of the room is really really small. Also, the room was decorated in a way to fit in the building and surrounding (I guess) and as a result was very dark. The style of the bathroom is modern and I wish the rest of the room was decorated that way. A few other minor points: They don't provide a box of tissue in the room (I am sure they will give us one but I thought this is automatic in a hotel). Black coffee at breakfast has no taste (literally black water) and they serve the same thing at breakfast every single day. The last point was really annoying. Reserving online give you a 5% off but you have to pay by cash. They didn't mention that clearly during reservation and I only saw it on one of the paragraph on P.3 of my confirmation email but it was too late by the time I read it.

Reviews.Title: “Bella apartment in Bella Roma”
Reviews.Author: choochPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids for 3 nights in one of the apartments this hotel manages just off the Campo de' fiori. Easy check in and great assistance from reception throughout our stay. The apartment was 3 floors up winding old stairs which was fine for us but perhaps not if you've mobility issues or v young kids. It was large, airy, spotlessly clean, with modern fittings and well equipped kitchen. The location is brilliant - bought fresh fruit, veges, bread and meat every day at the Campo to cook with and picnic, back streets to explore, the best pizza in Rome at Buffetta around the corner, and fabulous city sights in walking distance. I'm sure there are cheaper options in Rome, but we would definitely pay extra to stay here again. Good points - roof garden on hotel - free wifi, brilliant view; location close to markets and attractions; helpful staff. Not so good - Campo is busy all night so bring earplugs if you're not used to sleeping with a bit of background noise; can't get wifi in apartments.

Reviews.Title: “A True Treasure”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaFenton
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo De' Fiori is a fabulous boutique hotel with a dedication to guest comfort. The exceptional staff - particularly Barbara, Gabriel and Franco made us fel as though we were their only guests at the hotel. The central location was perfect for visiting all of the major sites in Rome as well as very close to fantastic restaurants. The hotel has a beautiful, large roof top terrace that offers panoramic views of the city. The terrace was a wonderful spot to unwind each afternoon with a glass of wine. Thanks to the hotel for making our 30th wedding anniversary even more memorable!

Reviews.Title: “The roof terrace is worth the price alone!”
Reviews.Author: stuart641
Reviews.Content: Five-star service! The staff all spoke English and were extremely friendly and helpful. We loved the location on the plaza that is completely surrounded by restaurants so that after a day of walking all over, we were able to get a good meal just steps away. The hotel is within walking distance of most all of Rome's major attractions. The rooms are small but quite comfortable, and the beautiful, three-level roof top terrace offering sweeping views of Rome more than compensates. The complimentary breakfast was delicious. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel -- great location”
Reviews.Author: mliq
Reviews.Content: Jewel box rooms -- the room they first showed us was lovely but tiny (even though we booked a deluxe) but they quickly moved us to an equally lovely but larger room. Location is perfect, and the staff is welcoming and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “comfort, cleanliness, and convenience”
Reviews.Author: jaebirdsyracuse_NY
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever visited. Incredibly clean rooms, within walking distance to practically everything worth seeing in Rome. The staff is exceptional, and I have to name especially: Matteo, Adam, Valentina, and Barbara for their extraordinary, personalized service and help. Everyone went out of his/her way to be helpful and considerate to all the guests. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome; four nights was not long enough. I hope to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: pattythayer
Reviews.Content: Best hotel and location in Rome! The service and friendliness of the staff was exceptional. Thank you, Valentina, Barbara, Mateo, and everyone for making our group of 8 feel so welcome and at home in your hotel. We enjoyed all of our gatherings in the lobby living room and on the beautiful terrace with the spectacular views. My friend and I stayed in one of the hotel's comfortable apartments for 6 nights and our group stayed at the hotel for four nights. All rooms were clean, comfortable, and quiet. The hotel is in the center of Rome so the major sights and shopping areas are all within walking distance. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Quite brilliant”
Reviews.Author: dpfam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo de' Fiori proved to be a brilliant choice for our three night cultural tour of Rome. There is practically nothing I can fault about the place: it is gorgeously appointed, tasteful, chic, uber-convenient and - crucially - superbly well staffed and managed. I was travelling with my two children, aged 10 and 12, which may have been a problem for some hotels of this type and standard. Not so the Campo. Their staff were genuinly excellent, providing the warmest of welcomes, keeping us unbelievably well informed and being as flexible as we needed. Full marks.

Reviews.Title: “What a treasure within the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: 1stTrip2Italy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for our 25th anniversary trip. Even before we arrived, Gabriel helpted to make special arrangements for a stay in one of their apartments the other side of the Piazza which was wonderful for a 4-night stay. We felt as if we were living in a Roman community and were part of the daily life. Valentina was so friendly and helpful as she arranged a private tour for us and helped us locate a wonderful restaurant in her neighborhood. The location was the best! The rooftop terrace was beautiful and gave us wonderful views in three directions of landmarks we had visited. This will always be our choice whenever we return to Rome. It felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Campo De' Fiori was a perfect surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ChiKelly30
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this place! The location is great - central and within 20 min walking from most major Rome attractions. The hotel was adorable with ivy growing on the outside, tucked away in a square with a market open in the mornings. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The rooms were great. We actually stayed in one of their apartments at it was my husband and I with another couple. We would definitely go back and would recommend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in a Fantastic Location - Look no Further !”
Reviews.Author: sparkdog15
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller I am fortunate enough to have stayed in some very nice hotels throughout the world and the Campo de'Fiori is right up there as one of the nicest I have been to. It thoroughly deserves it's high-ranking here on tripadvisor and is definately somewhere I will come back to one day. The photo's on the hotel's website are a fair representation of the faciltiies which is reassuring amongst the hustle and bustle of 100's of city-centre hotels vying for your money. Location-wise it is perfect, set in the Centro Storico area of the city set on one corner of the Campo de'Fiori square, a market by day and a lively area of bars and restaurants by night. Mainly in a pedestrian area but take care to look out for the odd taxi, van or lorry that deliver people and goods to the square and rattle over the cobbled streets around the hotel and square. It looks amazing from the outside, covered in ivy and standing out from the faded decor that is typical of many Roman buildings. The staff are amazingly helpful, we arrived (using the hotel's private transfer from the airport which I highly recommend as a very easy and convenient way to get from the airport to the hotel front door and not much more expensive than a taxi) just before miday and the room we had booked was already available which is very unusual for city centre hotels and very welcome after an early start to get to Rome. Full of local information they provided us with not only a local map but a walking tour marked out to ensure we were able to take in all the sights. We didn't use any of the local guide services they offered but they seemed to be comprehensive and from reading other reviews appear to be good value for money. The (deluxe double) room we stayed in was excellent. A good size for a European city-centre hotel it was very tastefully decorated, had a large double bed, very large wardrobes, ample storage for clothes, flat-screen TV (which we didn't turn on) and an obligatory safe. Other reviews have mentioned the fridge, wine glasses and corkscrew which are extremely useful for a bottle of wine on the terrace at sunset. The bathroom was fabulously decorated and had a great walk-in shower with an outstanding rain-shower head. Our room faced a small interior courtyard which made it very peaceful but the streets outside are no noiser than any other city-centre and those that have complained about the noise in these reviews are making a fuss over nothing. Breakfast is good and served by a very cheerful and helpful lady who appears to be managing the service on her own very efficiently and expertly, a shining example of how good the hotel staff really are. Don't miss the 3-level rooftop terrace, mentioned elsewhere but definately worth taking a bottle of wine up to to watch the sun-set and take in the sights and sounds of this wonderful city. I mentioned location but it really is fantastic. You can walk everywhere, the Colosseum is around 20-30mins walk (get there early to avoid the long queues or haggle on price with one of the guides touting for business outside the entrance), and then you can strol back up Palatine Hill and through the Roman Forum. The Vatican City is around the same distance as the Colsseum in the opposite direction (also good to get there early and go straight to the museums for the Sistine Chapel and the amazing Last Judgement). The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps are all within 30 minutes of gentle walking. Just over the river and around 15 minutes away is the Trastevere area full of very good restaurants and ideal for dinner. You don't need to look any further if you're looking for mid-priced, gorgeous hotel in Rome. If they maintain these standards it'll be in the top 10 by the end of the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Campo De' Fiori - FANTASTICO!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFromAus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo De' Fiori is the most beautiful boutique hotel I have stayed in. This hotel is chic and glamourous. The rooms are delightfully decorated and have modern bathrooms. Most historic sites are within a 20 minute walk from the hotel or there is the tourist hop on/hop off bus not far away. The hotel has a sensational roof top garden/seating area with 360o views of Rome - lovely during the day and night and a breakfast room straight out of a movie set. The Piazza Campo De' Fiori is around the corner where you can buy lovely gifts, fresh fruit, cheese, nuts and Italian wine - we took our food back to the roof top garden! The owner Franco and staff Barbara and Gabriel are very helpful and accommodating, nothing was too much trouble. They gave us a very warm welcome and it was like leaving family when we said goodbye. I will certainly be staying here again when I next visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, perfectly positioned.”
Reviews.Author: Roger187069
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and perfect. We spent 4 great days in Rome, the hotel position is very conveniently placed for sightseeing. The reception staff were extremely helpful, giving directions and maps, recommending good restaurants and arranging private tours (we went on a private tour of the Vatican which was excellent). Nothing was too much trouble for them.The room was perfect for our requirement, the breakfast was good and they were flexible with early starts. The rooftop terrace is delightful. Residents took wine and food to have on the terrace. Overall a great hotel and excellent choice. The only place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: levelray
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and very helpful. This must be one of the cleanest hotels i have stayed in. The rooms were very tastefully decorated, comfortable and quiet. The location is fantastic, you are within walking distance to all the major attractions. The panoramic roof terrace is the perfect place to sip a glass of wine and unwind after a busy day sight seeing. I loved every minute of my stay here and wish i would have stayed for longer. I will return to Rome one day and will definately return to Hotel Campo de Fiori. They made myself and my family feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Rome”
Reviews.Author: Timm05
Reviews.Content: If you are a frequent Rome traveler like me, you will appreciate this little gem of a hotel just off the Campo de'Fiori (one of the new "in" places in Rome). Intimate and warm with a friendly, English speaking staff , this hotel provides a feel of authentic Rome, far from the faded glamour of the Via Veneto or the over-priced grand hotels. While there is no bar or restaurant (just a cozy breakfast room), with the Campo De Firori just around the corner there's no lack of places to eat and drink. Or you can enjoy the sunset over St. Peter's from their charming two-level rooftop garden. This gem of a hotel was another great find by Carol Coviello-Malzone of Flavors of Rome (www.flavorsofrome.com).

Reviews.Title: “What a location, what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tdetzi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and my Sister and brother in law just finished our trip to Italy, culminating with 2 days in Rome. We wanted a Hotel that was near the Ancient city. We picked the Hotel after reviewing the Trip Advisor for comments. It did not let us down. the location was unbelievable, right in the heart of Campo de' Fiori. A bustling Piazza was right outside the hotel. There was a market setup each day in the piazza and plenty of food choices as well as meat and pastry shops not to mention plenty of clothing shops. the Hotel was a short walk to the Pantheon and the Colosseum. The room we had came with a private balcony, but since we were on the 6th floor our room was right outside of the hotel's 3 level terrace. This became our terrace to relax with a bottle of wine and some fresh meats and cheeses from the shops below, so the additional cost for our room was really not needed. The room we had was a little larger than the one my sister and brother in law had. Both were small compared to USA rooms but about what you would expect to find in any city hotel. The rooms were decorated very tastefully and were extremely clean. The bathrooms, always of concern, were new and very clean with all of the modern appointments. One word of caution do not get a room overlooking the piazza, unless you are into a very active and loud nightlife and want to hear that late into the evening. One of the rooms we had was over the piazza, and the noise level was quite high late in the evening. Our room was overlooking the rooftops of other hotels and apartments and was extremely quiet. From our terrace we could see the domes of St Peters and the Pantheon, truly amazing. The entire staff at the hotel was extremely courteous and helpful in anything and everything we wanted. Matteo is one person i would call out for excellent customer service. He was GREAT!. If there was a deficiency it would have to be their breakfast. Of the other 2 hotels we stayed at during our trip, the Hotel Campo de' Fiori breakfast was the least impressive. it had a small variety of foods to choose from. But it was a small deficiency compared to all of the benefits. Overall we had a wonderful experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful! Set an unbeatable standard for Italy”
Reviews.Author: Pip1978
Reviews.Content: This is definately a boutique hotel. It's just gorgeous and charming. We arrived in Rome and were so warmly welcomed by the private driver arranged through the hotel and then by the hotel staff. They were so helpful in providing a simple map and easy to follow directions. I have visited Rome before and never found it this easy. The location is perfect and we would recommend splashing out for it if you only have a few days to explore Rome. You can get everywhere easily on foot or a taxi ride to The Vatican City or train station is only about 12 euro. The hotel staff organised us an english speaking private driver to take us on a night tour of Rome (our choice of attractions to visit) and then he dropped us off to an amazing trattoria for dinner. They just went the extra mile and you get much better value and comfort than an expensive arranged tour on a bus (we had a mercedes). Nothing was ever a problem. Are you planning on visiting The Vatican City or Catacombs? -we highly recommend booking a tour through the hotel who used "Eyes of Rome" for us. Denis our "Roman Storyteller" was so knowledgable, friendly and had a great sense of humour. Back to the hotel -the room was spotless, a little small but we are now in our 5th Italian Hotel and they are all very similar in size. The bathroom was just beautiful and modern yet elegant. Breakfast is tasty and we were well looked after. On the Friday night there was some noise from the streets but the other nights were so peaceful. The roof top balcony must not be missed! You will not regret indulging in this true taste of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “I'd move into this hotel if I could....”
Reviews.Author: MomCat1992
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying again (March 2011) at this charming, boutique hotel for a total of 8 nights; last time in April 2010 for 7 nights. First, the location is perfect (to me) – right next to Campo de' Fiori, in the historic center of Rome making it a breeze to walk to most places. The rooms are each like jewel boxes; individually decorated, different colors of paint (walls), furnishings and paintings together with beautiful lighting fixtures and, a real plus: carpeting. The carpeting eliminates any noise at all from other rooms, which is a big plus. And, though the campo can get noisy at night, you simply close the double paned windows and silence envelopes the room and sleep is easy. The beds are extremely comfortable (not easy to come by in Rome), towels are large and plush and I particularly like that they have the system whereby you insert your room "key" into a corresponding slot when you enter the room that activates the electricity which reduces energy waste. The rooms all have a small refrigerator, glasses, wine opener and plenty of space for clothing - it is not like other hotel rooms where you are crammed into it and bumping into inadequate closet space. The wardrobes, drawers, cabinets are made of a beautiful wood and provide more than enough space and, in the rooms I stayed in this area is separate from the space with the bed, etc., making it even more comfortable. The bathrooms are nicely decorated with ample space and rainshower showerheads. I did not have a bath, only a shower (but a nice size); not sure if other rooms do have baths. The photos on their website are representative of the rooms, lobby, breakfast space and roof and I think the photos are fairly recent; at least I recall them being different than ones I'd seen on the site in the past. Yet, I find the rooms to be even prettier than in the website's photos. I have stayed in both the double standard room and the double deluxe room and have found both to be designed in a way that you have more space than you might originally think. I did not feel confined at all in the rooms even though I was there for a week at a time. Breakfast is typical and plentiful (eggs, cakes, breads, fruit, yogurt, croissants, meats, cheeses, juices, cereal) and the woman who serves is always pleasant as she manages to effectively serve a room full of guests. The roof deck is the crown jewel of the hotel - three levels which include comfortable, cushioned couches and chairs and tables which allows for people to relax and bring up wine and food and soak up the unobstructed gorgeous view of Rome. Tip: it's nice to take your breakfast up to the roof. The staff is a stand out: each of them from Valentina, Matteo, Adam, Barbara and a new fellow that I unfortunately cannot recall his name but each are personable, engaging and helpful. They offer excellent suggestions about restaurants, getting around, and will cheerfully assist you with reservations, etc. I feel as though I have a home in Rome when I stay at this hotel and wouldn't stay anywhere else. I'm already plotting my return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Apartment M2”
Reviews.Author: BellaOne
Reviews.Content: We've just returned form our vacation to Italy. We stayed 4 total nights at M2 Dependance (Apartment) on the Hotel Campo De'Fiori and loved it. The hotel itself is really charming and roof top garden is an amazing place. M2 is around the corner on the piazza, and I loved being there. It is large and was great for our family of 4. The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. They let us check in early and communicate by email very well! The square has a market every day that clears out in the late afternoon to become an open public space with basically no cars. Forno bakery sells excellent pastries and pizza to go. The Magnolia was a great sit down place and there are several great "bars" to hang out and get a beer or wine for a great price without paying for a table. Our 2.5 yr old could run around the square with the other kids and was welcome wherever we went. The M2 is kind of a shotgun set up, one room wide with one enclosed outdoor patio (READ - no view of anything but straight up! But was nice to sit out there). The bathroom is large with a standup, enclosed shower, good lighting, and plenty of shelf and counter space. Queen bed in the large room at the back of the apartment is nice. Nice TV and overall quiet. 2 single beds in the front room are definitely for kids but were still comfortable. The room has a bit more noise but still nothing I would complain of. There is no "living room". The rest of the apartment is a small kitchen and a nice table/chairs. The only TV is in the large bedroom, if this makes a difference to you. I was a little disappointed at first that the apartment had no living area, but it really never mattered. We watched no TV and were gone all the time or sitting on the patio. I have previously stayed in other parts of Rome and would only come back to Campo De'Fiori in the future. It is so well located and feels like you have your own slice of Rome to youself...surrounded by people who are really living and working in the area. I have read a lot about noise, drinking, or whatever on the piazza. We didn't find any of that except for very late on a Saturday night. And it was really just more crowded than anything. If you were over in the hotel, you would never have known a thing.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff in center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: mandycandler
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Hotel Campo de'Fiori staff for making my first trip to Italy so memorable. Every endless question and request was handled with courtesy and professionalism. The front desk crew could not have been nicer to my daughters and me, reservations and details went without a hitch, and we will return. The rooms are small, but well-equipped, and the deck on top of the hotel is heaven with a bottle of wine and good company. The full breakfast is delightful in a room set aside just for this purpose. Grazie, to all.

Reviews.Title: “rarely does a hotel look better than the website. this one does.”
Reviews.Author: ISMLondon
Reviews.Content: lovely room, amazing roof terrace, friendly staff. thick doors and double glazing (plus shutters) help create a calm oasis. lovely furniture. no blandness here

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique Hotel with Warm Welcome and Incredible 360° Roof Top Terrace”
Reviews.Author: JRJK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Campo De' Fiori with a group of family and friends for a week to celebrate my wife's birthday and cannot say enough wonderful things about the hotel and the staff. Everything about the hotel was perfect, from the front desk staff, to the breakfast, the accommodations, the cleanliness, and the great central location. Coordinating the needs of 13 travelers can be challenging and the hotel staff did this flawlessly, providing a variety of room types for all the needs and budgets of our group. The rooms were beautifully decorated, extremely quite, the beds comfortable, and the bathrooms both well appointed and spotless. Everyone in our group found the accommodations more than perfect and all the staff of the highest caliber. We will be returning to the Hotel Campo De' Fiori every time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Little jewel box rooms in a lovely old building in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: LexidocNY
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Campo de' Fiori. We chose it because of the location and the nice presentation on the web site. The rooms are small but they are lovely little jewel box like spaces, and have ample storage for clothing. Beds are comfortable. Good updated window glazing mutes street noise. Bathroom is small but modern, well designed, and with good plumbing (which can be hard to find in Europe). The roof top deck lounge is really pretty with wonderful Roman views and comfortable seating. In the summer when all the plantings are blooming it must be heavenly.The staff are fluent in English and always friendly and helpful. We love the neighborhood and would absolutely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: andreaL_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend at this hotel for a week. We were given a red romantic room with a brand new bathroom. Wifi was available in the room as well as in the lobby. Although we had been told that Campo de fiori square get's busy in the night we slept without any noise. Staff was friendly and helpful. At the check in they advised us to make a guided tour to the Vatican, and it was really useful. We enjoyed a bottle of wine on the terrace at the rooftop with a breathtaking view. Colosseum, Trevi and Spanish Steps are walking distance of 20 minutes. We will definately reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “nearly ruined our much needed holiday.....”
Reviews.Author: anitatucker08
Reviews.Content: The hotel had no availability for the dates we wanted so they offered us an apartment. I asked what it was like and was told it was decorated like the hotel's rooms and to take a look in the gallery. There was no photo showing how different the apartment was. It turned out to be a horrible dingy room with a dreadful too narrow bathroom and dirty extra blankets. in a street covered with graffitti. In the morning we asked if there was a room available in the hotel instead. They offered us a different apartment. It was better but still nothing like the hotel and far too expensive for what it was. We spent a day and a half of our precious holiday looking for another hotel. Fortunately we found a lovely hotel nearby with a lovely courtyard and at a cheaper rate! We then had a fascinating time in Rome but were sad to have missed so much holiday time worrying about finding a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: robertwhitman
Reviews.Content: be ready for quirky and cramped rooms, in a superb location, with the most attentive, welcoming and helpful staff around. Take note especially of the crew at the desk and Valentina who is now making her own jewelry! Try to talk her into making some for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Fairport_NYHeather
Reviews.Content: We could not have picked a better hotel! The location is amazing--an easy 20 minute walk to both Vatican City and the Colosseum. It is close to several Piazzas, and many restaurants. The hotel itself was perfect. The room was pretty and clean, and the perfect size for the two of us. The staff was friendly and helpful! On our next trip to Rome, we will definitely stay at Campo De' Fiori

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Heyjo72
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel for a 2 night stay after a long journey and were greeted by a very friendly female receptionist. She gave us advice on how best to get to Stadio Flaminio (we were over for the rugby) and booked us a taxi. Unfotunately however, our room was not available due to some plumbing problem and we were instead given an apartment across from the hotel. It was very nice and spacious but did smell strongly of cigarette smoke. We returned later that night to a very noisy Campo de' Fiori but slept okay due to a combination of exhaustion, wine and earplugs!! Next day we were given a room on the top floor of the hotel by way of compensation. It was beautiful, with a fantastic bathroom, but very small. The one feature we didn't like about the room was the control panel on the wall, which emitted a bright blue light which lit up the whole room. Perhaps there is a way to dim it but we couldn't work it out! All in all though, a great hotel in a great location. The views from the rooftop terrace are wonderful, the staff were all very friendly, and the breakfast was nice too!

Reviews.Title: “roaming Rome from the perfect base camp!!”
Reviews.Author: ggolay
Reviews.Content: Not only would I recommend this hotel but I will return soon! Central position, surrounded by History yet real life, without the touristic buzz, this uncompromising hotel is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Hotel with a Great Heart”
Reviews.Author: Daddywales
Reviews.Content: We have visited Rome many times over the years, and stayed at quite a few hotels, some good some not as good, so we feel that as we write this we have some experience to call upon. Finding Campo De' Fiori was a real stroke of luck. Perfectly located just 5 minutes from Piazza Navona, with it's breathtaking fountain by Bernini, 10 Minutes from the Vittorio Emmanuel Monument and the Capitoline hill, and a short river walk from San Angelo and the Vatican. The hotel is situated in a vibrant area of central Rome, that converts from an early morning flower market, to a place full of restaurants and places to find great value food. The hotel is fabulous, an old building that has been so tastefully renovated, keeping the luxurious feel of the splendour of Italian Decor, yet so very comfortable.....and the staff were wonderful, friendly and so helpful, you were always met with a smile and good advice. "Small with a great big heart". Would we use this hotel again?..... we wouldn't stay anywhere else when in Rome..... enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel, great staff, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: terrymckeown9
Reviews.Content: Very good apartment in side street, warm and comfortable. Hotel staff were wonderful, even gave great help to our Aussie friends who were not even staying there. Beautiful location, close to main attractions. No trouble to walk from the piazza to Colosseuim, forum, St Peters. We had terrible weather but still greatly enjoyed our visit. If we return to Rome we wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Mikeoverend
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Lovely friendly staff, great decor in rooms and perfect location for all the sights of Rome (we walked everywhere). Bed and breakfast only, but breakfast was substantial and nicely prepared. For evening meals there was plenty of choice nearby. We would recommend Pizzeria Hostaria diagonally opposite the hotel across the piazza - a friendly, family owed, resauraunt with very good food. La Pollarola restauraunt, nearby the hotel, was not so good - expensive fish, greasy starter and staff not so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice apartment and awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: MYTraveller85
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome and it was amazing! The staff were really friendly and great in providing tips for restaurants, which had great food and weren't touristy either. Loved the location in Campo di Fiori, not too far from the action and the tourist sites. Overall highly recommended for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....nothing much more need be said”
Reviews.Author: usuallywith5kids
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel for an overnight trip to Rome from London with my two teenage daughters - we wanted a small hotel with character, easy walking to all the main sights and in the heart of the old city. As an architect I am admittedly very fussy about design and spend hours examining room pics before booking. I usually seek cool and contemporary where possible but this time - at the suggestion of my wife - we wanted something that fitted more with the character of old Rome. Only I had been to Rome before and we wanted this short trip to encapsulate everything that sums up Rome - a vibrant, architectural gem of a city, full of Italian character and history - and this hotel contributed to this in a way which could not have been more perfect. The hotel, which is in an old building in a side street just off the Campo De' Fiori, had been beautifully and tastefully 'interior designed' in a slightly opulent but still contemporary way which suited the age and scale of the building perfectly.
