The welcome from the staff could not have been warmer - they took the time to orientate us with a map when we arrived and make suggestions - the rooms were comfortable (smallish, but what do you expect for a little building in the old city) and the bathrooms clean, stylish and up to date (the rooms even looked like the pics on the website, something that can't be said of all hotels). The hotel had free WiFi - something all hotels should have in 2011 (get more than one access code if you have more than one device) - and it had a lovely roof terrace with views over the city. Breakfast was good and service excellent. We didn't use the car hotel's car service from the airport but booked through http://www.airportconnection.it/ - €50 from Fiumicino, 10% discount on the return and very reliable and good value. For our one dinner in Rome we ate at Baccanale restaurant in the Campo De' Fiori - expensive (if you eat too many courses and have an expensive wine, like we did) but excellent non-touristy, non-pizza menu with excellent, attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: DannyC77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a standard double room, every morning there was a great breakfast and whenever we needed any help with booking a restaurant or taxi or any advice on the sights Matteo and his colleagues were very helpful. The rooms were fine for what we wanted and double glazed so the noise levels were not a problem. The bed was comfortable too. Locationwise it is perfect for all the attractions and there were some nice bars nearby for the evening. All in all a great stay highly recommended - would definitetatstay again!

Reviews.Title: “best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jantie001
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 times already at this hotel and love the location in the historical heart and its roof terrace with great views over the roofs and domes of Rome. Visited Rome at least 10 times already and this hotel is my favourite !

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, friendly hotel perfectly located in central Rome.”
Reviews.Author: bobjhinds48
Reviews.Content: We came in mid-February for sunshine, good food, fine Italian service and found all of it. Forty minutes from Fiumicino by car, the hotel provided a fine visual impact, colours, decor and furniture pulling us in at every turn. The Room we had on the top floor had been chosen by us as it had a balcony and a view across the city. Small but perfectly equipped, and very clean indeed. The bathroom was a delight, surprisingly spacious and very elegant. The buffet breakfast was adequate in all respects with plenty of choice and the staff simply could not have been more helpful. Where else but in Rome would the proprietor have led two shattered guests out to show them his favourite local restaurant on the evening of their arrival? Taking everything into account, this was probably the most pleasant Italian "city centre" hotel we have stayed in, and we have been visiting Italy regularly every year since 1980.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Will313
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo De' Fiori is a fabulous hotel tucked away in the Piazza Farnese. Great staff, great location and impeccably clean. I can’t imagine anyway not falling in love with this place. And if you have a passion for edgy shoes check out Loco, just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A beuatiful hotel in a great location with wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: AdamSurbiton
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as a surprise for my then girlfriend, now fiancée (I proposed whilst there) and booked the hotel on the strength of previous reviews. I cannot say enough good about the Hotel Campo De' Fiori. Firstly, let me say a huge thank you to all of the staff who were absolutely wonderful. All of them were extremely helpful and friendly and couldn't seem to do enough for you. I was embarrassed my lack of Italian but I needn't of been because they all spoke perfect English. The hotel is just as beautiful as it looks on the website. They don't have a bar but you can get drinks at the bar opposite and take them up to the roof terrace, which we did, prior to going out on the Saturday evening. The terrace is quite high up, so you have a fantastic view of nearly the whole of Rome. The hotel is in a great location, we walked to or from all the main sites that we wanted to see: the Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Coliseum, etc. Our room was small but beautifully decked out in what I imagine would be a baroque style. The bathroom was very clean and modern with a lovely shower. I noticed that one of the many candle light bulbs had burnt out one morning and was replaced again by the afternoon without me having to mention it. I did hear some Americans complaining about some late noise from a nighclub. We were on the third floor and couldn't hear anything, so it might pay to be sure to be higher up. We will definitely be going back here and I would recommend it highly to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: HelenaP_11
Reviews.Content: Our brief stay at this very special Hotel Campo di Fiori made the whole difference. Confortable, the flavor of the old Rome but very updated services (TV, internet), modern bathrooms, good beds and pillows, clean, close to everything you must see in Rome, a charming day market full of flowers and cozy outdoors Caffè's at night. Very special staff in charge of making everything run perfect for us. Very well trained and friendly team! We will surely go back to watch Rome at night from the terrace with a glass of champagne. Helena from Venezuela

Reviews.Title: “Romance & Rome in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: footloose_farang
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel in a prime spot. the views from the rooftop terrace breathtaking.. Stock up on delicacies from the Campo and sit with your loved one sipping great wine as the sun sets over Rome's rooftops. Exquisite hotel with beautiful and sumptuous decoration. We adored it. The staff went out of their way to make our wedding anniversary something never to be forgotten.. Bella Italia... Bella Roma!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grazie, Campo de fiori!”
Reviews.Author: bendoro
Reviews.Content: I took myself on a Roman Holiday as a treat....never been to Italy, so most certainly hadn't been to Rome. I'm a 20-something woman so wanted something safe and central so woudn't have to cab too much at night etc. I must say, I highly recommend the hotel for its location for this very reason.You can walk to so many things! As for the actual accommodations, the staff greeted me after a redeye with a great energy that was as effective as a double espresso—got me revved up to see all the sights. Plus, my room was ready which is always a treat after a long flight. The hotel itself was charming—not 'modern' italian by any means as far as decor goes, so don't expect the typical in hotel bedding etc., but the pics on the website show what it's like so really there are no surprises. But the cleaning staff was swift and nice and the breakfast was filling (and free!) and whatever you do, don't miss the roof deck!! World famous pizza place Forno is on the Campo de Fiori square, so grab some slices and bring them back around the corner to the hotel and eat at the top, overlooking roma! Bellissima!

Reviews.Title: “Added to TOP of my List”
Reviews.Author: IvyMaciado
Reviews.Content: I have been traveled so many place, this is the hotel i would like to highly recommend !! It is just been in my TOP list after 3 days stay. Talk about the location first , right in the center of Rome, within 5 -10 mins walk you can reach shopping, bunch of bar and restaurants. also public transpotation , train, bus...ect 10-15 mins walk to tourism spots.. entry to the reception, they are all friendly and willing to provide lots of recommendation for spot to see or restaurants... Hotel with romatic room and warm room design, also nice new bathroom with heater, you can have shower warm and fresh ! by the way, it is ipad friendly with free wireless internet in the lobby and room!! Breakfast in basement, the great design of the basement, you dont even notice you are in the basement at all. awesome awesome roop top, you can bring you own food and wine to enjoy the top view of the city, comfy seating .... i really enjoy that !!! this is the top 1 in my list after i travel around the world, i would say, good price, location , service, great design of the hotel ..~~

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ssbird
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo de Fiori is a charming boutique hotel with an outstanding location in the center of Rome. The hotel has a traditional Old Italy style, but everything is updated and modern. Great bathrooms, breakfast includes eggs, and a helpful staff. The view from the rooftop is amazing, with comfortable furniture, to make a pleasant place to relax. The entire hotel is super clean. Thanks to the staff for their help and suggestions, especially Valentina, who helped us get our IPad connected to their free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all round, one of my nicest experiences in a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiancaIreland
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time in Rome and our stay at this hotel greatly contributed to this. We will definately be back to stay again as the location was so good and the staff were fantastic. From the cleaning ladies to the front desk, you couldn't have asked for a nicer and more helpful bunch! The breakfast was lovely and the whole ambience of the hotel was charming and inviting. We actually checked out the reviews on Tripadvisor before we decided on this hotel and we were delighted to experience all the good things that others had written about their stay. So thank you to you all at Hotel Campo De Fiori, it was a pleasure staying there. Bianca Divito

Reviews.Title: “We could not have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: 501TTD
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Campo Di Fiori Hotel for 2 nights and absolutely loved it. The location is perfect for discovering Rome, 20 mintues walk to Vatican and 20 minutes walk to the colosseum. the hotel is situated just off campo di fiori, and surrounded by great restaurants and cafes. From the rooftop terrace you have a great view of Rome, and would have been a great to relax had the weather been a bit warmer!! The room was very comfortable, clean and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was again spotlessly clean and we felt at home right away. The breakfast offered plenty of choice and was a great way to prepare for a busy day in Rome. I think the best part of the hotel has to be the staff. Everyone we met in the hotel was very friendly and helpful, suggesting places to see and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, professionally run hotel, in fabulous area with incredible staff.”
Reviews.Author: dallpat
Reviews.Content: On a short visit to Rome with my husband, we had the good fortune to to have stayed at the Hotel Campo de'Fiori. There are many wonderful things about this small, quaint hotel but, first and foremost is the staff. Everyone is warm, friendly, helpful - everything you dream of experiencing when you are traveling. It is easy to read on their happy, smiling faces, that they truly enjoy their job and are eager to pass their joy onto their guests. By the time we left after a brief four day stay, we felt like we were part of one big happy family. In addition, the hotel is located in one of the most historic districts of Rome, an easy walk to all the major sites. The hotel is beautifully decorated in a true antique Roman style. The atmosphere reflects the joyousness of the personnel. Even the breakfast room, which can be dreadfully depressing in Italy, is fun, light and airy, with light classical music which puts you in a good mood for the entire day. The rooms are not huge but seem bigger than they are since they are very well thought out. There is a place for everything including room in the closet for even the biggest suitcase. Switches are in the right places and there is an abundance of plugs. There are shelves in the bathroom for toiletries. The only criticism I might have is that the bathrooms are equipped with only showers. I am a bath person. However, I was even willing to put up with this inconvenience because everything else was so perfect and the wonderful staff could make you accept just about anything!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, opulent and perfect for couples, in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pugh7678
Reviews.Content: Big thanks to the Hotel Campo di Fiori. We stayed here while getting married in that beautiful city that is - Rome. The staff where so helpful in all aspects, even walking my future wife to a dry cleaners to have her wedding dress pressed and conversing with the staff as we spoke very little Italian. The main girls at reception, Valentina & Barbara, had a quirky sense of humour, which was a delight from most hotels that we’ve stayed in, and helped out again and again with my future wife's needs at the drop of a hat. Interiors where something to behold also, all individually bespoke and a reflection of that wonderful city that you're in. Location was just right. Right next to Campo di Fiori Square - with all its bars and restaurants, and only a quick cab ride to the Vatican, not to mention a barely ten minutes walk from other major attractions. Walking was the best mode of transport that we found, as there is just so much to see. We’re already planning to go back to the hotel for our 1st anniversary and do all the things we missed out on, due to the wedding. Thanks again to the staff who kindly had a bottle of champagne and gifts waiting in our room on our wedding night, which was a pleasant surprise… well… not really, that’s just the type of staff that they are. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: S_cubedSoMaryland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the TripAdvisor recommendations and were not sorry. It is located in the Campo de Fiori square, where a flower and fruit market sets up every day. It's hard to find, and we got lost several times. The front desk staff is wonderful: so friendly and helpful. Gabriel recommended a private tour with "The Eyes of Rome" company, which totally made our trip. The hotel lobby and bathroom on the main floor are gorgeous. It was decorated for Christmas when we were there. The basement is a library/sitting room that hosts a wonderful breakfast in the morning for 10 euro each. The rooftop terrace is fantastic, with great 360 views of Rome. We had our 20 year daughter with us, so we were assigned an off-site "apartment", which was down an alley, then down another alley. I was quite disconcerted as we were being escorted to the place, but it was quite nice. A first floor walk-up with a bedroom, sitting room with 2 chairs that convert to single beds, a kitchenette, and a nice bathroom with a shower. It also had some sort of sun room and patio, but I guess that is for the summer. It was decorated very nicely, with old-world furniture and lovely comfy blankets. We were a little disappointed that we had no internet in our room, but you could walk over to the main hotel and ask the front desk for either a one hour or 24 hour password to use there. We loved the location of this hotel. It is in the middle of everything. We could walk to many sites, and it was only 15 minutes across a little bridge to the Travestere area, where you MUST eat. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome. With just two of us next time, we will hopefully get to stay in the main hotel. We did get a peek at a room, and it was small but beautifully done and had a great bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “special, romantic and delightful”
Reviews.Author: nigel17
Reviews.Content: We just loved this hotel. We arrived on 31st December, so the place was bedecked in Christmas tree and lights. After a lost luggage situation at the airport, resulting in my partner not being able to see because his contact lenses were in the suitcase, the reception were tremendously helpful. Valentina, especially, was a charming and very fantastic receptionist, helping us out with numerous queries. We seemed to have new issues every day and she was fantastic throughout. The hotel rooms seem all individually decorated, and with a lot of care and love. The kind of way you would decorate your own home - individual, caring and thoughtful. The rooftop terrace is fantastic. Breakfast is quite good, perhaps not the best in the world, but good nonetheless and in a sublime and serene breakfast room on the ground floor with classical music playing. How civilised. Maid service was very efficient and the front desk were always available to help. With two people it is definitely worth taking the 50 euro transfer from the airport offered by the hotel. Downsides - rooms seem pretty small, this would be expected in an old building in historic Rome, but what they lack in size they make up in charm. Staying over peak season is not the cheapest option, even by Rome standards, but it was just so well worth it. Wish we could back again. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Confucius55
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel and we had a great stay over the Christmas holiday. The rooms are great and the staff are friendly, competent, and go out of their way to be helpful. The small self-service apartments next door are clean, pleasant, and everything works. We cooked a few times in the kitchenette with things bought at the outdoor market in Campo dei Fiori. Excellent! The location is right in the centre of the old part of town. Most sights are within 10-15 minutes walking distance. Only drawback is terrible wifi. The internet only works from the lobby, the breakfast room, and the roof terrace. You can't access wifi from most rooms. In addition, your computer/smartphone has to be reregistered every 24 hours which the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Be alert when booking apartment at the hotel and transportation service”
Reviews.Author: WasInRome
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Rome with my mother, husband, and son (2 years old). I decided to stay at the Hotel Campo De'Fiori because of the reviews on TripAdvisor, because they had apartments, and because of the central location. After staying at an apartment maintained by Hotel Campo De'Fiori, I needed to write a review to give other families with young children more information. Pluses: We found the apartment to be spacious and clean. The apartment was near the square/market, and thus was convenient for us. Great view from the rooftop. Minuses: The staff of the hotel was often aloof and unhelpful to us. For example, I booked online for a specific apartment that was on a ground floor so that we wouldn't have to take our stroller and multiple bags up and down many flights of steps. When we arrived, they did not give me the apartment that they told me I would get via email - all that was available was on the 2nd or 3rd floors, at a building 2 blocks from the hotel. We had to move 4 heavy suitcases, a young child, stroller and car seat over two blocks and up to a 3rd floor apartment at 8 pm in the evening. Since this is a small hotel and there was only one employee working at night, we had to do this all ourselves. When we left for the airport several days later, early in the morning, we had to do the same thing in reverse. Also, the cleaning staff regularly moved things around the apartment, and I needed to be alert to where my belongings were. Although there is free wi-fi at the hotel, we did not have it at the apartment. Lastly, do not book transportation to/from the airport through the hotel. We used Rome Cabs to go to the hotel - they were great - they waited for us at the airport and they charged 55 euros for the 4 of us. On the way back, we used the transportation service arranged through the hotel. The price they quoted was 80 euros, and then when we arrived at the airport, the driver told us it was really 90 euros because he had to wait for us at the hotel. This service is obviously gouging riders, and I would not recommend them at all. All in all, for my next trip to Rome, I think that if I could find another hotel with apartments in the same general area of Rome, I would try that place instead.

Reviews.Title: “Neigbourghood couldn't be better, amazing terrace, smiling staff.”
Reviews.Author: MowbrayBoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo De' Fiori is located in a great 'hood - right next to the old square the hotel is named after (which hosts a great market) and surrounded by restaurants, small shops and creperies. In fact right around the corner is a restaurant called Bafetto "2" - great pizzas and gnocchi. Campo De' Fiori is also bang in the middle between the Colosseum and the Vatican City - a 20 minute walk in either direction. The staff were particularly friendly: the cleaning ladies always greet you with a smile and the people behind the reception desk were incredibly helpful - full of advice ranging from restaurants (a great guy called Gabriel recommended Bafetto to us) to walking routes through the city. But, if anything, go to Campo De' Fiori for the terrace: 360 degree views of Rome. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “I can't recommend this hotel highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: dcl007
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of accommodation research before my recent stay in Rome and from the time I made my initial booking directly with the hotel they couldn't have been more helpful and efficient. I actually stayed in the hotel's B1 dependancy. Don't be put off by the graffiti outside - it's everywhere in Rome! It was quaint, spotless, comfortable and had everything you need for a great break - including fresh ground coffee, which was a really nice touch. And you couldn't ask for somewhere more central - Rome's main attractions are virtually on your doorstep! Do make a point of popping up to the hotel's roof terrace - the views across the Eternal City are amazing. And finally, I must mention the hotel's reception staff - lovely people and very helpful. So, don't hesitate - book, stay and enjoy yourselves! I will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: CowSong
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the city, walking distance to many of the major sites. Room was kept up well, but didn't like no option to open up exterior shutters - so no natural light in room. No Internet access in rooms only in lobby...don't bring wrinkly clothes, only option to iron is dry cleaner around the corner, who was too busy to iron one item.

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to returning.”
Reviews.Author: Alaskamclj
Reviews.Content: Our intent was to stay at a centrally located hotel as we spent five days exploring Rome. The location, comfort, service, and roof top patio made this an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, loaded with characther”
Reviews.Author: mohrjosh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome for the first time this past November, and we couldn't be happier with our stay at Hotel Campo de Fiori. The location of the hotel is perfect, 5 minute walk to most of the sites, 20 minute walk to the Vatican City and 20 minutes the other way to the Coliseum. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and make good recommendations on restaurants (La Scalla and The Library were two of our favorites, and will go back for sure to both). The rooms were smaller - but they were loaded with character and the bathrooms were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Weeked_Break87
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location for exploring Rome by foot. We did all the major tourist sites and did not need to take public transport once. Right round the corner from Campo Di Fiori which has nice restaurants and bars and only a 5 min walk from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. 10 mins easy walk also to the Forum and the Coleseum. Friendly service, a very good continenal breakfast and a room much bigger than the normal for European capital cities. Friendly staff with excellent tips for avoiding cues etc at the usual sites. Great roof terrace which sadly the weather did not allow us to explore. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent service-fantastic terrace”
Reviews.Author: lampa60
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 50th birthday in Rome. My husband arranged a surpriseparty on the roof terrace with fantastic help frm Barbara and Valentina in the reception. A memory for life. Love this place. We will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “perfect boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dinamoore
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Campo De'Fiori, and we can't say enough good things about the hotel. You will be smitten from the minute you arrive along the tiny cobblestone street: the charming ivy climbing the front of the hotel building; the scent of fresh roses and lilies in the lobby--everything about the hotel is welcoming. Once inside, the rooms are perfectly appointed with a great mix of antique and modern. The antique furniture and pale purple walls gives the room an almost gothic feel, along with the crystal chandelier hung over the bed. We left our french doors open at night, with only the shutters closed to keep out any flying creatures, and it was absolutely quiet. The bathroom is completely new and has contemporary large black matte tiles on the floor and walls, with a big glass shower with a rainshower head. Lovely. Actually, the thick but not overly soft oversized towels were our favorite--usually in European hotels the towels are half the size. Hotel's location is perfect walking distance to the colosseum, pantheon, travestere(over the ponte sisto--best spot for dinner), and piazza navorna. The staff is incredibly helpful and will assist with just about anything. I would not hesitate to recommend the Hotel Campo De'Fiori and will absolutely stay here again. Don't miss cappucino at Sant’Eustachio coffee bar a few blocks away--it's the best of all the delicious italian coffee bars--just ask at the desk and they'll draw you a map!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: estatictravellers
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel, from the minute we walked into the foyer. It was like living in a cozy but elegant Roman home. Our room was calming but beautifully furnished and we had a lovely view of a small piazza outside our window. The bathroom is modern with a great shower and plenty of hot water. It is in a fantastic location, easy walk to everywhere, a great lively market around the corner every morning and plenty of restaurants to choose from without going too far. Breakfast was lovely in an elegant breakfast room which made you feel very special. We will certainly stay at this lovely hotel again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel's apartment - location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Fiona642064
Reviews.Content: We have visted Rome for years and love the location of this hotel and its apartments. The hotel has been completely refurbished and is beautiful - if pricey! The roof terrace is a real bonus and we spent two very lovely evenings creating fond memories of our favourite city. On this occasion we used an apartment owned by this hotel and located on the Campo de Fiori. Now we love the location and not much would disappoint us, but I think many people would be put off by the noise and the real shabbiness of this apartment. Whilst it was clean, the bathroom was really really in need of an upgrade - you wouldn't want to have a bath! All that said, we would not hesitate to stay there again. I guess we're easy pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jMeredithg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the last 2 nights of our honeymoon, and it was wonderful. This was the perfect end to our honeymoon. We had a top floor room with an amazing view of the city. The bed was so comfortable, the bathroom was great, the staff was super helpful, and the breakfast was very good. All in all this was the best hotel we stayed at during our 3 weeks in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 95Denise
Reviews.Content: What this hotel lacks in its room quality it makes up for in superb service and fabulous location. Our family with two pre teen children stayed in one of the hotels off-site apartments. The bathroom was roomy, clean and serviced each day. The bed quality and linens were only average, but extra pillows and blankets were at the ready. Lighting was a small issue in the main living/kitchen area. Just out the door of the apartment was a forno for morning brioche & pizza and the daily food/gift market in Campo de'Fiori piazza offered many fruit options for the kids as well. The location of the hotel/apartment cannot be beat. 10 min walk to Pantheon, Spanish Steps. 15 to Colosseum. Plus, steps from fantastic coffee and restaurants. Lastly the hotel service and warmth was a true find. Great food/coffee recommendations, plus excellent partnership with a tour company. Our tours of both the Vatican and the Colosseum were highlights of the trip for the whole family. NOTE: The area around Campo De'Fiori is buzzing at night...late into the night. If you can handle that all will be perfect because of location and service.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely perfect experience in a truly wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMSmith411
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review by saying that I am a total hotel snob and that the hotel can make or break a holiday for me. This hotel most certainly made it. A lot of thought and money has obviously gone into modernising this beautiful old building. It has retained so much charm and character and yet has all modern ameneties. Our room was wonderfully plush and comfortable and set the perfect romantic tone for our anniversary trip. The entire hotel was spotlessly clean and the breakfast very tasty. What really sets this place apart though is the staff. It is incredibly rare to find one member of staff as friendly and helpful as the entire team was here. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble. They were happy to give directions and recommended some truly truly outstanding restaurants (one of which was the highlight of our 2 week trip). On our final day a wonderful woman, (whose name I can shamefully not remember) directed us to the best cup of coffee in the world and told us where to walk around to discover the real Rome. Each conversation I had with every member of staff here proved them to be incredibly professional, knowledgeable and friendly and demonstrated that they took real pride in what they do. We fully appreciated all of their hard work and effort. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay when near historical Roma”
Reviews.Author: skigirl50
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Lovely rooms with nice showers, good breakfast, perfect staff and very helpful with excellent dinner recommendations... The Library - small restaurant filled with wine bottles.. and of course walk across the bridge to the other side Traverse.. visit the Basilica and enjoy its splendor as well as its music.. Highly recommend this it is a little off the tourist path.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel201059
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4 nights staying at this well placed hotel. It was beautifully appointed, fabulous staff and a a wonderful breakfast. We had a room with a private balcony which was very enjoyable however that made us very close to the amazing roof-top terraces and we found many guests coming and going late at night very noisy especially the continuing slamming doors. This was the only complaint we had. I would definately recommend this hotel. It was the most expensive accommodation we had during our 3 weeks in Italy but you have to pay for position sometimes !

Reviews.Title: “Location, Views, an Character.”
Reviews.Author: HalleAndTheWorld
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel with a playful, unpretentious character. The building had a trendy renovation with integrity to the initial structure. The rooms are small, but colorful. Perhaps most importantly, the bathroom was clean and modern (with a shower clearly for one person). Check out the rooftop with great, private views of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Henrik1104
Reviews.Content: We have spend a wonderful (long) weekend in Rome staying in a flat near Campo de' Fiori. Everything was fine apart from one little detail; after checking out at 12 O'clock the last day we had nowhere to put our luggage before flying back home at 8 O'clock in the evening. That's where Hotel Campo De' Fiori comes into the picture; I took a long shot and went into the hotel and asked if they could help us out. Like an angel in disguise Valentina at the front desk turned out to be THE MOST HELPFUL AND SERVICEMINDED PERSON I can imagine (backed up by her colleagues that were all smiles). I was simply treated like a king and I had not even spent a single night at the hotel! BUT I CERTAINLY WILL next time we go to Rome (yes, I threw a coin in the Trevi Fountain!) Ciao Bella, see you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel/Staff - Breathtaking City”
Reviews.Author: Munster-FanCork
Reviews.Content: Returned home last Sunday night after a four night stay at this hotel. We were given an apartment across the road from the hotel which I must say was a nice surprise. Spacious bedroom, sitting room, fully fitted kitchen and a comfortable bathroom. The hotel is located at one corner of Campo De Fiori Square which has a nice market each day. We were very lucky with our hotel selection as in terms of location we could not have picked a better spot, very close to all the beautiful sights of Rome and about two hundred yards from the hop on hop off tour bus stops. We did not see a lot of the hotel as we wanted to take in as much of Rome as we could during our short stay. We did look at the roof top terrace and our plan was to return some evening with a bottle of wine and some cheese however we would have needed to stay for a couple of more nights. Considering the fact that we spent so little time in the hotel it is amazing how we managed to get to know the staff at reception. I was in touch with Barbara & Valentina a few days before we arrived in Rome and they gave some programme suggestions that we should take on board during our stay. The Borghese Gallery was one such suggestion, the place had to been booked in advance and Valentina very kindly had that reservation made for us on our arrival. While we had an early start in the morning (suffering from the effects of a lot of wine and a big meal the night before) I would certainly recommend that you visit this gallery. Each morning we called to reception with our many questions for the day and everyone at reception just went that extra yard to be helpful, right down to recommending restaurants and making reservations for us. If there was a negative it would be that the place was a busy spot in the evenings particularly the Saturday night, so if you are planning on early nights ask for a quiet room. Having said that, for most of our stay we did sleep fairly well. I have to say that Rome is a city that is well worth a visit - Bring a good pair of shoes.

Reviews.Title: “superb location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowDrMac
Reviews.Content: stayed in this boutique style hotel for a 4 night city break. Had to move to a different room for the last night but not a problem. All rooms appear to be small but very quiet and comfortable. Only had an en suite shower in each of the rooms we experienced, but this was quite adequate. Its location adjacent to Campo de Fiori square with its daily morning market was excellent. The square is cleaned each afternoon to prepare for the evening when the cafes and restaurants come alight. Its position in the heart of he historic district allows you to walk to any of the major attractions, such as the Vatican, ancient Rome, spanish steps and the shopping streets and Trastavere. It has a two level roof terrace which is a suoerb facility if the weather is warm, with good views over the city. The hotel has no bar, but each room has a fridge. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable and quiet hotel for a short break in this city, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: bctovegas
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day visit to Rome and we stayed at the hotel's 'dependency', basically a separate apartment a short distance from the hotel. The hotel was fully booked and we opted to try this accommodation. The walk to the apartment from the hotel with all of our luggage was painful, even with Guido's enthusiastic assistance. Once we were there though we were very happy with the apartment. The rooms were nicely decorated; a large bedroom and a large separate reading room which could be converted to another bedroom I think quite easily, a kitchen, modern bathroom. Lots of space. There was some street noise, church bells, all very typical of Rome. We could've closed the windows as they are all new and appear to be sound proof, but we liked the fresh air. There was a giant piece of a pillar in the bedroom which had been build around. I understand it was a pillar from the old Pompeii Theatre. The accommodation was fun for us. As friends we can now recall the time when we had our own apartment in Rome (LOL). While at the apartment you can still use the facilities of the hotel. We did not have breakfast included and saved some $$ that way, opting for breakfast in the square. The rooftop terrace is a lovely spot to watch the sunset or to comfortably lounge. The views are wonderful. Lastly, the staff at the hotel are all helpful and go the extra distance to make sure you have everything you need for a great visit. Valentina, Barbara, Matteo, Guido, Adam and the new guy (trainee). Their pride in service is evident. We had a problem with a recommendation they had provided and they went all out to correct and remedy the issue. A special thank you to the manager, Mr. Severino for the great service. Other recommendations for dining (especially at La Scala in Travestere) were fantastic. This place looks after you!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CANDMStockbridge_MA
Reviews.Content: A find! Ideal location, charming setting with a fabulous terrace to enjoy the roofs and monuments of Rome in the sunset. Extremely friendly staff. Good breakfast. Rooms are small but quite comfortable ad nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Credit crunch”
Reviews.Author: BorderRiever_10
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place with a central location and superb roofterrace and don't mind being ripped off, this is it. All you need to overlook is the dreadfull breakfast (for instance, the cheese had never seen a cow and the orange juice looks radio-active), the claustrophobic rooms and lack of any extras cq basics in the room (water, toilettries, etc.) that you might expect for the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel,great location,divine roof top terrace”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth61
Reviews.Content: This great boutique hotel on a side street beside the Campo De'firoi had a perfect location for our needs. We were three friends traveling together and although the room was small, I loved the decoration, and the bed was very comfortable. Even though it was close to the main Piazza there was very little noise with the window closed. There is a wonderful market around the corner with fresh fruits and veggies, trinkets, meats during the day and at night there were many small tratttorias surrounding the hotel-- one with amazing pizza. I would say the highlight of the hotel was the roof top terrace. One can see all over Rome and it is heavenly in the evening. Lovely patio furniture and flowers bedeck the terrace. I would definitely come back. The staff was VERY helpful and friendly also and speak excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “lovingly restored hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: gacki
Reviews.Content: stayed at this beautiful hote for nine nights. we had room 502 which had its own balconyand was beautifully decorated. beds and pillows really comfortable, the entire hotel is spotless, from our room to the publiv areas. the roof terrace is really lovelu with nice views of the rome skyline. the staff at this hotel are great from directions to what bus or train to take to restaurant reccomendations. Barbara Adam, Valentina and last but cerainly not least Matteo who each day gave us a mini history lesson. would definitly stay here again. fantastic location also. valentina this is for you sari beccamo! regards mr. mrs falcinelli

Reviews.Title: “Rome to visit a college student”
Reviews.Author: ksg12
Reviews.Content: We arrived. on a Saturday afternoon, and were very hesitant when we saw the crowd in the Camp de Fiori, but that quickly vanished when I had the most relaxing, and fitful sleep on my 12 day european journey. The rooms were small but incredibly relaxing and quiet. The hotel is beautiful and charming, the rooftop terrace is great after a long day walking, bring a bottle of wine and join the other guests. Matteo at the front desk was extremely helpful, and gave us great restaurant recommendations (non-touristy). We were able to walk to our daughters apt. in the Trastevere section, very quaint with cobblestone streets. All in all, a great stay, although I agree with another reviewer regarding the capuccino, needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: debbarker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Campo De' Fiori four nights at the beginning of our Italy trip. It was a great way to kick off the trip. It's an adorable boutique hotel in a fantastic location in walking distance to everything including the colleseum (20 mins) and the Vatican (15 mins). Aside from the car from the airport (which Guido was so sweet to arrange) we never once had to take a cab. The room was small, but exactly what we needed. Extremely clean and super quiet. The hotel is off of the piazza campo di fiori and it can be quite loud at night, but we were never bothered. The room was cool and dark, nice for curing a bit of jetlag. The front desk staff was very helpful and gave us detailed directions to anywhere we wanted to go. We really only had one very small, minor criticism. We had a very early morning reservation at the vatican and wanted to grab breakfast first. It began at 7:30, but we were leaving at 7:15 to walk to the Vatican. The front desk had suggested going down a bit early and they would still give us a coffee and danish. However, when we did, the woman setting the area was a little rude and wouldn't serve us. She just told us we were too early. It wasn't a huge deal, but we never did get to try the breakfast the hotel offers due to our schedule. But it looked great:) In all fairness to the hotel, we never mentioned it to the front desk as I imagine they would have allowed us to grab something. Anyway, if you want to be in the thick of things, close to Pza Navona, shopping, Pantheon, etc., stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: triptorome
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. the staff was very nice too and informative about things to do and places to eat. the hotel was in the middle of alot of piazzas and restaraunts. one thing i liked about the room it has music on demand for free on the tv. the roof top is a good relaxing place to overlook all of rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff - nice hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: WalkingTravelers
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Campo de Fiori was the perfect first stop for our trip to Italy: the staff warmly welcomed us and encouraged us to experience all of Rome. The rooms are smaller but beautifully decorated, as is the breakfast room. The rooftop garden is fabulous, providing a delightful view of the city. As the hotel is centrally located, we were able to walk everywhere and absorb the incredible sights as we traveled. The highlight of our city stay was a visit to the Vatican with a private tour guide arranged by the hotel staff. Sylvia was knowledgeable, attentive to our needs, and delightfully funny as well. Like other guests who have posted to this site, we too are looking forward to our return!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Gem in the Best Part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bigpolar
Reviews.Content: Incredibly professional, capable, hospitable, courteous staff, especially Adam at the fron desk, who really helped us with a tour reservation. Fantastic room, awesome rooftop terrace with views in every direction. Steps away from the Campo de Fiori square, where there is a great open air market 6 days a week. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: efleisc
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about Hotel Campo De' Fiori - it is a small, beutifully renovated hotel with exceptional service and a great location. This is a great hotel and fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic rooftop but watch out for the local ATM Machines”
Reviews.Author: cityorcountry
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay and were very pleased with this hotel. We travelled with extended family and were able to see and compare two different rooms. The room facing the front of the hotel was a bit noisy but afforded a nice view. The interior room was quite peaceful. The rooms are on the small side but were beautifully decorated. The rooftop terrace is probably the best feature of the hotel. The staff were extremely accommodating, polite and helpful. Matteo was a huge help. I cannot say enough positive things about him. He gave us great recommendations on restaurants and even explained how to validate our train tickets when we moved on to Florence. There are a lot of things to do in this neighborhood, but I would also recommend taking the short walk over to Trestavere. The only negative experience we had was NOT the fault of this hotel. We made ATM withdrawls at 2 locations during our stay. One was in Piazza Navona (a 10 minute walk from the hotel) and the other around the corner from the hotel on Corso Vittorio Emmanuel. One of the machines must have been fitted with a "skimming" device and camera. We returned home to find that thousands of dollars had been stolen from us. Again, this is not the fault of the hotel, but you do need to be aware of this as these ATM machines are in close proximity to Campo De Fiori. Before you go to Rome you should do your research about how to avoid this happening to you. With that said, if we ever return to Rome we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in an historic location”
Reviews.Author: Portseapal
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers more than three star 24 hour service, where staff is extremely helpful and language is no barrier. Self catering apartments offered also, and the World renowned daily marketplace is only 15 metres away! Now it is our HOME IN ROME! Many thanks from Aussies Chris & Kay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartment”
Reviews.Author: lindahaughan
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Rome and stayed in one of the Hotels Apartments - only a short distance away from the Hotel. We had picked the attic apartment so knew it was going to be up four flights of stairs. The climb was worth it as the apartment was lovely. A lot bigger than i expected and very light and airy. Great kitchen and Bathroom too. Only steps away from the market and the bakery was on the corner of the street - well worth buying your bread from their fresh in the morning. The fact we could also use the hotel roof terrace was a bonus too as this was a wonderful surprise - the views over to the Vatican were wonderful Can only agree with everyone else on the staff - very helpful when we arrived, showing us the directions on the map, taking us to our apartment, keeping our bags and letting us use the roof terrace on the sunday afternoon after we had checked out. Perfect location to be able to walk everywhere. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and apartments to anyone. Linda

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel in the best part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: smb157
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Campo de Fiori and we highly recommend it. It's located in the historic center, just off the Piazzi Campo de Fiori. The piazza is home to a farmer's market in the mornings, and then several outdoor cafes take over. The stunning Piazza Navona is a short walk- 4-5 blocks. We cabbed around town and because of our central location it was easy and relatively cheap. The Vatican, The Trevi fountain/Spanish Steps, The Collesum/Rome Forum are all short rides and cost 8-10 euros for 4 people. The hotel is quiet and offers a wonderful breakfast in a basement dining room. Be sure to spend some time on the rooftop garden- with tremendous views. We took a bottle of wine to the roof and soaked in the sunset. The rooms are a bit small but very modern and comfortable. This part of town is a good choice for people who enjoy the nightlife, lots of cafes, pizzerias etc. The staff is friendly and efficient- especially Matteo- an American transplant who now calls Roma home. Matteo is quick to offer tips on attractions, dining recommendations, and help of all kinds. He's one of those people who makes sure guests are happy. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING AND ROMANTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CRI242
Reviews.Content: Very nice location. Very kind staff members, always ready to help, The room was nicely decorated, with style, very clean. We stayed on the sixth floor enjoying a small balcony where we could relax, read, have a drink and watch the sunset. On the rooftop there is a quite large terrasse on different levels offering different views (360°) of Rome. Even if located in a quite busy area, the ambiance was very quite and relaxing. Many nice restaurants in the area and all main sites to visit within walking distances. Breakfast room is located in the basement. We would have preferred on the rooftop like in many hotels in Rome but it was ok, nice decoration, Italian way, nice light music and finally the most important was a simple but nice buffet. (Only cold dishes). The only "-" comment we would make concerns the supply of soap/shampoo in the bathroom which are quite (too) limited.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel, The best place to stay in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Alison G
Reviews.Content: We just returned 2 weeks ago from a wonderful weekend in Rome, After 2 months reserching on trip advisor for a hotel in Rome, I can most definatly say that this was a fantastic choice, We prebooked pick up from FCO airport which was 50 euro each way, we were met in the arrivals hall, our driver was holding a card with our names on it and Hotel Campo Di Fiori written underneath, we were escorted to our car a black mercedes benz with leather seats {very posh!}, and were whisked to our hotel in approx 30mins{very professional service}. Upon arrival at the hotel, the staff were very nice and friendly and while the gentleman checked us in the lady at reception, asked us if it was our 1st time in Roma and showed us a handy map of the city, marked where the hotel was located and told us how far walking distance everywhere was from the hotel, we didnt have to ask...... Room was beautiful, very tastefully decorated as was the whole hotel. Bathroom was amazing, piped music also so if you have the TV on you can hear it in the bathroom! Very Comfy Bed and pillows, spotless clean! Breakfast in the Basement was fantastic! Rooftop Terrace was AMAZING, Pictures cant describe how nice it is...You have to see it for yourself, again spotless clean, never any rubbish or bottles or glasses left around, we used it 2 evenings and had it to ourselves, You also feel like its your own private apartment with terrace in Rome, rather than staying at a stuffy hotel. 2 mins walk from the Piazza Navona, Beautiful Fountains {even nicer than trevi with less crowds} We walked everywhere in Rome, whe had a map and didnt take any tours, although opentop buses did leave from the main corso near the hotel. One evening we wanted to get night photos of the colosseum and took a taxi , as we had been walking for about 8 hours each day sightseeing, it was just 7 euro and took about 5 mins, well worth it. Lots of restraunts and a takeway Pizza, which sells beer, wine , coke water etc and Gelato shop near the hotel. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel, its a must. It made our stay in Rome a wonderful positive experiance. Thank you to the Staff of Hotel Campo Di Fiori!

Reviews.Title: “a romantic and cosy hotel in the heart of rome”
Reviews.Author: donrobs
Reviews.Content: my wife and me had a very pleasant stay at hotel campo fiori. it is situated very central. within a 15 min walk you can reach almost all touristic attractivities of rome. our room was not that big, but we did not care, we liked it a lot. very romantic, with a top level bathoom. the staff of the hotel is vigilant, pacient and extraordinary helpful. they recommended us brilliant restaurants very close and off the touristic tracks: just to mention two of them: roscioli (famous for stinky cheese and prosciutto ...delicatesses, noodles and outstandig wine accompaniement very italian!) or il san lorenzo (very delicious fish from the island of ponza, little expensive but top top top!) .... when we come back to rome, we will book this hotel again for sure. tip: saving money by online bookin ;-) greetings to the stuff, n+h nowak PS they offer a pick up service from the airport (you cant get quicker to the city ...!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian0176
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days, the rooms are quiet, clean with bathrooms of good quality. The continental breakfast was adequate and was included in the room rate which was very reasonable for Rome. The hotel position on the Campo de Fiori is great with bars and restaurants near by and the nightlife in this area is fun. The hotel is well positioned within walking distance of the Vatican, Colosseum, River and bus services for the City and main railway station. The staff were very friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Francis_Sean
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo de' Fiori is extremely charming, the rooms are the most romantic ever seen!! Me and my husband chose this Hotel for our honeymoon, and we had the room on the top floor with its private balcony...the view we had from there was simply amazing!! Rooms are very clean and the breakfast was excellent, moreover the Hotel is located in the heart of the hisorical centre....I will recommend this Hotel to everybody!! The staff at the reception is very kind and attentive, they made our stay really enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near Campo de Fiori”
Reviews.Author: HoustonRichie
Reviews.Content: We spent our first four nights in Italy at the Hotel Campo de Fiori. It is a gem--overlooks the Campo de Fiori, great updates to common areas and rooms, central to everything. Some highlights: (i) the rooms are very well organized, with small but well done bathrooms, well thought out space, sound proof walls and windows; (ii) the roof is a real treat (3 separate levels, nice chairs and great views of the whole city (Vatican to the west); (iii) professional and multi-lingual staff. Very nice breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome -- stay at Hotel Campo De' Fiori”
Reviews.Author: RosannNJ
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome mid July 2010 with my daughter and a friend. We spent 3 nights in Rome and then traveled down to the beautiful Amalfi Coast. The hotel staff at Campo De' Fiori was extremely friendly and all spoke fluent English (hello to all -- Matteo, Barbara, Valentina & Guido -- oh, and also hello to Vickie-whose friendly smile and soft voice greeted us each morning at breakfast!). The location was great and the rooms were beautiful, spacious and very clean! The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. A very nice continental breakfast was offered each morning. I would highly recommend staying here while in Rome (very central to most sight-seeing attractions).

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Norwegianguy017
Reviews.Content: If you go to Rome - stay there! It is small, nice, very good staff and the balcony on the roof was the best part. From there you can see the center of the town. The price - not cheap but the quality made it acceptable. Campo di Fiori is close by. And may of the other sights in Rome are not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennyT0m
Reviews.Content: The hotel Campo de Fiori was located in a side street next the square Location was marbelous; Navona,Panteon and the Trevi fountain we're on walking distance. Staff was friendly, rooms we're small but adequate. All in all our stay was very nice and Rome was beautiful! we booked tours with InLimoRome. We were picked up at the airport by Andrea, our driver for five days and we toured the ancient Rome,Vatican,Pompei and Florence We shall certainly use again and tell all our freinds to do so when travelling to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelinfiddler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Campo de Fiori in Rome is a small ,well run hotel in the old section of Rome. Considering the location, it is remarkably quiet with small rooms that are well maintained by the excellent staff. Features include a free breakfast, room safe, refrigerator and a roof deck that in the evening offers a spectacular view of the lit Rome skyline. Contrary to the writeup in Fodor's , we found the staff to be extremely helpful. If you fly into Rome, we recommend getting the hotel to send a car to avoid getting ripped off by cab drivers. You could end saving money and stress. Book early because they fill up well in advance. Finally, the matresses were excellent. ( This was a re-posting of an earlier review to remove typos.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place - inbetween all the sights”
Reviews.Author: kev77kev
Reviews.Content: Not a bad word to say about the hotel. Everything went smoothly, nicely central to pretty much everything. Nothing is more than a 20 minute walk away. Helpful staff, a great roof terrace and air conditioned rooms too help you sleep in the summer heat. If you are looking for a wine opener, check under the sink in the bathroom. We could've asked the reception, but for some reason did not. A highly recommendable hotel, will certainly go back when ever i am in Rome. Ida & Kevin

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WITH GREAT STAFF ESPECIALLY MATTEO”
Reviews.Author: ANAMERICANINROME
Reviews.Content: We are a couple that travelled to Rome with another couple. This hotel has nice rooms, terrace, and great position centrally located. This was our second time in Rome and we decided to stay in this Boutique hotel. It was a great decision and had a great time. The staff at the hotel was helpful and kind but there was Matteo who was outstanding in all aspects. Great knowledge of all to see and visit. Had a pleasant word for us everytime we meet him. He actually made our trip from 7 to 10! We will never forget Roma and Matteo! We recommend to all this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: USATRAVELER00101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I passed a fabulous 2 weeks in Italy but the most memorable stay was at hotel Campo de' Fiori in Rome. The position was great, a real "Boutique Hotel" with nice rooms, romantic atmosphere and a fabulous roof terrace. The reception has a good staff but there was Matteo who was there when we arrived and intervined and I need to say, " made our stay a real pleasure". A very kind and intelligent person. Explained to us the history of Rome, the monuments, there locations, what to see in Rome, where to have dinner and made us both feel at home. A real pleasure! When we left we felt like we were leaving a piece of our family in Rome. Thank you Matteo!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely oustanding staff!!”
Reviews.Author: WoodstockBuddy
Reviews.Content: THE STAFF-BARBARA, GUIDO AND THE MANAGER FRANCO SEVERINO could not have been nicer in trying to help us locate another hotel. We mistakenly booked a room at the Campo de Fiori B&B, thinking we would be staying at the Hotel Campo de Fiori. Sadly they did not have room for us, but after trying for nearly an hour! did find us a nice place nearby. They told us that this happens often as the other place is misrepresenting themselves with a web page that looks great and has a very similar name. They are in a disoute with the B&B. We wish we could have stayed at Hotel Campo de Fiori and will if we ever return to Rome. Thanks to all of you for helping us out of a very disturbing situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and very romantic roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Cellin0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at your hotel last week for 4 nights and I would just like to send you my best regards and thank you for a very enjoyable time. Valentina and all the staff were extremely helpful and gave us super tips about the beach in Fregene and the wellness centre near the hotel. We had a very relaxed and memorable time.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the crown of Rome...”
Reviews.Author: AnyaSmithLondon
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful time at the delightful Hotel Campo De' Fiori, which made our parent's wedding anniversary very special indeed and will be a memory to treasure... In a great spot, next to Campo De Fiori, where the market is held most days, there are plenty of places to eat, drink and be happy....and yet the hotel is quiet. The busier areas of Piazza Navona and Piazza Di Spagna are only a short walk away, as is the Fontana de Trevi and other must-sees - in fact everywhere you look in Rome is a must-see! Beautifully decorated with great style, Hotel Campo De Fiori is charming, as are the staff who looked after us so well. (Special thanks to Barbara, Valentina and Edith) The rooms are comfortable and elegant, fully air-conditioned and just lovely. The spacious roof terrace is an added bonus for all guests, where the splendour of Rome can be enjoyed at any time of day... When we return to Rome (of course, we threw our coins in the Trevi to make sure!) we would wouldn't think of staying anywhere else ; )

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: isifun
Reviews.Content: Campo de Fiori is a real find!!!! The rooms are very comfortably and elegant and we had a romantic stay! The location is excellent and in the evening feels like returning home. The staff is great, Valentina, Guido, Matteo, Angelo and Barbara are warm and welcoming and suggested us nice restaurants and sighseeing tours. WE WILL COME BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and it's true how great the rooftop terrace is.”
Reviews.Author: Smilesalot
Reviews.Content: After our port intensive Med cruise it was a relief to have such a haven as this hotel to unwind for three nights. We loved our top floor room with it's own terrace and the access to the fabulous large rooftop terrace was right outside our door. The terrace was not only a great 360 degree view of the historic area of Rome but it was such a great social place to join others over wine in the hours leading up to sunset. Magic. The staff is so helpful and made us feel so welcome there. Highly recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great staff - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bostonman3
Reviews.Content: During the month of June we stayed in this Boutique hotel. The position was fabulous the rooms alittle small but very nice. The reception staff was what made our stay excellent. It was like being at home. They were all good but there was one that was really amazing which was Matteo. He entered immediately into harmony with us and made us really feel important. He knew all about every monument and he even called the Vatican (when others of the staff didn't know what to do) to find out some information for us which we found absolutely amazing! He got us into the Papal Audience without a reservation! He helped us also with restaurants, and transportation. Our trip was fabulous and we highly suggest this Boutique Hotel to all who go to Rome and also to see the roof terrace which has an amazing view of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and fabulous personnel”
Reviews.Author: Thomas45
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at the end of May. The weather was good and the hotel was fabulous. When we arrived the morning receptionist wasn't the best but then this was forgotten when we met Matteo, an amazing gentleman with a vast knowledge of all and explained to us many sites and monuments we were going to see and suggested excellent restaurants. He as well as the amazing roof terrace made our stay. We recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Spectacular Views from the Roof Terrace”
Reviews.Author: ClaireArmstrong
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to travel to Rome as a birthday treat to both of us. We chose this hotel because of the location and because it had a roof terrace. The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful - they organised a pick up from the airport and from then on gave us fabulous advice during our trip. They helped us to book trips and restaurants and were so friendly. Our room was lovely and spacious (standard room - 203) with a very smart bathroom and power shower. There were shutters and black-out curtains and air conditioning which made sleeping very easy! The roof terrace is spectacular with fabulous views over Rome. It's a haven when you have been walking around in the heat all day. A perfect place to go for an afternoon sunbathe and glass of vino! It's also beautiful after dark when all the lights of Rome are twinkling! I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know who is travelling to Rome. If I was ever going back I would love to stay here again - it was a complete treat and we had a fabulous time!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and great roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: JoeandSandra
Reviews.Content: We di a day trip from a cruise to Rome 2 years ago and decided it was time for a proper visit. We stayed for 3 nights 6-9th June in double deluxe with balcony (red room) and views towards the vatican and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room is well maintained with large comfy bed and the fridge was most appreciated being able to chill our stock of drinks! The free champagne we received from our package also went down well. The hotel is a boutique hotel so it's not large but it is immaculately kept plus the staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooftop terrace affords great views and is a great place to relax and have a few drinks with other guests, as we did each night. The breakfast room is in the basement and is very nice. It's a continental breakfast, so no sausages or eggs but it is one of the best one I have seen in Europe (Banks Mansions in Amsterdam do eggs so they win!) There is plenty of meat bread etc and a lot tastier than the cardboard breakfasts of France. The hotel location is perfect for walking to all the sights, no more than 20 minutes from the Vatican and Colisseum. We queued for almost 1 hour in high temperatures to get into the Vatican museum (well worth it) and when we left at about 12.10 you could have walked straight in! Similarly when we went to the Colisseum we were 'advised' by the guides outside that it was over 1 hour wait to get in but for 25 euro extra each we could jump the queue and get a guided tour, this was down to 8 euro each as we entered the queue and then 4,5 euro halfway along! We actually waited only 20 minutes and all in the shade. We took in the 3D Rewind Rome experience in a street behind the Colisseum (Camp de Africa or something)it was good fun and you can get a chance to dress up as a Gladiator or Senator, they dont charge you for this part and use your own camera. The receptionist recommended a rooftop meal at The Grand Hotel Minerva next to the Pantheon, its a 5 star hotel so not cheap, the food was excellent and the service was second to none and we were pleased with the recomendation, we also ate at theTucci restaurant in Piazza Navona and again enjoyed a very good meal with service to match, it was enjoyable watching the street buskers in action. In all we thought and also after speaking with other guests, you cannot really go wrong wherever you choose. One thing I would point out is the scandalous excjhange rates given out at exchange booths, the ATMs had ran out of money on the Sunday and had not refilled by Monday so I was forced to use the exchange place at the Pantheon where I was ripped off by 20% commission!! 87cents to the pound is absolute theft! When ATMs did work I received 1.21 Euro for my pound so beware of these rogues. We enjoyed our stay we had glorious weather, saw a beautiful city and topped it all by sunbathing (with a cheeky wee wine or two of course) on the rooftop terrace to wind down after lots and lots of walking. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelleywink
Reviews.Content: this is a small, beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of rome. the staff, especially olga, is extremely friendly and helpful. the rooms are clean and beautifully appointed. the bathroom is immaculate and newly tiled. each room has a refrigerator. the air conditioning worked well. there is a gorgeous tri-level rooftop terrace, where you can sit during the evening as well as the daytime, with a panoramic view of the city. the location of this hotel is perfect: right in the center of the city, within walking distance of all the fountains and the parthenon. it is situated on a square with lots of restaurants, shopping and a fresh fruit market. although it was our first trip to rome, i doubt wether you could find a better place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: italyfan61
Reviews.Content: Our family booked 2 rooms and stayed 4 nights in this hotel. I love the convenient location, beautifully decorated room, very chic bathroom, and great breakfast. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially Olga, the helpful receptionist with a great smile. We like the hotel overall. The only reason I gave it four stars rating was that the room was small. However, that being said, we did enjoy our stay and would stay there again. Next time, hopefully there will be no rain so that we can enjoy their awesome roof-top terrace with wonderful seating space and beautiful views of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: cathf2012
Reviews.Content: My family (four, including myself) stayed at this hotel for four nights and were extremely happy with everything. The location is really great. Honestly, for the price you pay, it is worth it. We managed to cover alot of ground just by walking around near our hotel and saw some interesting and beautiful churches. The rooms were delightful and tastefully decorated. They were both unique in arrangement and decor, which was refreshing. (we separated into two rooms, seeing as how there were only two allowed per room). The bathroom provided adequate room with a spacious sink and shower. Even though I have to admit the room was somewhat cramped, it was still comfortable and not really a bother. We had two large suitcases with us. There is a TV, but be warned, there is only one or two English channels at the most. One of them was a news channel, which repeated the same news two or three nights in a row, which was hilarious in our opinion. The bed itself was large and very comfy. We had a view of the street directly in front of the hotel, which was nice. However, there is a club and bar located very near to the hotel (almost right across the street), and at first, it was a big nuisance. But we eventually became used to it after a couple of nights. The breakfast was excellent and had a wide array of pastries, croissants, and meats. We always were the first ones down there (its located in the basement), and it was nice having the room to ourselves :) There was always a waitress to greet us and ask us if we wanted any coffee, cappucino, etc. There is no charge for it, although make sure you know your room number (she will ask). The only complaint I had was the music selection during breakfast. It was a bunch of techno and syncopation that really was out-of-place and tacky. We thought it more funny than anything else, however. The front-desk staff are as friendly as can be. They made reservations, called taxis, and recommended restaurants for us. On the first night, we were recommended to this restaurant that was supposed to be one of the best. I don't know if they were commissioned to tell us to go there, but honestly, it wasn't that great. So, for food selections, I would advise people to do research on their own and decide what they like for themselves. Overall, I really didn't have any complaints or troubles during our stay in Campo de Fiori and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location & Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: carl_07_13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply amazing for three reasons. Its location made everything a fifteen minute walk and you got to stay next to one of the best open market plazas in Italy. Second the service and accommodations were perfect, anything you need or needed help with the staff would gladly assist you. A young lady that worked there named OLGA.... was simply perfect, her help and wonderful attitude would bring me back just for her. The third was the price, reasonably priced for such a great location and amenities, it really made you feel like you were living in ROME !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, lovely accomodation”
Reviews.Author: tatafanow
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, right on the square and between the Vatican and Colosseum, within waking distance if you are healthy, about 20 minutes either way. This was my second trip to Rome and will be going back. I stayed in one of the sister apartments of the hotel also just off the square, steep stone stairs and a small room but value for money as on a budget. Clean and comfy, don't expect air conditioning in the apartments as they are in ancient buildings, but then who wants to spend their time stuck inside anyway! The square is bustling in the day as a fresh food market, then at night all is cleared away to make room for tables and chairs for people to while the evening away wining and dining. You can use the hotel amenities whilst in the sister apartments, the hotel is lovely and the rooftop terrace views are not to be missed. Wonderful.....

Reviews.Title: “Rude Owner - Avoid the Aparment "Upgrade" and Stay in the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RuthTrips
Reviews.Content: We had a very unfortunately experience in what should have been a fantastic hotel. When we checked in they said they had “upgraded us” to a studio apartment instead of the room that I had reserved. The truth was that they overbooked and needed a place to put us. The apartment was located two doors down from the hotel. We had to carry our bags up to the second floor and the room was over a fish market and smelled terrible. Although we asked to be moved, there were no rooms available. At night, the plaza outside the hotel fills up with teenagers who drink to all hours of the evening. At about 3 in the morning, someone broke through the front door and we could hear them going up and down the stairs outside the apartment. We tried to call the office but discovered that there was no phone! They told us that they can’t put phones in the apartments because of some sort of wiring issue. We stayed awake almost all night and then next morning, insisted on changing rooms and getting our money back for our sleepless night. Fortunately, they were able to put us in another room (by putting another poor sole in the apartment) which was wonderful – it was so charming, the bathroom was wonderful and it had a phone and a safe. It was quiet and we felt secure. We tried to talk with the owner about the situation and what had occurred and he refused to even speak with us even though we had been told to come back multiple times … we tried to speak with him on three different occasions and eventually gave up. I have never experienced such a rude owner and a staff who could do nothing without his approval. He was the most ungracious, inhospitable person … truly a disappointment. Unfortunately, the experience with the hotel clouded our overall experience in Rome. If you decide to go to this hotel, be sure that you go to the hotel and that they do no not try to “upgrade” you to an apartment!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel... amazing location... great roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: stevegos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in one or the "cheaper" rooms. We had room 203 which is an internal room with window looking out onto a small dark court yard (which also made the room quieter than those more expensive rooms with a view!). The room was small but well decorated with comfortable standard double bed, good storage with fridge and safe. The bathroom just had a shower which did lack hot water, but it was just about usable. Bathroom very stylish, and clean. Air conditioning worked fine, but you needed to have the window closed for it to work. Which we always had to have closed as a member of staff (or someone) was frequently smoking in the courtyard and the smoke kept coming in our room. Staff were all helpful and pleasant. There is wireless internet in the reception area but not in the rooms. the hotel loaned me a network cable which worked but was broken. I would recommend anyone take their own cable - over 3 or 4 meters is best! Breakfast was the typical continental selection served in the basement (no windows)... but... ask for a tray and take it up to the roof terrace and it the best thing about this hotel. You can see all around Rome for miles. It really made the difference. Location: Excellent. Close to the usual attractions and just off a very lively piazza with lots of resturants, bars, live music, entertainers, etc. During the day there is a market in the piazza which was nice to strole around. Buses stop nearby. Plus very importantly... an excellent Italian icecream shop nearby! All in all this is not a cheap hotel and I'm not quite sure it was worth the money, but we enjoyed every minute.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Wen47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 9 - 13th. The front desk could not have been more pleasant and helpful. Sometimes I asked the same question three different times and Olga answered each time with a smile. She also recommended a restaurant called Cul de Sac that is within walking distance to the hotel and felt like eating food your Italian mother makes. Since it was mother's day and my husband's birthday, our son sent flowers and spumante for us through the hotel desk. Olga was very excited about our "surprise". It was a very personal touch. Our room was elegant and cozy. We always had hot water. The breakfast is enough to get you going. We never seemed to stop eating for long on our time away from the hotel anyway.
