They arranged for taxis, a private car to the airport and museum information. Even if you look at photos of the roof garden on the web, it doesn't prepare you for how special it is. The hotel's location is literally minutes from many sites and the market in the square always delighted us. Our best laid plans were thrown literally to the volcanic wind and we were held in Dublin for two nights. This meant our Positano plans had to be cancelled and we needed two more nights in Rome. This was to be for Fri. and Sat. night and it was very crowded. Both by phone and in person, the front desk tried to help us get a room elsewhere. We would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “NO HOT WATER”
Reviews.Author: doglady75
Reviews.Content: Pleasant small hotel. Very nice staff. Lovely rooftop terrace as mentioned on your website. BUT the lack of hot water when you're paying almost $500 per night seems to me inexcusable. Also, there are zero bath amenities. Not even a kleenex! Twice I tried to change Euros at the desk - no change available for either a 50-euro or 20-euro note. Breakfast was just ok, also as mentioned in other reviews

Reviews.Title: “perfect location with outstanding staff & lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: b2352
Reviews.Content: my daughter & i could walk to many, many places around rome from our hotel. we felt very safe. the staff was totally helpful on arranging transportations from the airport, to the train station and for a day trip outside of rome. they also had many suggestions on places to go & see. as well as obtaining reservations to museums. the staff was very welcoming and personable. they love their city and it was very pleasantly infectious. the square was right there.....a marketplace by day, wonderful restaurants by night. so convenient, after a long day of sight seeing and shopping. the room was on the small side but laid out very well. it was decorated in a hip old world style. very comfortable. and a great bathroom. truly can't say enough how the both of us enjoyed the hotel. and would even consider staying there again because of the staff. (usually when returning to a foreign city, i like to venture out & stay in a different area.) loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauriant
Reviews.Content: After bad experience at another hotel (Daphne Inn, Trevi) we checked into Campo De Fiori and had a fantastic experience. From the very LOVELY, sweet, efficient Valentina and her collegue we could not have been treated better. Rooms very clean, great beds and showers and staff amazing. Valentina is a treat we will remember - she treated us like FAMILY! What a gem! Can't wait to return! Whomever hired Valentina is genius because she represents the true loveliness of the Italian people in a 5 STAR way!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome A+++++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: Adventure5515
Reviews.Content: Lovely and very clean Hotel, very good location. Hotel employees very friendly and always ready to help, from hotel loacation 2 min by walk via del corso and from there to the left a 25 min by walk to the Vatican; from the right 15 min by walk to Piazza Venezia and from there 10min by walk to the Coloseum

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pamelaann82
Reviews.Content: Basically any hotel in Rome will have a "great location" because the historical center is small, but this truly was an amazing location! We were able to walk everywhere, including the Colosseum, in 15 minutes or less. We never once had to use the Metro to get anywhere. The hotel is very charming. Our room was small as all hotel rooms in Rome seem to be, but so well laid out that we didn't feel cramped and had plenty of room. The TV speaker in the bathroom was a nice touch we liked! I can't say enough about the roof deck- their own pictures don't even do it justice. There are three tiers, plenty of nice seating, and 360 degree views of the entire city. That view can't be beat! The breakfast is pretty minimal compared to an American hotel but it was enough for us. The staff is pretty nice and the restaurants they recommended were superb. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “everything excellent (but one the receptionists...)”
Reviews.Author: DME78
Reviews.Content: The location doesn't need any comment: it's stuck in the centre, at walking distance from everything. The hotel is nice, quite, clean and the staff is very nice and caring (apart from the italian receptionist. Just to mention an episode: she was engaged in personal call and doesn't bother to help out for an issue in order to cut it short and resume her own business on the phone). Will stay at Hotel Campo de' Fiori for sure again next time in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room with a view”
Reviews.Author: bertram31
Reviews.Content: What a perfect little hotel in a great location. I guess we got one of the two rooms with a balcony on the sixth floor. Spectacular sunsets over the Vatican! We were in Rome the first part of March and it was quite cold and brisk. The patio on the roof was great but a little cool and breezy in the evening. The room was very clean, the bathroom was more than adequate, and the staff was very helpful. I looked at other reviews regarding this hotel and it seems there are some apartments connected with this hotel. I would only stay here again if I could get one of the two rooms with a balcony. We stayed two days and then moved to another hotel in Room because we could not get the same room for 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here every time!”
Reviews.Author: FastCarFerrari
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo de Fiori was our saving grace after we had been dreadfully let down by the neighbouring Casa de' Fiori. What a fantastic boutique hotel the Hotel Campo de Fiori is! The rooms are very comfortable and the bathrooms are clean and offer decent space. The location of the hotel is unbeatable - right in the heart of the city centre by the idyllic Campo de Fiori, and about 5 mins walk from Piazza Navonna. As I said, we'd had an awful night at the Casa de Fiori for one night, so we checked out, walked straight across the square and into the oasis that is Hotel Campo de Fiori. The staff were so warm and helpful. I will definitely always book this hotel if available whenever I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay in any other hotel or location in Rome - both are Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: chops7
Reviews.Content: You can't do better, in my opinion. This was my second time at the Campo De Fiori hotel, and hopefully not the last. The renovation is beautiful with a touch of whimsy. The rooms are comfortably elegant - including up to date bathrooms, a fridge, and flat screen tv - and impeccably clean. Hopefully you won't be in your room much, given all there is to do in Rome, but it is such a pleasure to return to after a long day of sightseeing and eating too much! The entire staff is outstanding - professional, warm, friendly, and incredibly helpful. Most speak excellent English. I am particularly grateful to Valentina and Edith at the front desk for giving great advice about restaurants, taxis, shopping, sightseeing etc In addition to all this is the extraordinary location. You can't beat the Campo De Fiori for cafes, people watching, and Roman street life. Ask to have a quiet room in the hotel, and noise from the square will not exist. Finally the location is central to many sights. If you are a good walker you'll be able to do a lot of sightseeing by foot. ENJOY!! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Rome's Centro Storico”
Reviews.Author: FR73
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a very enjoyable stay in this lovely hotel with my wife and our 2 sons (aged 10 and 1). I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a hotel with character in the historic centre of Rome at a reasonable price. We stayed in a triple room on the 5th floor , which had a wonderful high, wood-beamed ceiling. There were 2 full length, shuttered windows which opened to give a lovely view on to the Piazza del Biscione and over the surrounding rooftops. In spite of the lively location near to numerous restaurants and bars around the Campo de' Fiori, with the windows closed and shuttered, we were able to have very peaceful nights. The breakfast buffet was very good, and the service attentive. The location is ideal, next to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona, and also quite near to the Forum, Piazza Venizia, and the Colloseum. The number 64 or 40 buses along Corso Vittorio Emanuele II connect to the Vatican, while the dinky electric 116 bus wends its way through the historic centre to the Via Veneto and Villa Borghese. Anyone wishing to book this hotel should check the hotel's own website, as they seem to have a range of special offers available, making this a very reasonable option price-wise for the historic centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: pinguins
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were in this little and charming place for Valentine's Day and we had a wonderful time. the roof teace, the very stylish rooms , the market , all the restaurants and tourist attractions very close by . you should try it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Harold_Hilder
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel with all main attractions within 20 mins walk. Room was very comfortable and clean with no outside noise. Black out curtains meant we could have slept all day! Continental breakfast was good with good supply of coffee or tea served by a very gracious lady.The hotel receptionist spoke excellent English and has a fantastic sense of humour. She was very helpful with information about the local eateries and places to visit.The hotel has a lovely roof terrace which we would have used had it not been covered in snow!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Fernando_SP
Reviews.Content: Campo De' Fiori was a real find in our trip! It is a very cozy and charming hotel. The rooms have a beatiful and warm decoration (we have seen 2 of them). Besides, they are very are clean, quiet and relatively spacious. The bathroom is also wonderful. But the real highlights of this hotel are: 1) the staff (special thanks to kind Olga); and 2) the superb location, right in the heart of Rome! We will certainli be back!

Reviews.Title: “Choice location for all of Rome”
Reviews.Author: 777pilot
Reviews.Content: As an airline pilot, I stay in a lot of hotels all over the world. Campo De' Fiori was very clean, excellent refurbishment, interesting with its history. Great location for walking all over Rome, or just hanging out in the local area. The hotel personnel were very helpful (good English spoken). Nice accommodations and shower. Reasonable price. I guess the only negative is it is not near a metro, but the bus is available, if that is important; and on Saturday night the piazza outside gets a bit raucous, but fun!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Apartments”
Reviews.Author: ansh97
Reviews.Content: The apartments are really nice. Location is stunning. Although expensive, it is totally worth each and every penny, nickel and dime.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel...Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dreamdance
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. The service and breakfast were outstanding. The location was also perfect. It was on a quiet side street, and a stones through from a piazza with plenty of restaurants. Our room was really nice with an beautiful view of Rome. We had one of the rooms on the top floor. Great shower and comfy bed.... Would for sure stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: dutchbuis
Reviews.Content: great location, very clean and friendly staff, specially mateo and olga. breakfast is very good. beautiful view from the terrace overlooking the city. would stay here again when in rome again next time. walking distance to all major sights.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Vic051
Reviews.Content: Located at the very popular Campo de Fiori and within walking distance to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, the Trevei Fountain, and the Trastevere district, this very lovely hotel has very nice rooms, a warm and friendly staff, and a great breakfast to start our day. One member of our party had been in Rome 2 other times and had stayed at very expensive hotels, but she preferred this hotel and its great location. One additional note...our flight from Rome to Palermo was cancelled and AlItalia claimed that we did not have a reservation, which was incorrect. The hotel staff went to great lengths to contact the right people at Alitalia and secure our flight to Palermo and correct the problem. The staff at the Hotel really impressed us! When we return to Rome we will make every effort to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to find, but great location, small but clean rooms, great staff, fantastic view from roof terrace.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisR11
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff at the front desk went out of their way to help in locating parking, restaurants, and other destinations. The rooms, at least the room we stayed in, was rather small, but it was immaculate with the cleanest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel. If you are looking for a tourist trap type hotel, this is not your place to stay. It’s located in the Western part of Rome, closer to the residential areas and adjacent to the Campo de Fiori, one of Rome’s best open air markets. The 360 view of Rome and the Vatican from the roof terrace is fantastic. After 3 previous trips to Rome, the only negative that I can think of about Hotel Campo de Fiori, is that there are no Metro (subway) stops nearby. I wish we could have stayed here longer and will definitely put it at the top of my list for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience- highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmieMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo De' Fiori was a fantastic hotel and where we began our vacation in Italy. Everything was wonderful - from the room to the location to the staff. We especially felt so welcome by Olga. She was incredible - very helpful in recommending great restaurants, sights to see , how to get there and anything else we needed.. She made us feel like we were special, as we're sure she does with each hotel guest. . We actually booked this hotel based on the high reommendations posted on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed and would gladly return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another name for perfection - Campo De'Fiori”
Reviews.Author: chitowngo
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome - we could not have asked for a better hotel - great, friendly staff, great location - we could walk everywhere - we highly receommend Campo De'Fiori! Special thanks to Matteo and the rest of the front desk staff for their help making sure a package sent to us from the States finally got to us in Florence - we didn't even have to ask - they just followed up and made it easy - thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Hassle”
Reviews.Author: happy_trails_2_you99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments. It was the worst I have ever stayed in. You must check in at the hotel, and then drag your luggage down the street and around the corner where the apt building is located in a graffiti filled alleyway. We were informed there was no telephone, but there was, it was simply not working / no line? The elevator in the building can only fit one person with one suitcase at a time. You are given one set of keys; one key for the front door of the apt building and one key for your door. What a hassle. How do four people get in and out of the apt with one key? It's not like a hotel, where you can walk in and knock on your door to be let into your room. There is no one in attendance in the apt lobby, the front door is locked, and remember, there is no telephone to call up to the room. It was extremely annoying. The worst aspect of this though, is the fact that the front door to the building automatically locks from the inside also. You need the key to get OUT of the building. It made me sick to think if there was ever a fire in this place. Scrambling to unlock doors,or, what if your friend has the key and they are out of the building, and of course, no phone to call for help. For this reason alone, this place was unacceptable. The apt itself looks like it was last remodeled in 1978. The icing on the cake for me was when we were leaving. We dragged our suitcases back to the hotel to check out and we were pretty tired. We asked to use the phone to call a taxi, and the desk clerk adamantly refused to let us use it, or call one himself. I reminded him that there was no telephone in our apt, and we would gladly pay for the call, but again, the answer was "no". This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. There are so many better choices to stay at in Rome than this fire hazard.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: LolaLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from six days in Rome at the Hotel Campo De' Fiori in Rome. It was a wonderful visit and the hotel was perfect. The staff was more than accomodating and all spoke English. The rooms were small, but from what I hear, pretty normal for European standards. They were clean, charming and cozy. I found the beds to be comfortable, too. Every morning, I would pull back our drapes and open our shutters and windows and listen to the people passing by. The market is just around the corner and it was fun to be able to walk though there every morning or afternoon before they packed up. The piazza also has many restaurants to grab a dinner or a quick bite to eat. Also, there is shopping all around. I was surprised to see as many students as we did, but that was the case in Florence as well. From this location, we were able to walk just about everywhere. We could have taken buses, etc but we really enjoyed exploring the city by foot. I would stay here again without a doubt. Arriving via the airport, the hotel can make arrangements for a driver to pick you up for 50 euros or you can take a cab which could cost 35-45 euros. If you arrive via the train station as we did, a cab is the quickest way to the hotel and cost about 12-15 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: mdials
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for two days just recently. I booked 2 rooms, but only one was confirmed. Luckily, I caught this before we left the US and so they confirmed an apartment they have nearby for the other room. The staff at the hotel speak great English but are not the most helpful. They hand you a map, circle the location of the hotel and send you on your way. Compared to others that we encountered, they were not as helpful. We asked the first man we met at the desk for a dinner recommendation. He told us of one restaurant and we asked twice for them to make a reservation. He said he would and would leave the information for us at the desk when we returned from sight seeing. When we got back, his shift was over and there was no information. Luckily, we got a great restaurant recommendation from someone else at the desk. The apartment, though very spacious, was not nearly as luxurious as the hotel and was not air conditioned. Before we left, I was assured that this wouldn't be an issue in Rome in October but given the temps were in the 80s, it was hot. The best, most wonderful place about this hotel is the rooftop terrace. It is stunning and very spacious. We went there each night to enjoy wine and cheese and the amazing view. The terrace made the hotel so special. The location is great-- very near neat shops (for shopping), restaurants, markets, and the major sights. We walked everywhere and it was a good resting spot between Ancient Rome and the Vatican. The room in the hotel was small, but very nice. The bathroom was wonderful. Overall, the price was higher than some but given the location, the luxury and the rooftop terrace, it was still a great value. If the staff had been friendlier and not messed up the reservation, it would get 5 stars from us!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, great location, excellent staff, we will return”
Reviews.Author: chipperAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be perfect for what we needed. While the bedroom was small, the bathroom was large and lovely. But it was really Olga at the desk who made our stay so great. She recommended wonderful restaurants, and gave us terrific directions to everywhere we went. She was always so friendly and patient. Bene Bene!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, exceptional room for price, roof top with view to relax at end of day”
Reviews.Author: Gertee
Reviews.Content: Rooms have all been remodeled...bathroom was wonderfully modern. Location is in heart of Rome and every sight was walkable for us from the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Roof top deck had plenty of room for many people to relax and enjoy the view. Common areas were lovely and breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great”
Reviews.Author: pete_coach
Reviews.Content: The location, as others have said was perfect. Piazza Campo de Fiori is just a behive of activity all day and night long. From the wonderful market during the day to the really nice resturants in the evening. In the afternoons it is a great place to just sit, have prosciutto and melon and, a glass of wine while the world goes by. It is a gathering point for not only tourists but is full of local people as well. Always a good sign. We stayed in a 6th floor room and they are very special. The decor is wonderful, the bathrooms very large by European and Italian standards and the balcony was just right. The rooftop deck is, in a word, special. It is the place to sit, with a bottle of wine, to watch the sunset over the Palatine hit and St Peters. Just special in all regards. The continental breakfast was very good and plentiful and the coffee excellent. The staff was superb, helpful in every way, from suggestions for restaurants to events to go and things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular rooftop view!!”
Reviews.Author: JoseMiami_FL
Reviews.Content: The room to this hotel is small but very charming. What captivated us was the rooftop view, it's incredible!! Great location too, centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGoMom
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel in the perfect locaion to walk to the Vatican and ancient Roman ruins. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was quite nice with a breakfast included. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, you want to be "in Rome"”
Reviews.Author: Happyvegemites
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of the Campo De Fiori market area. During the day it is a bustling market and at night it comes alive with music and fantastic restaurants. It is within walking distance to the many famous tourist spots and is very close to the hop on hop off bus stop. The hotel has recently been renovated and is delightful. The rooms although small with a standard double bed are very comfortable and beautifully decorated. The bathroom is big, fabulous, modern, clean. well lit with a huge shower cubicle and rain drop shower! The rooms are soundproofed, so at night you can close your window and be guaranteed a good night's rest away from the bustling city noise. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The roof garden is the perfect spot to enjoy the sounds and sights of Rome, especially at night with a good bottle of Italian wine! Very romantic! I would certainly stay again and will be recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, very helpful staff, roof terraces for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: KRSchubart
Reviews.Content: This is a well-run smallish hotel just off the Campo de' Fiori and therefore walking distance to many landmarks such as the Piazza Navona, the Church of Andrea delle Valle, and the Pantheon and right around the corner from the magnificent Piazza Farnese with its cafe bar, the very good trattoria Da Galleta and no parked cars--a real treat. Our double room was dark (when will Europeans decide that some at least of their guests like reading in their rooms?) and not very large, but this is apparently the norm in the older parts of the city and in an old building. And the A/C and cozy room is welcome after hot Roman streets. Besides you can always go to the roof and sit comfortably on one of the three terraces, imbibing and nibbling, if you've brought your own food and drink. The view is just what you want in the evening before going out to dinner. There is late-night noise from the crowds in the Campo, but it's filtered by good windows and curtains so that we had no trouble sleeping. Everything is up-to-date in the hotel and having free LAN service is in itself a reason to stay here, since some hotels, even high-end ones, charge through the nose for wi-fi. Breakfast is uninspiring--no cooked food--but included in the room rate. One can always go out to a local cafe for something better. There is a laundry around the corner in the Campo itself. The hotel also rents apartments in the neighborhood, we understand, which would be the best choice for a stay of more than three or four days. We thank the staff for being so helpful from the moment we contacted them in advance with questions about tours and how to book rooms separated by a few days to our final departure. English is spoken well by most staff and adequately by all. Taxis are called quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel in Perfect Location for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ozelite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my partner in August '09. The hotel is located 50m around the corner from the famous Campo De 'Fiori which is a wonderful area for eating and drinking as well as having great nightlife. The room itself was beautifully done in a period setting. Bed was large and aircon was fine. Staff extremely passionate and friendly about when and where to see the sights. Location is excellent as only a 5 minute walk to the piazza navona, 10 min walk to the trevi fountain and pantheon and 15 min walk to Vaticano and Colosseum. Also only a 10 min walk to the river and the wonderful trastevere area of eating/nightlife. There is a viewing deck above the top floor which is great to relax and have a few drinks and offers a really nice view of the area as well which was a bonus! No complaints whatsoever here, had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Superb luxury hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: NorthLondoner1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 4 nights in August 2009. We had a fantastic stay and would highly recommend it. The reason we picked it initially was because of the central location, and this didn't disappoint. You're about 5 minutes from Piazza Navonna - and all of the other main tourist sites in Rome are within walking distance (we spent 4 days sightseeing and walked everywhere). The hotel is on a small side street just off the Campo de' Fiori square. I probably would never have visited the Campo de' Fiori if we hadn't been staying here, but I was really glad we did. There's a fantastic selection of bars and restaurants on the square, and we found them to be just a little bit less busy and less touristy than Piazza Navonna. (There's a branch of the Obika mozzarella restaurant which is particularly good if you want a lunch of - well - cheese!) Our room was small (but not terribly small by continental European standards) but decorated to an incredibly luxurious standard. As lots of the other reviewers have said, the roof terrace is a stand out feature - you've got views over the rooftops of Rome. There's no bar on the roof, but they seem happy for you to take your own drinks up there. The only disappointing aspect for me was breakfast (and this is the reason I haven't given it a 5 star review). It was billed as a continental breakfast but mainly consisted of long life croissants and bread, and not much else. Don't let that put you off staying at the hotel, but maybe think about having breakfast out?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location and the interior is finished to a very high standard.”
Reviews.Author: EmmetJC
Reviews.Content: We spent the first two nights of our honeymoon in the Hotel and could not have had a more romantic Hotel. The interior decor is beautiful and perfect for couples. The Hotel booked a car to collect us from the Airport and it was a great start to our holiday. The Hotel is in a great location just off the Campo De Fiori. The roof terrace is a must and a great spot to bring some white wine, food and just relax and take in the views. Our only regret was that we only had two nights there and would go back in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: need4travelnow
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on knowing the location from a previous trip. The hotel was excellent! The staff was fabulous from the moment we arrived until the moment we departed! Olga, Tao, John Carlo, Victoria & Steve and many others made our stay so incredibly enjoyable that words cannot express our gratitude to them for their ideas and assistance! The rooms are small, but nicely furnished with small balconies, very clean and the bathrooms newly remodeled! The terrace on the 6th floor is fabulous! It's wonderfully breezy and relaxing. Bring your wine and a few glasses and you can see the entire city while you enjoy it! The location is excellent, 15 minute walk to the Vatican, Colosseum, Trestevere, Piazza Navona and Jewish Ghetto. Great square with many cafes, restaurants and bars! Have already recommended it to friends! Hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JMA07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights with our 17-year-old son. we really loved this hotel. When we first arrived I was a bit worried because our room was fairly small; but once we settled in we found that it was so well designed that it never felt cramped. The decor was charming and we had large French-style windows looking over a small piazza. (Very quiet at night when we closed them). The beds were comfortable, TV worked well and the bathroom was lovely. The roof garden has spectacular views in every direction--though they could use some shade for those hot Rome days. The breakfast was simple but fresh and filling, with gracious service from the cappuccino lady. The staff is superb (thanks, Valentina!), friendly, good English, full of wonderful dining suggestions. You cannot be the location. We loved being in the heart of old Rome, with the wonderful market around the corner. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “You Need To Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: traveler012345
Reviews.Content: After extensive research on the web, I decided to book a room at Campo De Fiori and never regretted it. The hotel is just as described in previous excellent reviews and we enjoyed our stay tremendously. The staff was courteous and extremely helpful. The rooms were clean and had complimentary wireless internet. The rooftop is big with great views of the city. The breakfast was nice and overall, the location of the hotel couldn't have been any better. We really wanted to be in the heart of everything and in this hotel, we were only a 20 min walk away from all the major attractions and shopping. In the evenings, we enjoyed being able to walk downstairs and be just a few short steps away from great restaurants and the atmosphere of the Campo De Fiori square. I hope we will return to Rome and when that happens, we will be sure to stay at the Hotel Camp de Fiori again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel, fabulously located in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dar3212
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull desk staff, recently up-dated, quiet rooms with beautiful bath, lovely linens and clean, clean, clean! Walk to all major attractions and eat in restaurants with the "locals", enjoying delicious, well priced food. Would never stay anywhere else in Rome. Great buy--you can count on value for your dollar here!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: roger4lin
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in an apartment associated with the hotel. It overlooked the piazza, had two bedrooms, a full kitchen and was cleaned daily. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Figgygirl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading good reviews on Trip Advisor, and was very glad I did. I received prompt and friendly replies to my emails from Olga, Valentina and Angelo, who explained they have standard and deluxe rooms, plus 2 with balcony on the top floor, giving lovely views. They offered me a good discount, so I booked one of the top floor rooms for 4 nts ( mon- fri) The hotel will book car transfer to/from the airport for you, at a fixed rate of 50 euros each way. We decided to book a shuttle through Viator.com from Fiumicino airport to the hotel, for 35 euros, and to book a car for our return trip. Although we found the shuttle desk without a problem, there was a queue of people also booking hotels. Only one person was serving so we had a long wait, and then had to wait again for the next shuttle. We wasted about 2 hours at the airport, but were pleased when the shuttle was an air conditioned Mercedes, that took us to the hotel door. LOCATION The hotel is literally just around the corner from the Piazza Campo De'Fiori where there is a market every morning. This is cleared away by late afternoon, and in the evening the piazza is buzzing with people and musicians. There are restaurants, trattorias and bars all around the piazza, which stay open until late.The hotel is soundproofed, so no worries about noise at night. In Italy some restaurants close after 3pm, but we found that most stayed open all day, so no problem getting food and drinks. The location is excellent, and we walked to all the sights; 10 min to Piazza Navona, with Trevi Fountain and Pantheon just beyond. 20 min to Castel Sant'Angelo, Vatican Museums and St Peter's Basilica. 20 min to Colosseum and Forum. This was at a leisurely walking pace. HOTEL It was very hot when we arrived, and walked into the cool, peaceful hotel entrance. There is classical music playing quietly. Matteo was at reception, speaks excellent English with an American accent. Very welcoming, and gave us a map of the city. There is a small lounge on the left. The hotel decor is very elegant with chandeliers and vaulted ceilings. There is a room to store baggage, and a W.C.( take a look- very grand, with fresh towels.) There is also a small writing area. The bedrooms are on 6 floors. The lift goes up to floor 5. There is a small flight of wooden stairs from here to the 2 balcony rooms, and the door to the rooftop terrace. The 360 degree view from the Terrace is spectacular. Worth taking binoculars to pick out the sights. Good view of St Peter's Dome to the west- beautiful at sunset. The hotel does not have a bar, but you can take your own drinks up to the terrace. Pack a bottle opener/ corkscrew. There are drinking glasses in the room. OUR ROOM We had room number 602, and this was really the icing on the cake. Definitely worth the extra cost. Decorated in green and gold,comfortable king sized bed ( 4 pillows), writing desk, armchair, double wardrobe. Minibar/ fridge with 2 complimentary bottles of water and safe. Flat screen TV on the wall, inside a gold frame. Chandelier, faux candle wall lights. Lace curtains over sliding doors to large balcony. Great view to the east. We could see the white National Monument to King Vittorio Emanuele II on the Piazza Venezia in the distance.Known as the Wedding Cake. Lovely sitting in the early morning sunshine, listening to church bells ringing, and relaxing at night to the sounds and music from the piazza round the corner. When we closed the doors, it was silent in the room. Modern shower room ( no bath) HUGE showerhead! Also a separate hand shower.Black wall and floor tiles, loo/bidet, sink, mirror, hairdryer. Plenty of towels, changed every day. There are speakers in the ceiling so you can hear the TV! CNN and BBC World news. Some toiletries are provided. The room was a good size. The other top floor room is similar, but faces west, with views of the Vatican. BREAKFAST This is taken on the lower ground floor ( -1) accessed by stairs or lift. Two joining rooms with vaulted ceiling. Buffet laid out, tea and coffee is brought to you. Coffee with hot milk is known as American coffee. You can also have expresso or cappuccino. Very cool and restful, with classical music playing quietly. Small elegant tables, antique bookcases. Breakfast consists of fruit salad ( yes it is tinned, but very nice) bread rolls, cheese, ham, yoghurts, cereals and cake. Croissants and biscuits in wrappers on your table, with jam, honey,marmalade. Ask if you want butter. Juices in a jug. It was plenty to set us up for the day. The hotel give you a map of the city, but we used the AA Rome city guidebook. Has clear maps of each area, plus a wipe- clean map of the city in large print. We also used Baedeker Rome book for info about the sights, as this contains site plans. Very useful, and saved paying 7 euros for an audio guide at each place. You can use the hop on/ off 110 tour bus. Does a round trip in about 2 hours for 8 euros. Stop and go day ticket costs 13 euros. We preferred to walk, as you see other sights on the way. Lots of churches!! There are always guides offering guided tours outside the sights. I read on Trip Advisor that Angel Tours are well recommended. Always carry water with you, as some sights do not have refreshments once inside. Advise trainers ( not sandals) for the Forum, as dusty and gritty. I carried a small umbrella ( you can buy paper parasols) as a sunshade, and took a small battery fan. That was a godsend at times. We prebooked Vatican Museum tickets online from the Vatican's website, for 9am and spent all day there. Tried to get tickets for the Scavi Tour ( underground tombs) but was full- you have to book way ahead for this. Had a fantastic trip, but still more to see, so want to return one day. Will definitely stay at the Campo De'Fiori. If you find a great hotel, why go elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Big bucks for a tiny space”
Reviews.Author: Funky_travel_junky
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its proximity to Piazza Navona and on that account it disappoint. We also loved the fact that it was tucked off the Piazza Campo di Fiori which whilst still full of tourists, felt slightly more authentically Roman - a great place to people watch and enjoy a beer or wine in the evening. The rooms are absolutely tiny - I'm guessing all the rooms are small but we paid €300 per night for a triple and the extra bed was a camp bed against the wall which amounted to about 1/2m of clearance between the double and the campbed. The bathroom was equally small with just a shower so we really struggled to manage logistics getting ready in the morning and going to bed - not quite what I had expected for the money. However, petit was balanced with a certain amount of bijoux - the rooms were interestingly (! - see the 'gold' beading round the TV...) furnished with dark green walls and a chandelier and the bathroom was faux marble effect. With flimsy curtains, the overall effect was quite dark and tacky but at least the room was clean enough. The public spaces were better decorated and the outside terrace was lovely, if too windy to actually use when we were there. Breaksfasts were at best adequate (coffee/tea, juices from cartons, cold meats, cheeses, cereal, fruit, prepacked 'plastic' croissants) but were a bit of an insult given the prices being charged, especially as there is a fabulous baker, Il Fornaio, just around the corner. A couple of other things annoyed me - the one lift in the hotel is pretty claustrophobic, taking 3 people max and the hotel staff seemed to permanently occupy it and to think it was their own private lift, I could sense the housekeeping staff rolling their eyes a couple of times as if I was inconveniencing them when I tried to squeeze in alongside them. On check out, we were the only guests waiting but had to wait for 15mins until the girl at the front desk worked through the housekeeping roster with housekeeping. When, she finally got round to checking us out - she gave me my bill in Euros and then processed my bill in GBP, with a poorer exchange rate than my Visa card would have given me, without informing me. So in short, not fabulous - great location, nice enough terrace and just ok rooms. I know Rome is an expensive city but I'm almost certain there are better places to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Campo de Fiori is excellent”
Reviews.Author: ClayJoDee
Reviews.Content: We had such an excellent experience at Hotel Campo de Fiori during the first leg of our vacation, that we canceled our reservation at a more expensive hotel and returned for our final night in Italy. The location is superb, close to incredible nightlife and many good restaurants. The staff went out of their way to accomodate us. Matteo, Olga, Angelo and Maria are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The rooms, while not exceptionally large, are elegant and recently remodeled. Be sure to check out the rooftop terrace, especially after dark, for an exquisite view of the Rome skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Rome for convenience, style and comfort”
Reviews.Author: fire20
Reviews.Content: My friend and I pciked the hotel from the many that was recommended. It has been remodeled in last two years. Great location - located right around the corner from the Campo market where something is going on all of the time. Service was impeccable from check in to advice on where to go and to eat, how to get to the airport or port the easiest. Continental breakfast was wonderful and the service there was great. They have a great roof garden where we shared a bottle of wine and watched the sun set. The room was very adequate and comfortable, especially the sound proofing that they had done. Can't think of anything that I didn't like. It was wonderful and worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about this property is the location”
Reviews.Author: bklynguy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty and it's right around the corner of the market at Campo de Fiori. Rooms are very expensive for what you get. In our 9 day stay in Italy, this was the most expensive property with the least amount of amenities. Most of the staff are pleasant, some are rude and uncaring. Superior room we had was very small (which didn't bother us so much) as it was very dark. Breakfasts were typical European with hams, cheeses, pastries, & coffee. Some of the cakes were stale on all 3 mornings. Roof deck is a nice retreat. Had the room price been more in line with comparable properties and if all the staff had been more friendlier, we would have given a better rating. Beds were comfortable and hotel seemed quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, Fantastic location, Rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: miller041
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of the city, with the market and shops, restaurants and cafes just steps away. And the main attractions are within walking distance (except St. Peters may be a little far for some to walk, a cab there is around $10). The area is touristy, but what area of central Rome isn't? Our room was recently redecorated, small but lovely. We thought 180 Euros was a good price for such a well located hotel. And it had a comfortable, plush, true double bed. As previous reviewers noted, the hotel has a furnished rooftop openair terrace with amazing views, a great way to relax after a day of walking through this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: BostonLulu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely charming and the service was perfect. The front desk staff was very helpful in every way. The location couldn't have been better, within walking distance to all the major sights. The breakfast was nicely prepared and served. The view from the terrace is spectacular! I was amazed at how quiet our room was as the hotel is right in the piazza which was very busy at night. The only suggestion I would have is that they have more light in the room. I hope to return to Rome some day and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great apartment, very very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: red56London
Reviews.Content: Stayed in apartment which is across square from hotel - great setup around the corner from excellent take-out pizza (quick lunch after we arrived on our dining room table). The Campo de Fiori is an excellent location (could it be better?) with loads of restaurants there, and interesting walks to most parts of the historic centre (we never bothered to take public transport while we were there, though we are keen walkers). The staff at the hotel were outrageously helpful, suggesting iterineraries when we wanted them, staying in the background when not. I would definitely come again (and stay at the main hotel or in the apartments). The apartments work out great if you're travelling (as we were) with kids. The only draw back is that the room that faced onto the little road was a bit noisy at night - there's a club just next door, and while we couldn't hear the club we did hear people chatting when they had spilled out of the door. However I feel like, that's what you get for staying in a great area of town: want it deathly calm? stay in the suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “lovely holiday”
Reviews.Author: CamCambridge
Reviews.Content: We can definitly recommend this hotel. The location is superb, the rooms are quiet thanks to double/triple glazing and the staff had been very helpful and friendly. The view from the roof terrasse is great. The only downturn had been the breakfast. Everything was wrapped in foil - no fresh croissants, no good quality juice, bread or jam. This was really disappointing !!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in all of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: theATLtraveler
Reviews.Content: From the first telephone inquiry with Olga to the last "arrivederci" (again with Olga) after a five day stay, the service at the Hotel Campo de Fiori was superb! The rooms are "European small" but very well appointed and impecably maintained. I'm certain this is the best located hotel in Rome if you are looking for authentic streetlife, nightlife, and a preponderance of Romans over tourists. Furthermore, every major tourist attraction in Rome can be reached after only a short walk from the hotel. My girlfriend and I never took any public transportation or taxis; we walked everywhere straight from the hotel. The Hotel Campo de Fiori has been remodeled significantly since I made my first of several visits 19 years ago. And it is better in every way but one: price, of course. With the improvements have come prices that are nearly out of my range, but the location, the service, and that magical rooftop garden will insure that I stay here every time I return to the Eternal City!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: GemeliaK
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in fabulous location with all major Rome attractions within 15 minutes walk. Our room while not huge was very well presented with an immaculate bathroom. The staff were polite and helpful and the roof terrace offers amazing views of the city and a great location to enjoy a pre dinner glass of vino. Breakfast is cold meats cheese and bread - perfectly adequate to get you started for the day. There is a square adjacent to the hotel full of bars and reasonably priced restaurants - you need not stray from here at night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: loughtoncpl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Campo De Fiori for 2 nights in March 09. From the moment we arrived to the day we left we found the staff helpful, polite and very friendly with all speaking excellent English. Our room was a standard double, which was elegantly decorating clean and a lot bigger than we were led to believe in some other reviews. The bathroom was very modern with a shower, no bath but this was not a problem for us. As for the location, it was perfect being so close to the Campo De Fiori, which meant we had bars and good restaurants nearby and also meant we were within walking distance of pretty much all the major sites in Rome. The roof terrace was a bonus and gave amazing views across this beautiful city. We will definitely be returning to this traditional Italian hotel and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rome: we came, we stayed, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: BolderBob
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel; we stayed at beginning and end of our journey. Filling breakfast included Plus location is just steps to market where we filled water bottle, bought a chunk of Parmigan cheese and fruit for lunch everyday. Very close to major sites. Staff is very informed, excellent english and solid recommendations. Streets wind a LOT nearby, we got lost constantly going to recommended eateries. The Staff's recommendations for dining were fantastic. Strongly recommend talking to front desk folks. Amazing view for photos from roof. Cool Basilica steps away too. Downsides: internet in room via tv was slow and worthless, we found an internet cafe nearby; staff recommended a nearby hotel for one night's stay (Campo was booked), that recommendation was poor. Room was a little dark, small. We loved and miss hotel though. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Generally great, if you're not big on breakfast... or space”
Reviews.Author: Juan_Moretime
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and I decided to splash out on a more expensive room, which was on the top floor. I had read reviews that the rooms were small but 'small' is a bit of an understatement... ours was tiny. There was barely enough room for the bed, and literally just a narrow space around it, though they have squeezed in a small dressing table and a tiny pouffe on which to sit at it. There was nowhere to put our suitcases except in the wardrobe, one at ground level, and nowhere to sit except on the bed. No chairs! No room for them. The bath room has no bath, just a shower, which admittedly is rather plush. So I suppose you could say the room was 'intimate', and the bed was certainly very comfortable and it was all cosy and finished to a high standard, but really, I'm not sure I would be able to offer it with a clean conscience as a double room if I ran a hotel. Change the double for a single bed and stick a chair in there... but then you'd probably not rent it half the time. On the plus side, the staff were very helpful, polite and friendly at all times. The internet only worked once by ethernet cable but thereafter I was given a WiFi access code, which was fine. If you're big on breakfast, sadly the breakfast falls rather short... there's nothing cooked, and everything is very processed: cold meats and cheese were not your typical Italian style but more like what you'd buy in Asda in the UK. Individually-packaged 'croissants' with long best-before dates; tinned fruit salad; supermarket yogurts, and milk left out to lose its chill; juices with indiscernible flavours and unnatural colours. Um-Bongo anyone? And finally, the cappuccino was just filter coffee with frothed milk on top -- I'm afraid I wasn't fooled. Okay so I understand they want to keep costs down by offering a breakfast that doesn't require more than a single member of staff to cater for the entire hotel, but we'd rather have paid more and had better. To redress the balance slightly for all that moaning (hey I'm British), I can say that the location is absolutely stunning, the views from the roof garden are stunning, the staff excellent, and on the whole we enjoyed our stay tremendously and would stay here again... we just might just lower our breakfast expectations, or grab breakfast in one of the many cafes around the Campo. --

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant location, fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: gbajz
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a fantastic position we managed to walk to all the attractions easily. The roof terrace is lovely with great views. The room although compact was superb in decor, very comfortable, quiet at night and very clean. (we did have a room with its own balcony which was great). The staff could not have been more friendly or helpfull, excellent in every way, helping us around the city, to and fro from the airport (excellent shuttle service arranged for us). and always welcoming. Extra bonus three excellent retaurants within two minutes walk. The La taverna del Ghetto, and the Brazia both in the same street the Via Portico d' Ottavia + the Osteria ar Galletto in the Piazza Farnese, but make a reservation or go early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EverGreenEscapes
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in Italy. (We went on to tour by bicycle and train much of Southern Italy.) We later realized that in general the level of service in Italy was quite high overall. The folks at the Campo De' Fiori were awesome. Breakfasts were substantial with great espresso, the staff was super helpful. They even accommodated an unusual request - the let us store our disassembled bicycles in their luggage storage area for one night. Besides the friendly staff, the view from the top floor balcony is amazing and the location is right in the middle of everything. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Campo de' fiori location”
Reviews.Author: Tom_from_Livermore
Reviews.Content: The room was quiet, fairly well lit. Room was small by US standards, but adequate. New lcd tv, with both cnn and bbc stations available. The washroom was excellent. Very modern. Comforable queen size bed. Desk staff very helpful. Air conditioning seemed adequate, though temperature outside never much over 68 F. Room window was not on a street. Would have been nice to have two chairs in the room, but then there'd have been less space. Campo de' Fiori 10 yards to the right out the front door. Location fairly central to most Rome sites. No. 23 bus to Vatican and No. 116 to Borghese are convenient. Nice views from roof top. 844 euros for 5 nights (low season).

Reviews.Title: “Unclean rooms, unbelievably rude staff”
Reviews.Author: rachelia18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two nights in August. It was by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The room reeked of cigarettes (even though we selected a nonsmoking room) and there was no way to open the little window to air it out. No light came in through the window either, we were in perpetual night. The shower leaked (hope it was the shower, could have been the toilet.) Finally, they charged us for phone calls we didnt make, I think they must have pulled that cheating stunt in the past because when I innocently asked about saying it was a mistake, the guy at the counter (from New Jersey) started shouting at me in a manner that was completely out of proportion to the question or tone it was asked in. My friend with me worried he had mental problems and almost called the police. Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: jannycam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo de Fiori is the perfect choice in Rome if you are looking for an intimate hotel in a superb location with all the details that create a charming ambience. Walking in the front door right around the corner from the bustling campo de fiori market place, I knew I had found the perfect little hotel. The arched wooden bookcase behind the front desk, the silver room keys in velvet boxes, the cozy sitting area furnished with traditional Italian furniture. There is a tiny lift to take your bags up to your room where you will find a heavy wooden door leading into small room with shuttered windows draped in silk, a dark wood beamed ceiling with a small crystal chandelier hanging from the center. The room is furnished with Venetian style furniture but has a very modern bathroom. You put your clothes away in a polished wooden cabinet. Every detail adds to the charm of the small room. One marvelous feature of the hotel is its beautiful roof terrace with wicker chairs and tables and comfortable lounge chairs. When it's time for siesta - grab a pizza from any of the local shops and head up to the terrace to realax, eat ,and enjoy the sunshine overlooking the city. The hotel is located within walking distance of any of the important sites you want to see in Rome. We walked everywhere. The campo de fiori itself can be very noisy at night as it is a popular gathering place for young people. But the good windows in the Hotel shut out most of the noise except for a background hum and the occasional burst of song which is just Rome by night. The breakfast room is exquisite with its Venetian painted barrel vaulted ceiling, a beautul wood Venetian bookcase across the back of the room and traditonal small tables and chairs set with linen and china. Bread, cheese, cereal, yogurt, fruit cocktail juices and coffee are offered. The front desk is helpful with directions, transfers etc. Prices are competitive with other small hotels in the 3 star category - but after peeking inside a few of the others, there is no comparison. If you are looking for the charm of a traditional Italian hotel which provides an intimate oasis in a bustling city, this is the place for you. I was totally enchanted with Hotel Campo de Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Campo De Fiori's apartments- great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: yourusername
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the apartments of Hotel Campo De Fiori in October 2008. The apartment was basic, but clean and well kept. If you stay in the apartments you don't get all the bells and whistles of the fancy hotel, but you do get a kitchen, which was a bonus for us. Another bonus of staying in the apartments was being able to take advantage of the beautiful rooftop and helpful staff of the hotel. Emmanuel and other staff members were hugely helpful to us. (Thank you!) So to sum it up, the apartments aren't as nice as the hotel, but they're clean and in a great location of the city. Grab a bottle of wine and head up to the rooftop- the view is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: connecticutraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Rome Sept 4-7. The hotel arranged for a car to meet us at the airport. (Don't drive in Rome :) We loved the location of the hotel. The hotel is just minutes from Piazza Navona, Trevi fountain, the bus line and all other must see attractions in Rome. In Piazza Campo de Fiori there is a bustling open air market early in the morning, and large crowds going to the many great places to eat every evening outside in the square, we were a little concerned about noise. But when we were in our room (101) we NEVER heard anything from outside and slept great. The air conditioning works very well. (we had a heat wave during our stay)Our room was more than enough space for the 2 of us and the bathroom was modern and clean. The building has alot of history as well. Ask at the desk. The breakfast was great, with many cereals, fruit, meat and cheese and is included in your room rate. The terrace on the top of the building is a great place to relax and enjoy the spectacular view night or day. The staff at the front desk are ready and willing to help with any concerns or questions. We found them very friendly to a person.They speak excellent English. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome. Good value for your money We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and our stay at the Hotel Campo De Fiori was very nice. It was a great location, close to local transportation too. Our room was not large but very comfortable and certainly big enough for the two of us. The bathroom was average size and very clean. We enjoyed the rooftop terrace in the evening to watch the sun set or enjoy a cocktail. The breakfast was good and we could either eat in the inside dining room or outside with a view. Every morning in the square around the corner was a farmer's market which was fun with lots of good fruits and vegetables. The staff was friendly and helpful. Thanks to all of them and especially Olga who was the best ever. We will definitely stay here again next time we're in Rome. Fred and Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Earsby
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to the Campo Di Fiori square which is great for eaitng out or going for a quiet drink. Its also slap bang in the middle of the city, all major attractions are within walking distance. The staff were very good, and the roof terrace is great for watching the sun go down over picturesque Rome. The breakfast was basic, but very edible. Great hotel if you're visiting Rome for a couple of days and want to be close to the stuff you want to see. See attached photo of view from roof terrace...

Reviews.Title: “The One for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Angelkrew
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located hotel with friendly staff. The whole hotel has been recently refurbished to a high standard - lots of old world charm with a modern finish. There is a roof terrace with superb views, the continental breakfast was very good. We really couldn't fault this hotel and found it excellent value for money. If we were to return to Rome, and we did throw coins in the trevi! then this would be our hotel of choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Hotel Campo de' Fiori !!!”
Reviews.Author: rajiv_mitra
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much for your hospitality while we stayed with you during Aug 1 - 4, 2008. My wiffe and I were extremely pleased with the hospitable staff, general cleanliness, quiet rooms, delicious breakfast and all. The overall experience at your hotel was very good and this made Rome even better for us. We would look forward to coming back to Rome to stay in the Hotel Campo de' Fiori. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Camp glamour”
Reviews.Author: lifeissublime
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - very camp and gilted. Small rooms but big enough. Our room had a balcony (a superior room) which was great. It also has a roof terrace. Very noisy though as its just off the Campo di Fiori but great if you want to go out. Staff were very helpful and nice. All spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect lcoation”
Reviews.Author: CDKOntario
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a very convenient location. I would not however recommend the apartments owned by this hotel. Be sure to request the 'hotel' location. The hotel is nicely decorated and very clean with a roof top terrace and lovely breakfast room in the basement. It is steps away from the piazza Campo De' Fiori where there are nice shops, restaurants and daily market Monday to Saturday. This seems to be where the night life happens as well. Most attractions in Rome are a relatively short distance away. The helpful staff is on duty at the front desk 24 hours/day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Getgerald
Reviews.Content: We staid for 2 nights in the Appartment No 8. When I checked in, I mentioned one of the earlier reviews where the writer complained about the scaffolding and extreme noise. The check in person was very apologetic and just felt bad about it. Ok, we had more look. It was a tiny, cozy appartment, directly accessible from the Campo. Great location ! After climbing all the stairs to the top floor, we get into the appartment and loved it. Nice bedrooom (not facing the Campo), small kitchen and a small extra room with a sofa/table. Oh, of course also a bathroom where we had to get used to the shower but that was ok, remembering that we paid 120 Euro/night. Rome at that point of time was a steaming oven with temparatures above 30 degrees Celsius, not really cooling off during the nights. As a consequence we slept with an open window and were only disturbed by the wailing of an old woman during the 2nd night. There is a small aircondition in the appartment (really small) and a ventilator which could help to drop the temparatur by one or two deegrees. Having said this, the location is just great and this is now my 3rd in the Campo de' Fiori. I can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mersea_girl
Reviews.Content: Great position, comfortable rooms and lovely roof terrace. Very friendly, helpful staff. It was more expensive than we usually pay but was worth the money. We'd love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: reneevero
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect, lively location. The hotel itself is nicely decorated and has a spectacular roof deck where you can see all of Rome. The rooms and breakfast area were very clean and the staff was super helpful and spoke both Italian and perfect English. Even though the area was packed and fun at night the hotel seemed to be soundproof. I highly recommend this hotel. It is within walking distance to every major tourist site and close to a major bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility and great location, but....”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic14u
Reviews.Content: I just spent two days at the Hotel Camp De' Fiori in Rome, which enjoys an absolutely ideal location around the corner from Campo de' Fiori, providing easy access to Rome's many delights. The hotel itself is beautiful in a cozy way, and the room I had was a nice mixture of modern conveniences (flat screen TV) and elegant furnishings. My only quibble is my check-in experience. Having booked a room in advance, I was told when I arrived that only an apartment was available. The apartment I was taken to was on the other side of the square, on the third floor of the building with no elevator, and lacking a telephone-- far inferior to the hotel rooms. I was able to wangle my way back into the hotel, but only after repeated insistence. If you go, try to deal with Tommy, who not only engineered my room in the hotel, but helped me with restaurant reservations and gave great advice on where and when to go to different places, all with good humor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tcumatt2005
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic among the best I have stayed in, especially for Europe. Very friendly staff, comfortable beds, "lift," contemporary decor and a rooftop terrace with unbeatable views of Rome. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Final Fun”
Reviews.Author: loveaffair
Reviews.Content: The final leg of our journey beginning in Nice, France was a night spent at Hotel Campo de Fiori. We had been on a cruise along the coast of Italy on a luxury ship. But we longed for the charm, romance, chaos, and wonderful food of Rome. We arrived early, and our room was ready! This meant we could safely store our bags and head out into the city for some AM sightseeing (everything is in easy walking distance.) We had time to sightsee, have a cafe lunch, and return to our room for siesta before heading out again for late afternoon walking and sightseeing and dinner in the Jewish Ghetto. We strolled back to the hotel in time to join the parties in the nearby piazza. The roof deck is outstanding. The hotel's Italian styling and design feature charming accents everywhere. Our room was small, but romantic. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Not sure if there's AC - but it would be hot during the summer if there isn't. The next morning the piazza was alive with market set ups. Truly a Roman experience!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrentwoodVictoria
Reviews.Content: Having got ripped off yet a second time by a Rome taxi driver at the train station, we were not in a great mood when we finally walked the last block to the hotel. Everything changed from the moment we went in. The soothing jazz, the extremely helpful and concerned staff (particularly Tommy from Montreal and Mateo from New Jersey) put us completely at ease. The room was elegant and spacious by European standards, the bathroom predictably small but very elegant and functional. Our room overlooked a busy square but was completely quiet and a cool haven from the outside bustle. The only possible negative would be a less than satisfactory breakfast to North Americans. The hotel is perfectly located within walking distance to everything. The Campo de Fiori square is interesting and lively. The helpful staff recommended great restaurants (like Pier Luigi) within walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel for its value and comfort! (By the way, if you are going to Rome or any other major Italian city e-mail: info@romalimoservice.it and have Stefano pick you up or take you to the airport in his new Mercedes for 45 Euros--it saves a horrible train trip and taxi ride and is much better value!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically Friendly!!!”
Reviews.Author: parkesandgamby
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through a Time Out city guide and did our research on tripadvisor beforehand. We got there to find a fantastic little hotel off the bustling Campo De' Fiori - a real locals sqaure with a food market and plenty of restaurants and bars. Not only were the staff friendly and informative - they even took time when it was busy to point out all of the main tourist attractions on a map, which they then gave to us. The hotel's best feature is a fantastic roof terrace with plenty of comfy seating and great views of the city. You're a short walk from Trastevere for dinner and St Peter's Basilica, along with the shops and other major tourist attractions. The friendly staff even offer to open your wine and provide you with glasses to go and sit on the terrace in the evening. The hotel decor is rich and flamboyant and even the modest room we had was clean with real boutique touches in the bathroom! We would reccommend this hotel and this location to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SergeKnowlton
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campo de' Fiori is such a lovely, calm oasis with the most helpful and cheerful staff. Our room was beautiful, peaceful and had everything we needed. We have stayed in 5* hotels but this one is best. It is an excellent and dreamful hotel in a very strategic and marvelous position : in the center of Rome, just few steps from Campo de' Fiori, Pantheon or Navona square... Finally, and most importantly, I cannot even express how fantastic the hotel staff was-- to arrange for a car to pick us up and take us to the airport, to help to organize our trip to Sorrento. You can stop your relentless search for the perfect Hotel in Rome right now. This is the one. Serge

Reviews.Title: “The Highlight of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gizelle_Johnson
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of Rome were a disappointment. As with any large city it can be overwhelming at first and upon our late arrival we were immediately pounced on by unpleasant taxi drivers who assured us their fee would be much the same as the train journey we had planned on taking. They ushered us over to their taxi rank desk who also assured us that they offered a good price. We were tired and anxious to get to the hotel. The whole journey was unpleasant and pushey and we were shortchanged by several Euro and the cab journey was a total rip off. Never go to Rome and accept a lift from the men that wait at the airport exit. Our entrance into the Hotel Campo d'Fiori however was quite the reverse. A clean and comfortable room, a little on the small side, but very warm and nicely decorated. A modern and more than functional bathroom, in which you could even listen to the radio. The roof terrace offered excellent views over the City. The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and smiley at all times and the breakfast and vaulted chamber in which it was served was great. Rome is not cheap and this hotel was not particularly cheap. However, we managed to get an acceptable deal and it was centrally placed so you could walk everywhere easily...from the Vatican to the Spanish Steps to the Roman areas all made pleasant walking. And of course the Campo d'Fiori itself is a beautiful and lively square. My favourite area was the ghetto area and Trastavere, both of which were walkable and had a number of lovely restaurants. A bit further out close to Trastavere we had a lovely meal at a restaurant called "Antico Arco". If I returned to Rome, I would definitely stay at the Hotel Campo d'Fiori again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and great location”
Reviews.Author: nirvana27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the heart of it all. 5 minute walk to Piazza Navona and then keep walking another 3 min to the Pantheon. in an other direction 3 min to the cat sanctuary, then stroll along to the Victorio de Emanuel (sorry for spelling), the Roman forum, Collesseum. A direct walk from the hotel to the Collesseum is about 20-25 minutes. The spanish steps are about 15 min north, the vatican was about 15 min over the bridge. The hotel is beside a square that contains a fruit market by day and then the little restaurants open up by night. There are lots of ice cream shops, internet, and little stores in the streets off the square. Its a great atmosphere. The hotel rooms were fabulously updates and very romantic. the beds were comphy and the bathroom modern. There is a nice size closet, mini fridge and safe. The roof top terrace is great. there are couches and chairs to sit on to admire the views and take in the sun. The hotel staff were all friendly and accomodating. Breakfast is located in another greatly decorated room in the basement and had a good assortment of foods. We would definatly stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - Shame about the day staff”
Reviews.Author: NoolsLondon
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel in Oct 07 and had some problems. The first regarded taxis to be booked to the airport on our departure. The lady on reception accused us ordering a cab to De Vinci when infact we had asked her to book for Campiano. There was such an issue made about this and she just kept accusing us of being wrong, instead of just ordering an another cab. When another cab eventually arrived yet again (in italian)she went on to tell the driver it was our fault, it was actually getting embaressing at this stage. We also found the staff there to be quite abrupt, but put this down to a language barrier. There are no facilties in the rooms for tea/coffe etc. so we had takeaway coffees and we assumed it would be OK to have these in our room, yet again this was frowned upon. However we foolishly booked again to stay here in March as the location of the Hotel is excellent. We will never stay here again. After paying nearly 800 euros for a four night stay we were called to the desk. The same lady who we had the issue with during our previous stay proceeded to tell us that the room we we had been staying in was non smoking. We did smoke in this room as there were ashtrays in the room and no-one had told us otherwise. We then asked why were we not informed it was non smoking and she then said that we could actually smoke in the room but we should have opened the window. We HAD the windows constantly open as the room was unbearably hot and also had a strange smell. We were indeed going to ask reception about this at the beginning of our stay but just thought we would let it go. Yet again this converstaion turned into a major issue were she made us feel like school children and yet again as guests we were shown no respect whatsoever. The day staff here really need to lighten up abit. They believe they are right no matter what the circumstance. It is such a shame as the hotel is really nice and the location is great, which is why we did not mind paying the extra money. They also really need to have more facilities in the rooms if they are going to frown upon a takeaway coffee being brought to the room. The staff who were working in the evening/night shifts were lovely, and helpful at all times. If you are a young couple who would like to sample the nightlife in Rome - do not stay here. The should have a curfew at the door as it is honestly like going away and staying with your parents. By the way we are in our early thirties.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (adequate apartments), fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Brent010
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a boutique hotel in the heart of Old Rome, strongly consider this hotel. Recent updates to the hotel create an inviting lobby, a cozy downstairs library / breakfast area and an unbelievable tri-level rooftop terrace. We wished the evening weather would have been warmer (in February) to allow us to enjoy a bottle of wine on the rooftop with it's 360 degree view of the city. In the evening, the square bustles with a younger crowd, so anticipate late evening revelry. The din from the farmers market that sets up early on Saturdays in the square may not allow for sleeping in, but if you're here to tour the sights - who needs to sleep in? We were very happy with the staff that checked us in (and out) - they were friendly and informative (and spoke fluent English for those intimidated with foreign language). Our only dismay was that our booking (discounted, last minute) through Expedia set us up in one of the apartments which was not connected to the hotel (ours was within 100 yds). Our apartment had not seen the same updates as the hotel, but was perfectly functional and adequate considering the rate it was booked for. The apartment was clean, had a full kitchen and was well tended to by housekeeping every day. Opt for the rooms in the hotel when booking, but also consider apartments so long as your getting a discounted rate (or if everything else around is booked...).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely the Hotel Campo”
Reviews.Author: nicManchester
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days in Rome, staying at the Hotel Campo de Fiori in Campo de Fiori. Some of the reviews worried me slightly so i thought that my review may help put other visitors minds at rest. The hotel is very central, just off a lovely square with bars and restaurants and walking distance to most sights. Our room was the cheapest double and it was lovely - warm, beautifully decorated with a brand new bathroom and flat screen tv. The maid came in to clean everyday about 11am and there was no shortage of towels or toilet roll! The staff were very friendly and recommended some good restaurants to us, booked taxis, lent us umbrellas etc. The breakfast was served in a beautiful basement room. It was small - juice, rolls, cheese, ham and jams but this is what i would expect in Europe. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic place”
Reviews.Author: docmod65
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in a very strategic position!!!Highly recommended!!!What a Romantic view from the upper terrace!!! I will surely come back there.

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: hglahn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous trip to Rome. Hotel Campo De Fiori had been recommended to us and I would go back and stay there in a heart beat. The location is absolutely perfect, the rooms are cozy with brand new bathrooms, service is friendly, the breakfast room is lovely and there is a cute roof garden with great views of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: consuelasoarney
