Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located for site seeing while offering a quiet ,comfortable night for rest. The price was excellent too. Our room was quietly located on the 5th floor, and while offering ultra modern conveniences still managed to evoke an old world charm. The bathrrom and bedroom were spacious by Rome standards and even included a large closet. The bed was the most comfortable of the four hotels we stayed in during our trip. We even "splurged" one night in Rome on a more lavish 5-star hotel and found myself wishing we had stayed put. The rooftop terrace offers breaktaking panoramic views of the city and is beautifully decorated. The morning market in the Piazza Campo De Fiori must not be missed! The only minor drawback is the breakfast---while adequate, does not offer the variety of the other hotels we stayed at. The coffee was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again if I am ever in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trip75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Campo De' Fiori in November, 2007. We loved the location and the friendly staff. The rooms were reasonably priced and had a great view from the terrace. Breakfast was included daily. The rooms had modern conveniences yet the hotel had a very quaint feel. I highly recommend this hotel and this area for your next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Apartments!”
Reviews.Author: cleveland4eva
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments at the end of November 2007. The apartment was directly over a club, and it sounded like the music was being piped directly into the apartment until after 2am. It was ridiculous (not to mention the fact that there was only enough hot water for two people to shower). When we complained to the front desk, they completely brushed us off and said that this is Rome and you have to expect "city noise". All of the people staying in the apartment (four people in our early 30s) live in big cities (NYC, Chicago, Boston) and are used to a reasonable amount of noise, but this was intolerable. Although the manager of the hotel was more polite than the people at the front desk, he didn't move us to a better location or offer us any discount on the price. For our second night, they assured us that there would be no music that night (how does a club not play music on a Saturday night!). Although it was definitely quieter, it was still way too loud for the amount that we were paying per night. For our last night, we stayed in the hotel which was extremely nice, especially for the price. At that point, however, it was too late to change our impression of the hotel/apartments as a whole. Trust me, I am not a picky person...do not stay in the apartments! The hotel is nice and in a good location, but I would advise staying at a different place in Campo de Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougeLSS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Thanksgiving week 2007 in Rome. After much research, I decided to stay in the Campo De' Fiori area of Rome for the central location, young crowd, marketplace, and nightlife. We could not have asked for a better experience. I booked the hotel via the hotel website, which made me nervous at first. I filled out the form online and then was asked to email my credit card number (or I could have called with it as well). The stay was booked, and we were given a rate slightly lower than the published rate. In travelling to Europe in the past, I know what to except from European hotels- small rooms, outdated/simple bathrooms, and modest facilities. Hotel Campo De' Fiori has obviously been recently remodeled - everything was new and clean. The room was perfect, with a flat screen TV, fridge, AMAZING bathroom (by European hotel standards at least), and dependable maid service. The staff was friendly and helpful, even arranging for a private car service to take us to the airport (which was cheaper than the taxi ride). Though the hotel was great, the best part was the location. Campo De' Fiori was central to all the sights with the marketplace during the day, and plenty of nightlife - plenty of bars and restaurants with outdoor seating, cheap wine, and good company.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful September Wedding Experience”
Reviews.Author: gracedChicago
Reviews.Content: When planning my Rome wedding I visited several hotels for my guests. Hotel Campo De Fiori stood out to me for cleanliness, friendliness of staff, modernity and location. I could not have made a better choice. My 10 guests were extremely pleased with their updated rooms and service. The front desk staff was always helpful with restaurant recommendations and reservations, and even saw to it that my family made it off to planned day and weekend trips to other locations. Other guests easliy walked to all the major Rome attractions thanks to the great location. And even bought souveniers and fresh food goods at the daily morning market around the corner. The hotel also offers a wonderful 2-level furnished rooftop deck which made for cozy nights with friends and bottles of wine and a SPECTACULAR view. I stayed myself in one of the upstairs "suites" before and after the wedding - and although it was small, it was tidy and nicely decorated with it's own private terrace. The night of my wedding we returned to the Hotel to find flowers and champagne although we had not asked for it. What a delight! My family and friends will always give this Hotel our business for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: ochy82
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Campo de Fiori is in a great location, just off the Campo de Fiori square which has a great and very picturesque market. It's walkable from all the main sights. The rooms are wonderful, all dripping chandeliers and gold gilted mirrors, and the bathroom was opulence all the way. The breakfast wasn't great but served til 10.15 which was great for us! If you stay here, try Sloppy Sam's on the square for drinks - very cosy and a nice bottle of wine for 13 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Campo De' Fiori was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: mdwhlw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. It was very clean and had a pleasant and helpful staff. We especially loved the location. We were able to walk to all the major sites. We would highly recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the "apartments"”
Reviews.Author: mishywishy
Reviews.Content: While the hotel itself seems lovely, we were booked by the reservation staff to stay in their "big, beautiful apartments" across from the hotel. The website calls them "silent and elegant." They were terrible. My parents were in an apartment across from a restaurant with windows on the square. Their door was covered in graffiti and there was broken glass and trash in front accompanied by a very strong smell of urine. When I asked the front desk staff to have this cleaned up, they replied "There is nothing we can do, this is Rome." This apartment was clean, but dark, very loud and very dated. When the electricity went out one night, my 65 year old mother went to the hotel to tell them. Their response was a stoic "Just push the button." Our apartment was disgusting. The walls were stained with watermarks; the bathroom was virtually unusable with mold all over the "shower" floor, and the furnishings were extremely dated. Worst of all, the apartment was also directly above a lively restaurant with outdoor seating making it impossible to sleep until after closing time and very loud upstairs neighbors. When we complained to the staff, they ignored us. Not one person was helpful, accommodating or understanding. Our complaints were virtually ignored.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful And Stylish”
Reviews.Author: fisherman5
Reviews.Content: This was a delightful hotel. The rooms although not large, were decorated with great style. On the first visit the room was a deep red with a gold bedspread and curtains. On the second visit the room was a deep azure blue. I felt like I was living in a Renaissance painting. The bathrooms were all very modern with the latest of Italian fittings and the shuttered double glazed windows gave silence at night. The staff at Reception and Breakfast Room were most helpful,--all spoke fluent English. The position of the hotel on the edge of the Campo was ideal with the Colosseum, the Spanish Steps all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Val15
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Rome and stayed in one of Hotel De' Fiori's apartment on the Piaza Campo De' Fiori. The apartment itself was perfect in its location, cleanliness, size, utensils & coffee, tea & salt provided and layout. We took advantage of the apartment's proximity to the bakery, grocery store, and vegetable market daily for snacks and breakfast. Most evenings, we went out to restaurants with the exception of one evening when we had wine, cheese, Prosciutto and bread on the hotel's rooftop terrace. Like many before us, we enjoyed each evening on the rooftop terrace for a glimpse of the sunset with a glass of wine or a view of Rome at night. It was one of our favourite things to do during our visit. We would highly recommend arranging with the hotel for transportation to and from the airport. It made our arrival and departure effortless in every sense. The staff at the hotel were very accommodating, polite and fun. We were pleased to meet each of them and were sad to say goodbye when it came that time. We have recommended the hotel to several friends upon our return to reality and have also communicated with our travel agent, thanking her for the excellent recommendation and booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: AugustusX1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel Campo de Fiori and first time in Rome. Bit worried from some previous reviews and we had booked direct but all fears dispelled. We had a wonderful stay, both in the city and at the hotel. Get the impression that there must be a HUGE difference pre and post renovation. Lift, though small, was fine and quick. Room was quite small but perfectly adequate. Air conditioning good. Dark and quiet at night (except Sat with window open!) Bathroom with great shower was super including piped TV sound. Plasma TV with around 8 channels (mostly Italian, obviously). Very comfortable beds with proper soft pillows. Fridge and safe. Breakfast, in quaint basement room, was 'Continental' and good, coffee great. Staff seemed helpful and pleasant - our two booked taxis arrived promptly. Tri-level roof terrace is a winning feature with fab views and location is superb - all sites walkable, lovely sidestreets all around and plenty of good eateries. Couldn't recommend more highly from our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: heather_p23
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest place to stay in Rome but the standard was excellent. Helpful, friendly staff, an amazing roof terrace with big squashy sofas where you can take your own wine and rooms with plasma screen TVs. Breakfast was average and our 'window' wasn't great, but only minor gripes. This really is a lovely boutique hotel. The excellent location also means its difficult to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoChristine
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. My husband and I and another couple stayed for 4 days at the end of August and it was amazing! It's location on a quiet street just off a lively square and in the middle of everything is perfect. The rooms were recently renovated and are great with plasma TVs, beautiful baths and ours even had a small terrace. With the terrace doors shut, I did not hear anything from any other room or the street during our entire stay. The service was fantastic. As many restaurants are closed in August and on Sundays, wonderful Franco at the front desk helped us by calling around and suggesting great restaurants (Ad Hoc was our favorite!). The best part, however, is the rooftop deck. This can not be emphasized enough. It was fantastic. The four of us would pound the pavement everyday seeing the sights in this beautiful bustling city and return to relax, drink a glass of wine, discuss the day and watch the sunset high above everything. Don't book another hotel. You'd be crazy not to stay at Hotel Campo De Fiori!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: remus128
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was very good, central, clean, very friendly staff. Fantastic rooms and good views from roof terrace. Would recommend - I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mondor
Reviews.Content: Go for a room at the top with balcony. The location could not be better- Great view of Rome from the roof terrace. Almost everything of interest in Rome can be reached by foot and there are countless restaurants in the neighbourhood. Small, but cosy rooms and very friendly staff. Prices are on the expensive side but we did not regret our choice!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the heart of Bustling Campo de Fiori”
Reviews.Author: parterre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming boutique hotel for three nights in September and loved everything about it. The hotel has been recently refurbished and is tastefully decorated in a classic but modernized style. The atmosphere of the hotel and rooms is romantic and fresh with the unobtrusive addition of high tech amenities. Bathrooms were modern and clean, in fact the entire hotel was immaculate. The staff was friendly and willing to be of service in any way possible. The crowning jewel of the hotel for us was the tri-level rooftop terrace that affords a 360 degree view of the surrounding city. Complete with all weather wicker furniture and cafe tables it offered a great place to recharge or wind down. I would highly recommend this hotel and only hope that we can return sometime in the not so distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tobie75
Reviews.Content: This hotel has made my first time in Rome very special. I definitely will be coming back. One person in particular made me feel very welcome and went out of his way to help. Brilliant service.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of our 5-week, 6-country holiday.”
Reviews.Author: DocStanbro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best part of our vacation! Clean, modern, with responsive staff, the hotel was fantastic. It is centrally located to all the best sites of Rome: Trevi, Colosseum, Imperiali, Campidoglio, Navona, Pantheon, Archs of Constantine, Giano and Tito, the Mouth of Truth at Saint Maria's, Piazza Garibaldi, Spanish Steps, Villa Medici, Piazza del Popolo and Castle Sant Angelo. We walked everywhere, and were never more than 15 minutes from some amazing, incredible site. Loved the hotel, loved the city. The hotel's patio rooftop provides a stunning view of Rome, and watching the sun set and the lights come up over Saint Peter's is worth the trip to Rome and a stay in this hotel. When we needed help, the staff called a cab, provided bus schedules, and made reservations at restaurants and two museums. Cafes and restaurants, sidewalk performers (singing, music, mime, dancing, juggling) are litterally 15 feet from the hotel's front door. It was the best hotel experience in 5 weeks and 6 countries. We'll definitely book this hotel next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Europe that I have stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: cberling
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the one bad review below was not actually staying in the hotel....I'm not sure what apartments they are talking about. Their description doesn't even sound like this hotel. Maybe they are owned by the hotel? Hotel Campo de Fiori: Simply the best hotel I have stayed in in Europe thus far. It is in a great location, beautiful furnishings, very updated and the staff were very helpful. When my husband and I walked into our room, we immediately awwed at how nice it was. Dark wood furnishings, super comfortable bed with a nicer duvet and curtains than we own! The flat screen tv was inlaid into a huge fram on the wall and had music to select. We walked into the marble and tile bathroom to realize that there was a speaker in the bathroom too! So you can listen to anything from Bob Marley, Classical, Pop, or Italian while taking a shower or brushing your teeth. The hotel also offers a European style breakfast that won't excite you if you are an American but that is expected. The hotel also has a roof top terrace which you can see most of Rome and St. Peter's basilica (which we got some fantastic sunset pictures from up there). We spent our last night drinking wine on the terrace, watching the sunset and listening to the music drifting up from the Piazza next to the hotel. Simply perfect. I will never stay anywhere else when I go back to Rome...and you shouldn't either!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Campo Dei Fiori is Great!”
Reviews.Author: CMSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I am a long time customer of this hotel and have stayed here many times over the past 10 years. I have also stayed in their apartments which are also very nice and well located. The rooms are nicely furnished, clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly , knowledgeable and helpful and make you feel very welcome. The location is perfectly situated in Campo dei Fiori and is a close walking distance to most sights. It also has many great food shops, restaurants and bars nearby. The view from the terrace on the top of the hotel is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Campo de Fiori”
Reviews.Author: jkfarrel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and spending 4 nights at the Hotel Campo De Fiori. The hotel and central location could not have been better. The hotel has just been completly renovated and the rooms are great with terrific air conditioning, modernized bathrooms with excellent showers, comfortable bed, and unique decor. The large roof top terrace on the 6th floor has a spectacular view of the dome of St Peters Basilica and all of Rome. and there is nothing better than taking a bottle of wine up there and watching the sun set. The breakfast room on the lower level is decorated with antiques and is a great way to start your day before heading out to do some sightseeing. Located in the Campo De Fiori piazza area there are plenty of bars, restuarants, shops, etc to keep you busy. Also most sights you would want to see are just a short walk or an easy bus ride away. Franco and his staff will be happy to guide you anywhere. I just want to say when I return to Rome, soon, I will be staying at the Hotel Campo De Fiori and can not wait to be greated by Franco, Andreas, Angelo, & Michael. Make it easy on yourself and stay at a fantastic Italian hotel.. Contact them @ hotelcampodefiori.com PS... The best pizza place in Italy, Baffetto "2" is just around the corner. Say HI to Anna for me.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, great location”
Reviews.Author: OJGS
Reviews.Content: We recently had 2 nights in Rome and the location of this hotel really coudn't be better. The busy square is virtually just outside the door and most attractions are in walking distance. The recent refurbishment is very stylish with a modern edge to the old world charm, combining items such as chandeliers, purple walls and silk curtains. Sounds strange but it works! The rooms are small, but have everything you need including flat screen TV, ours had a tiny balcony overlooking the roof tops of the old city. The small bathroom was very modern with an excellent shower. Although looking incomplete (like empty window boxes) the roof top terrace offers magnificent views over the city. The staff are efficent, but perhaps a little smug, and the breakfast is not really worth turning up for! We would stay there again, but perhaps try to negotiate a rate that didn't include breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - stay away from apartment”
Reviews.Author: Georgiatransplant
Reviews.Content: Rome was our last stop in Italy, and this hotel our worst accommodation. We had reserved an apartment which turned out to be right off the piazza. After traversing a dark corridor with a rusty moped parked inside, we arrived at our second-story rooms. One bedroom (with a strange cot attached to a chair) was right over the square, with preparations for market starting at 5 am. Although clean, the furnishings were sparse - the "courtyard patio" consisted of a rickety plastic table and a cut-off garden hose on a sink faucet. The hotel staff treated us as an ugly stepchild, with no maid service, no breakfast, and no help w/our luggage - all this for 200 euros a night. There was no airconditioning, but they did provide us with another fan so we could attempt to cool the place. Fortunately, we were so tired at days' end, we did sleep. The hotel looked nice, but we never made it past the lobby. When checking out, we informed them of leakage around the toilet, and they didn't particularly seem concerned - almost as if we had done something. The location was great - walking to many sites was easily accomplished, and the piazza is charming. Stay nearby, but not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but by no means bad!”
Reviews.Author: WinnieEurope
Reviews.Content: On the 1st December, myself and my partner went to Rome for 3 days and stayed at this hotel. Eventually they found our booking and off we went - they didn't inform us about breakfast or anything - but we weren't bothered to be honest - you don't really go to Rome to stay in the hotel! The place was being renovated - but there was a (very tiny!) working lift. Our room was dark blue (makes it seem smaller) and designed cave-like. Very small en-suite off the room and a wardrobe. The en-suite although tiny was totally clean and plenty of towels available. The shower was a rain shower - totally fab. There was a flat screen plasma on the wall and internet was available. There was also a working saferty deposit box in the wardrobe. Never saw a roof garden. Breakfast was across the road in a cafe, croissants, coffee; very simple and you pay with a voucher the hotel gives you. It wasn't noisy at night at all, but we were situated in the middle of the building - looking out in to another room across the courtyard! (not really a courtyard - just a small area, not for customers) It is a grand place to stay, no hassle and really good location for all the sights. The room I stayed in, may have been a bit small for some - but as I said, you don't go to Rome to stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: lulaby.net
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room just for one night. Most of all we expected to be confortable and nicely treated. We made the reservation directly whit the hotel but when we arrived they had an overbooking. They give us a room with just a bed and a toilett as all services but they made us a big discount: 10 euros from the price of the "apartment" (an old, small room, unconfortable bed, cold with just one jurassic heater). On the top of it, they were rude and reluctant to give us the voucher for the breakfast. DO NOT GO, for sure you deserve a better stay in Rome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big room and central location”
Reviews.Author: cincomomo
Reviews.Content: We had a nice big room for our family of 4, with a queen and two single beds. One single bed was actually in it own little enclave (not quite a room) near the bathroom. It's not luxurious, but cheaper than most hotels in the area. You are within walking distance to many central tourist sites in Rome. We were on the 3rd floor.. and there's no elevator! This is a negative if you have lots of luggage/shopping bags. No bell boy to carry your bags either. Also the hallways are a little dark. Breakfast was decent. Fresh cappucinos, warm rolls with pate, jams, and nutella. Also, resh yogurt, cereals, juice. The staff was nice but not super accomodating.THere are bars nearby so it can be noisy at night. Budget and location is their main draw, dont' expect to be wined and dined.

Reviews.Title: “Such a ripoff”
Reviews.Author: Papagono
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel Campo de Fiori some years ago, shortly before it closed its doors to be modernized with new bathrooms and a more modern decor. The old hotel before the modernization was a wonderful and charming European style hotel with a very friendly staff, good rates and a wonderful roof garden. When we decided to go to Rome in December 2006, there was no doubt in our minds that we should stay at Hotel Campo De Fiori. The rates had more than doubled since we stayed there the last time, but that was OK because we expected improvements. When we arrived, we soon discovered that the renovation process was still very much going on. The much advertised roof garden was closed, and the breakfast restaurant wasn’t finished either. The room was nice enough, but the included breakfast had to be consumed in an unheated and not very clean snack bar across the street. We complained to the service desk, and after much discussion we were sourly offered a 10% discount. The staff was rude, and we were ripped off. We did not want to change hotel, because we were only in Rome for a few days, and we did not want to waste time by moving around. But you should make sure that the roof garden and the breakfast restaurant is finished before making a reservation. The hotel is very nicely situated, but the staff is rude and there are so many better places to stay in Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Campo De' Fiori
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Biscione, 6, 00186 Rome, Italy
